loans.name: Uch

texts.en:
Cultivating rice is part of 47-year-old Uch H.’s daily routine. Rice is an essential product, vital to Cambodian people. She learned to cultivate rice from her grandmother and she has been very widely known in this sector since she was single. She has since divorced her husband.

Uch H. never wastes time. She works hard everyday in order to generate a daily income to ensure her children will attend the highest level of education. Two of her children are employed and have provided their income to support their family's food needs a little more.

Uch H. will be using her loan to buy piglets to raise for additional profit. With the remainder of loan she will buy fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Natividad Ninfa

texts.es: La señora Ninfa se encuentra en su tercera secuencia de su crédito individual demostrando en todo momento ser una persona emprendedora con ganas de superación.  La actividad económica que realiza es la venta de Choripan y hot dog en la puerta de domicilio ubicada en la Av. Buenos Aires. Doña Ninfa vive en casa de su suegra pero de manera independiente comparte la vivienda con sus dos pequeños hijos y con Omar su esposo el cual se dedica a la confección de chamarras de polar.   El destino del crédito es precisamente para la compra de materia prima de la confección de chamarras.
texts.en:
Ninfa is currently in her third series of individual loans, demonstrating that she continues to be an enterprising person with a strong desire to improve her life. She works selling hot dogs and chorizo sandwiches from the door of her home, located on Buenos Aires Avenue. The home belongs to Ninfa's mother-in-law, but she and her family -- her husband Omar and their two small children -- share it in an independent manner. Omar's work is manufacturing fleece jackets. The purpose of the loan is to purchase the necessary raw materials for these jackets.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in the purchase of inputs and raw materials for her husband's business

loans.name: Tsend-Ayush

texts.en: Tsend-Ayush is 49 years old and lives with her husband and two children in the Zavkhan province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her youngest daughter attends university and her husband is a taxi driver who helps Tsend-Ayush with her business in his spare time. Tsend-Ayush is a seamstress who specializes in traditional Mongolian clothes such as deels, or long coats. While people in larger towns and cities in Mongolia wear western style clothing, those in smaller provinces and sums wear more traditional Mongolian clothing. She has been operating her sewing business for 11 years and in that length of time she has gained a lot of business knowledge and experience. Tsend-Ayush dreams of one day owning in her own house where her family can live comfortably. She is requesting a 400,000 tugrug (~280 USD) loan in order to purchase deel fabric, materials and needles for her sewing business.

loans.use: To purchase deel fabric, materials and needles for her sewing business.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: Daniel R. O.  de 34 años de edad vive en el departamento de La Libertad junto a su esposa y tres hijos de 16,13 y 4 años.  La esposa de Daniel trabaja de manera ambulante como comerciante para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, y Daniel por su parte tiene un negocio hace tres años en el mercado central es una venta de frutas y verduras, donde Daniel ofrece productos de excelente calidad y buenos precios, ahora el solicita de un crédito para comprar mayor cantidad de sus productos.
texts.en:
Daniel R. O. is 34 years old and lives in the department of La Libertad with his wife and their 3 children (ages 16, 13, and 4). Daniel’s wife works as a traveling merchant and helps with the household expenses. In turn, Daniel has a business in the central market selling fruits and vegetables. He has been in business for 3 years and offers high-quality products at good prices. The loan he is currently requesting will be used to by a large quantity of products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock his business

loans.name: Enitan

texts.en:
Enitan is 23 years old and single without children. She sells for long hours to ensure that there is food on her table to feed her aged parents. She is a hardworking girl and she is determined to excel in her business.

Enitan hopes to be a distributor of drinks in Lagos State, Nigeria. She hopes for a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Mao Tak Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Mao T. is a housewife. Her husband, Mr. N. Phal, is a traditional musician. H. also works in construction. Mrs. Mao T. is applying for a loan to buy duck eggs, beefsteak and other snacks to sell to earn more income for her family. SH. is 42 years old and tH. mother of five children: three are employed in a factory and tH. others are attending tH. local school. SH. is tH. village bank president who has been selected by tH. members. This village bank consists of twelve people who all live in Tonle Bati village in Takeo province.

loans.use: To buy duck eggs, beefsteak and other snacks to resell

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline C. is from the city of Caritan Norte Tug. She is 39 years old. Evangeline is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Evangeline owns and operates a business venture providing waste management services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating tricycle transport services. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Evangeline joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP, which will be used to pay for registration, franchise, and license fees. This loan will be the tenth loan taken out by Evangeline from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for registration, franchise and license fees

loans.name: Bolivar Group

texts.es:
“Bolívar ” es un grupo de 9 señoras y 1 varón que asisten a sus reuniones en el Centro Focal “Los Andes”,  se agruparon por  la necesidad de acceder al préstamo ya que todas necesitan incrementar su capital de trabajo, sobre todo en esta época de fin de año donde la demanda de productos se incrementa.
Ellas  tienen sus propios negocios como la venta de comida, tienda de barrio, venta de cosméticos, venta de mantas, venta de calzados, venta de yuca y confección de chamarras, esta es la segunda oportunidad que solicitan el préstamo a través del financiamiento de kiva.
texts.en:
"Bolivar" is a group of 9 women and one man who attend their meetings at "Los Andes" focal center. They came together in order to have access to financing since all of them need to increase their capital, especially this time of year when demand for products rises. They all have their own lines of work, such as: prepared meal sales, neighborhood grocery store, cosmetic sales, blanket sales, footwear sales, yucca (cassava, manioc) sales, jacket-making. This is their second loan opportunity though Kiva financing.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products.

loans.name: Yajauri

texts.es: Yajauri, es una mujer muy dinámica, vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, región Ucayali, tiene 28 años, madre de tres hijos, todos menores de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de comida, chupetes, hielo, gelatina y gaseosas, actividades que lo realiza en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien se dedica al oficio de ser chofer de un motocarro propio. Yajauri forma parte del Banco Comunal “Manos Maravillosas”, desde hace un año, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en la venta de gaseosas, ahora ella necesita 500 soles , que será invertido en la implementación de su venta de comida como cocina de carbón, platos, cubiertos y vasos. La meta de Yajauri es tener su propio negocio de abarrotes en general.
texts.en:
Yajauri, 28, is a very dynamic woman who lives in the Yarina Cocha district, Ucayali region. She has three minor children. She sells prepared meals, chupetes (popsicles), ice, gelatin desserts and soft-drinks from her home. Her husband, who is a mototaxi driver, supports her work efforts. Yajauri has been a member of the "Manos Maravillosas" communal bank for a year. Her first, 300 sol, loan was used to buy soft-drinks. Now, she needs 500 soles that will be used to equip her prepared meals sales business like: coal stove, dishes, cutlery, drinking glasses. Yajauri's goal is to have her own general store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To equip her meal preparation business.

loans.name: Asalmo

texts.en:
M. Asalmo is 30 years old. She is married and has three children. Asalmo sells clothes for women at the central city market. The location of her vending store is very favorable as it’s in a busy place. Asalmo has been in this trade for 5 years. She has proven to be an honest and communicative businesswoman. Asalmo is hoping to take a loan of 4000 Somoni to increase the variety of inventory in her store and to keep her business running successfully. This purchase will enable her to increase her sales, to earn more, and to meet the education expenses of her children. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing of the working capital with the purpose of business development.

loans.name: Norma Lucia

texts.es:
La señora Norma es socia del Banco Comunal “San Pedro” desde hace 3 años atrás, del distrito de Acora, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 43 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 02 hijos. Ella  estudio primaria completa, se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado.

Norma nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar un toro.

Su sueño para el futuro es aumentar sus ventas para así vivir mejor.

Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones que se realiza cada mes.
texts.en:
Norma has been a member of the “San Pedro” communal bank for 3 years. She is from the Acora district in the Puno province and department. She is 43 years old, a single mother and has 2 children. She has an elementary school education and buys and sells livestock for a living. Norma tells us that with the first loan she received from the Manuela Ramos Movement, of 300 PEN, she was able to increase her capital. She is asking for a loan of 1500 PEN so that she can buy a bull. Her dream for the future is to increase her sales so that she can have a better life. What she likes the most about her communal bank are the monthly meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY A BULL

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza C. is from the village of Malinao , Gingoog City. She is 23 years old. Analiza is married and has 2 infant-aged children. To make a living, Analiza owns & operates a motorcycle services business (know as habal habal) which her husband manages in the local community members. Analiza has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Analiza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Analiza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. Analiza is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Analiza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Edda María

texts.es: La señora Edda P. trabaja como Responsable de la Biblioteca Pública de Niquinohomo en el cual se gana un salario que le permite mantener a sus 2 hijos menores y así poder pagarle el estudio a uno de ellos, es madre soltera y con mucho esfuerzo a logrado sacarlos adelante, ella se acercó a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito y poder comprarles sus útiles escolares a su hija y el uniforme.
texts.en:
Edda P. works as the administrator of the Niquinohomo Public Library, where she earns a salary that allows her to support her 2 young children and also pay school fees for one of them. She is a single mother and through much effort she has been able to provide for her children. She approached Ceprodel to request a loan to buy her daughter’s school supplies and uniform.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase school supplies

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL “EL PROGRESO”

La alcancía comunal “EL PROGRESO” es un grupo autodenominado así porque sus miembros buscan sobresalir en lo que hacen y no quedarse atrás, es un grupo que ya lleva trabajando con EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD 3 años con 2 meses y es partícipe D. las actividades, charlas y capacitaciones que esta ofrece.

Cinty es presidenta del grupo “EL PROGRESO”, tiene una hija y vive con su pareja, ella se caracteriza por ser una presidenta muy joven, pues tiene 24 años D. edad, elegida por las demás socias por ser activa y tener mucho entusiasmo.

Ella se dedica a ser vendedora empleada en una mueblería, tiene varios meses trabajando en la venta D. muebles, y quiere poner su propio negocio D. venta D. muebles. Piensa usar su crédtio para comprar sillas, bancas, etc. para ya dedicarse a la venta directa para no estar trabajando en la mueblería sino D. forma independiente. Planea ahorrar para así estudiar “Visitadora médica”, pero por ahora los gastos que tiene en su casa superan sus ingresos, aunque también aporte su pareja.

Por ahora el mayor sueño D. Cinty es tener una casa propia así dejaría D. pagar un alquiler mensual.
texts.en:
The El Progreso Community Bank members chose this name because they are looking to get ahead in their jobs and not remain stuck in the past. The group has already worked with Kiva partner EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD for 3 years and 2 months and has participated in the activities, talks, and training that have been offered. Cinty is the president of the the El Progreso group. She has one daughter and lives with her partner. She seems a very young president, but she is 24 years old and was chosen by the other members because she is active and has a lot of enthusiasm. Cinty is a salesperson in a furniture shop. She's been doing this work for several months, and wants to open her own business selling furniture. She plans to use the loan to buy chairs and benches so that she can sell directly and independently to clients instead of working at the furniture shop. She is planning to save enough money to go back to school and become a distributor of medications (to local clinics). However, her current household expenses are more than her income even though her partner contributes too. For the time being Cindy's goal is to have a house of her own so she wouldn't have to pay rent.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chairs and benches to open a furniture sales business

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
La señora Maria Guadalupe E. tiene ya más de diez años dedicándose al comercio.
 A su negocio le está haciendo falta más variedad de mercancía, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder invertir y no descapitalizar si negocio. 
Es por eso que solicito un préstamo para comprar la mercancía y así tener más variedad de mercancía para vender. Ya que este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de su familia, ella y su esposo el señor Moisés Campos desea lo mejor para sus dos hijos. 
Planean pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias del negocio.
texts.en:
Maria Guadalupe E. has been a merchant for over 10 years. She needs to replace stock in her business but lacks the necessary funds to invest in merchandise without recapitalizing her business. Therefore, she is asking for funding to buy merchandise in order to have a wider variety of stock to sell. Because this business is her family’s sole source of income, she and her husband, Moisés Campos, wish the best for their two children. They plan to use part of the business’s profits to repay the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: EL SEÑOR CARLOS  ES UN CLIENTE QUE YA TRABAJO DOCE CREDITOS EN LA INSTITUCION, EN LOS ANTERIORES CREDITO DEMOSTRO RESPONSABILIDAD, EL SE DEDICA A DAR SERVICIO DE AMPLIFICACION EL TRABAJA EN  DIFERENTES ZONAS DE LA CIUDAD DE EL ALTO Y LA CIUDAD DE LA PAZ, TODAS SU MAQUINAS AMPLICADORAS LAS GUARDA EN SU MISMO DOMICILIO, SU PROPAGANDA LA REALIZA EN SU MISMO DOMICILIO, SU TRABAJO COMIENZA NORMALMENTE LOS FINES DE SEMANA DESDE EL DIA JUEVES HASTA EL DIA DOMINGO, SU AMPLICADORES VAN A FIESTAS DE MATRIMINIO, BAUTIZOS Y FIESTAS DE COLEGIOS, EL TRABAJO DEL SEÑOR CARLOS Q. ES UN POCO SACRIFICADO PORQUE EL TIENE QUE AMANECERSE PARA RECOGER SUS AMPLIFICADORES, EL TIENE TRES HIJOS  ELLOS ESTAN ESTUDIANDO PERO LOS FINES DE SEMANA LE AYUDAN A SU PADRE, LA ESPOSA SE DEDICA A LA ELABORACION DE COLCHONES QUE LOS VENDE EN LA ZONA 16 DE JULIO, EL CREDITO SERA INVERTIDO EN LA COMPRA DE EQUIPOS DE SONIDO EL CLIENTE YA TRABAJO VARIAS SECUENCIAS CON LA INSTITUCION Y EL CREDITO  QUE SACO EN LA INSTITUCION LO INVERTIRA EN LA COMPRA DE AMPLIFICADORES PARA ASI MEJORAR LA CALIDAD DE SONIDO PARA BRINDAR UN MEJOR SERVICIO A LOS CLIENTES. ESTA MUY AGRADECIDO CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Carlos is a client who has had 12 loans with the institution. He demonstrated responsibility with the previous loans. He provides amplification service. He works in different areas of the city of El Alto and the city of La Paz. He keeps all of his amplification machines in his own home. He does his advertising in his own home. His work normally starts on the week-ends from Thursday through Sunday. His amplifiers go to weddings, baptisms, and school parties. The work Carlos Q. does is a bit self-sacrificing because he has to get up at dawn to gather his amplifiers. He has three children, and they go to school. But, on the week-ends they help their father. His wife makes mattresses, and she sells them in the 16 de Julio zone. The loan is to buy sound equipment. The client has already worked with the institution in various cycles. He will use this loan from the institution to buy amplifiers to improve the quality of sound. That way he will provide his customers with better service. He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust shown in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy aerial sound equipment and fabric

loans.name: Na We Cam Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Na We Cam” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Kadiatu K. who is age 33. Kadiatu (pictured 3rd from left) was born in Makeni and is married to a diamond dealer with two children. Her husband is a businessman and his children are attending primary school.  For 12 years now, Kadiatu sells jean trousers, T-Shirts, shoes, jewelry, etc. With this loan, she will expand her business by buying the above items in wholesale to add to her business. 

(In the photo is also loan officer Zainab Bangura handing over the loan to the group).

loans.use: To buy jean trousers, T-Shirts, shoes, jewelry, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Help son buy work supplies.

loans.name: Ysmael

texts.es:
El socio Ysmael pertenece al banco comunal YANAPAKUY; El socio vive en el distrito de Santiago en la provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

El socio tiene 51 años de edad y tiene 4 hijos es divorciado y se dedica a la mecánica, el socio vende accesorios de autos en San jerónimo, el socio estudio superior completa y es mecánico de automóviles,  el viene trabajando desde hace 31 años actualmente quiere mejorar su taller. El socio solicita el préstamo para implementar algunos accesorios para su taller de mecánica.

El socio agradece y valora infinitamente el crédito otorgado y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de las deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The borrower is a member of the community bank Ysmael YANAPAKUY. He lives in the district of Santiago in the province of Cusco, department of Cusco. He is 51 years old, divorced, and has four children. He is an auto mechanic and sells auto parts in San jerónimo. He completed a post-secondary education in auto mechanics. He has been working for about 31 years now, and would like to improve his workshop. He is requesting a loan so he can obtain some additional items for his workshop. He is infinitely grateful and appreciative of this loan, and promises to make his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Aaron Cannon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The borrower requests the loan so he can get some items for his auto mechanic's workshop.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora V. is 36 years old and is a mother of six children, aged between one and 13 years. Despite being poor, Nora is happy that all her family members enjoy a harmonious relationship. She, at times, feels unfortunate for not being well-off and not being able to offer the best of lifestyle for her children. However, she is happy that she has a very supportive husband and loving children that make her feel luckier than many wealthy people who are faced with family problems and factions.

According to Nora, education is the greatest asset she can leave behind for her children when she grows old. She dreams of graduating her children from college, and she believes that nobody can take away the wealth of education. Nora is requesting a loan from ASHI to make her fishing business, in partnership with her husband, stable and profitable. She will use the loan amount to purchase fishing gears and fish, in addition to their own catch, for selling.

Nora says that the money earned from this business will help her children get their college degrees and give them a better lifestyle. She wants to pass on the virtues of good moral character and core values that she has learned from friends and other members of ASHI to her children, so that they are better prepared to face struggles in their lives.

loans.use: To purchase fishing gears and fish, aside from their own catch, for selling

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia P. is from the village of Capellan. She is 34 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. Leticia owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily pigs, for fattening and sale. Leticia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP per harvest.

Leticia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leticia has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI, which was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Leticia is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Leticia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Badassawé

texts.fr: O. gnao est une dame âgée de 35 ans, elle est couturière, elle exerce son activité dans son atelier de couture qu'elle a appelé " BEAUTE D'AFRIQUE". elle fait ce commerce depuis 2003. elle a des apprentis couturière, elle a besoin de s'acheter une nouvelle machine de couture pour livrer plus rapidement ses clients et mieux former ses apprentis. c'est pour cela qu'elle sollicite un crédit pour l'achat d'une nouvelle machine à coudre. elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants.
texts.en:
Ms. O. Gnao is a 35-year old woman. She is a seamstress. She has her own shop which she has named “Beaute d’Afrique” [Africa’s Beauty]. She has been in this business since 2003, and now has apprentices. In order to better train them and to deliver the customers’ orders more quickly, she needs a new sewing machine. Thus she is requesting a loan to purchase a new sewing machine. She is married and the mother of two children.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing a sewing machine

loans.name: Jaime Antonio

texts.es: Jaime Antonio, es padre de dos hijos uno estudia en primaria y el otro está menor de edad, su negocio es la venta de CD, Videos, también brinda servicio de fotografía y venta de lotería de manera ambulante. Debido a la difícil situación que enfrentamos el tiene que buscar la forma de proporcionar ingresos para su hogar. Junto a su esposa trabajan cada día para mejorar su negocio y el medio de vida de su familia. En este momento está solicitando un segundo financiamiento para invertirlo en su negocio como: compra de DC, Videos, Rollos de Películas, para ofrecer a sus clientes productos de buena calidad, con las ganancias que su negocio le brinda, mantiene su hogar y su familia.
texts.en:
Jaime Antonio is the father of 2 children: one of whom is in school and the other is younger. He has a business selling CDs and videos, and he also provides photography services and sells lottery tickets in the streets. Owing to the difficult situation that we face, he has to look for a way to provide income to his household. Along with his wife, they work every day to improve their business and the standard of living of their family. At this time he is requesting a second loan to invest in the business to buy CDs, videos and film so that he can offer his customers good quality products and, with the earnings that the business provides, support his family.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital to buy CDs, videos and film

loans.name: Mauricia

texts.es: Mauricia, de 64 años, es divorciada, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia en compañía de sus 2 hijos y sus nietas. Por algunos años vendía dulces en los paraderos de buses, pero lo tuvo que dejar debido a los obstáculos generados por sus competidores, entonces han transcurrido 4 años para dedicarse a la preparación de salchipapas (frituras de pollo y papas), platillos que los vende por las tardes y que gustan a la gente. El punto de su negocio es en la puerta de su casa, en la que con mucha paciencia atiende desde las 6:00pm  hasta 11:00 de la noche a sus vecinos, quienes son asiduos clientes, que gustan de la higiene y su buena sazón. Se siente feliz con su negocio; ya que no tiene  mucha competencia cercana,  y eso le favorece mucho en las ganancias. En adelante anhela instalar un restaurante en su casa. Este es su doceavo crédito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que desea contar con posteriores ayudas. Con el crédito que solicita, podrá comprarse una vitrina y sillas para implementar mejor su negocio.
texts.en:
Mauricia, age 64, is divorced. She is a hard-working mother and lives in her own home with her 2 children and her grandchildren. For some years she sold candies at bus stops, but she had to stop because of the obstacles generated by her competition. Now, for 4 years she has prepared salchipapas (fried chicken and potatoes), a dish that she sells in the afternoons and that people like. She sells from the door of her home, which she does with great patience from 6:00 pm to 11:00 pm. She sells to her neighbours, who are regular customers and like her cleanliness and the flavour of her food. She is happy with her business; since there is not much competition nearby, her earnings are good. In the future she wants to open up a restaurant in her home. This is her twelfth loan with MFP, and she promises to repay all of her quotas on time, since she wants to have future help. With the loan that she is requesting, she will be able to purchase a display cabinet and chairs to better set up her business.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy display cabinets and chairs to set up her business

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca es una señora de 58 años de edad, dedicada a la venta de tortillas, tamales y leña, reside en San Francisco Gotera, Morazán donde vive junto a su madre y un nieto quienes dependen económicamente de ella.
Ella vende tortillas por la mañana y por la tarde, los tamales los vende tres veces por semana y la leña pues todos los días en su casa.
Hoy francisca solicita un préstamo para compra de productos para la preparación de sus ventas como por ejemplo: Maíz, Leña, pollo y verduras, Con este préstamo ella comprara mercadería para abastecer su inventario porque hay productos que al comprar por mayor cantidad los encuentra más baratos como el Maíz y la leña que además estos no se dañan, contribuyendo para que ella pueda obtener mejores ventas y ganancias para la alimentación de la familia.
El objetivo de ella es poder darle a su nieto la educación para que este se supere y pueda tener acceso a una mejor vida en el futuro.
texts.en:
Francisca is a 58 year old lady who dedicates her time to the sale of tortillas, tamales [a local dish made from maize stuffed with meat or vegetables, and cooked in banana leaves] and firewood. She lives in San Francisco Gotera, Morazán, where she lives with her mother and a grandson, who depend upon her financially. She sells tortillas morning and evening, the tamales three times per week, and the firewood everyday, selling it from her home. Today Francisca is seeking a loan to purchase what she needs to make her products, including maize, firewood, chicken and vegetables. With this loan she will buy stock up on ingredients, because when she buys in quantity she can get things cheaper - especially maize-flour and firewood, which will not spoil. This will help improve her earnings so that she can feed her family. Francisca's goal is to be able to give her grandson an education, so that he can do well for himself and have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials - maize and firewood

loans.name: Hagar Nana Adjoa

texts.en: Hagar Nana Adjoa M. smokes fish to sell at Elmina. Hagar has been through junior high level of education. She is married to a farmer and together they live with their four children. She helps her husband in providing the basic needs of the family. Her loan will be used to buy additional fish to smoke for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a shop.

loans.use: buy additional fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth B. is an industrious mother and is blessed with a very supportive partner, Edwin Quiatchon. She is 43 years old and a resident of Guinbanga-an, Laua-an, Antique, Philippines. She has four children; the oldest is 18 years old while the youngest is 11 years old. 

Due to poverty, her oldest child, John Webb, did not finish his elementary level, her second child is only in grade 6 while her third child as well as her youngest child are both in grade 3. Even though they are both industrious, they are still tied by poverty because they lack opportunities and resources. Her partner, Edwin, is a farmer while she is a laborer and housekeeper.

In 2009, ASHI came into Elizabeth's life. This was also the time when she started to open her eyes, broaden her mind and started dreaming of their future. After their training in ASHI, she received her first loan of PHP 5,000 which they invested in farming and it helped them to sustain their basic needs.

For her second loan from ASHI, she is borrowing PHP 8,500 and this amount will be utilized as starting capital for their buy-and-sell business dealing in muscovado sugar because their municipality (town) Laua-an is known as the muscovado capital of Antique. Muscovado is a type of unrefined brown sugar with a strong molasses flavor. Also known as "Barbados sugar" or "moist sugar", muscovado is very dark brown and slightly coarser and stickier than moist brown sugar. Muscovado takes its flavor and color from its source, sugar cane juice. It offers good resistance to high temperatures and has a reasonably long shelf life. It is commonly used in baking recipes and making whiskey. 

Elizabeth has a simple dream in life which is to send her children to school until college and she believes that it is not too late to start again. She wishes that her membership in ASHI will help her dreams come true.

loans.use: To use as starting capital for buying and selling muscovado sugar

loans.name: Mariquita

texts.en:
Mariquita L. is from the village of Unidos. She is 59 years old. Mariquita is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Mariquita owns and operates a business venture in the agricultural sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising chickens for sale. Mariquita has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2002, Mariquita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mariquita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Mariquita is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 13th loan taken out by Mariquita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Feliza

texts.en:
This is Feliza L., 52, resident of Silang, Cavite City, Philippines. She is already widowed and she is working hard to continually provide income for her family’s everyday expenses.

Feliza manages her own farm. She mostly grows ornamental plants which she then sells to the local markets. Ornamental plants are mostly used in landscaping and aesthetic improvement of any place or occasion. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php200 in sales every day. Feliza also manages their own pineapple farm.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php35,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of supplies for the farm like fertilizers, seedlings and other products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
  
Feliza dreams of being able to buy her own delivery vehicle, with all of her work with the business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more quantities of supplies for the farm like fertilizers, seedlings and other products to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Bernadith

texts.en:
Bernadith T. is from the village of Sinara Alto, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old. Bernadith is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Bernadith owns & operates a business offering transportation services. Bernadith has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Bernadith joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bernadith is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Bernadith from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Ethel Doliguez's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ethel D. is from Guba Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old and is married with three school-age children. She is the group leader of this four-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Ethel D. Group. 

Ethel owns and operates a business making and selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for ten years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2005, Ethel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from PMPC.

Ethel is now requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her twelfth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: 
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more sticks and mats

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.en:
Cleofe S. is from the village of Tabon. She is 44 years old. Cleofe is a group member of PMPC. Cleofe is married and has two children. One is working and the other is still studying. To make a living, Cleofe operates a sari-sari store. Cleofe has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Cleofe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Cleofe is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used for additional capital. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Cleofe from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To provide additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Luna

texts.en:
Luna M. is 57 years old, married and supports her family by selling nipa, or palm leaves which are used in homes and to make baskets. She lives in Prk. Aguinaldo, Brgy. Calubang, Ilog, Negros Occidental and has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1996. She has made good use of loans from NWTF to improve her family's living standards. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 3,500 and is applying for a new loan, for PHP 12,000, to buy more nipa to sell to her customers. This will be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon, and her goal is to continue to improve her family's living standards. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through its alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To buy more nipa leaves to sell to her customers

loans.name: Elena Aurora

texts.es:
Elena tiene 49 años de edad y vive junto a su esposo en su casa propia en el caserío Palominos. Se ubica en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. Recién, Elena y su esposo han obtenido el servicio de luz en su casa. 

Elena se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida. Prepara la comida en su domicilio y luego sale a vendérsela al público en general. Lleva cinco años realizando esta actividad y tiene una clientela ya establecida en la región. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida debido a la buena calidad de los productos que ofrece y a la buena atención que brinda.

Desea comprar más insumos de primera necesidad que ampliará la producción de sus platos de comida y aumentará sus ventas. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
49 year old Elena lives with her husband in their own home in the hamlet of Palominos. The hamlet is in the district of Tambogrande, an agricultural zone in the province of Piura and the region of the same name, more than 4 hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region. Elena and her husband have recently installed electrical service in their house. 
Elena has a business preparing and selling food. She prepares the food in her home and later goes out to sell it to the general public. She has been doing this for 5 years and has an established customer base in the region. The business is very well received because of the good quality of the products and the good service that Elena offers. 
She wants to buy more raw materials to increase production of her dishes and expand her sales. For this reason, she is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of $200.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her business.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MOSOQ ALLPA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Sonia, La socia tiene 46 años de edad, la socia  es separada y tiene 1 hijo, la socia trabaja con este banco desde sus inicios, ella es una de las socias fundadoras y la socia administra un snack café situado en la florida, el negocio de la socia se llama “Gustitos al paso”, La socia es una mujer muy alegre y muy trabajadora, ella desea dar a sus hijo lo mejor y sobre todo una carrera profesional, la socia desea el crédito para implementar su negocio y también está pensando en poner una heladería en el mismo local, para lo cual ella requiere el préstamo. La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar su negocio y tener la venta de helados.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Mosoq Allpa communal bank which is located in the Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

She is Sonia, 46, and is separated with 1 son.  The member has worked with this bank since its beginning.  She is one of the founders and Sonia runs a snack café located in La Florida, called Gustitos al Paso.  She is a cheerful and hardworking woman who wants the best for her son, especially a professional career.  Sonia is requesting the loan to set up her business and she is also thinking about selling ice cream in the same stand.  For this she needs the loan, and the money will be used to set up her business and to also sell ice cream.

Sonia is happy with the loan issued her and she promises to make her payments in the established time period.

loans.use: The member is requesting a loan to set up her business and to sell ice cream

loans.name: Ninakan's Group

texts.ru:
Нинакан Жакыпова, 56, лидер этой группы. За свои 56 лет она успела прожить успешную и интенсивную жизнь. В этой женщине совмещены мать пятерых детей, преподавателем с большим стажем и опытная работница сельского хозяйства. Все ее дети , кроме младшего 24-летнего сына уже давно вылетели из родительского гнезда и машут крыльями по-своему. Младший сын вместе с отцом, работником налоговой управы местного поселка, активно следят за подобающим уходом скота. Разведению крупно-рогатого скота в Токтогуле благоприятствуют природно-климатические условия. Семья занимается разведением в обоих направлениях -молочного и мясного. Своеобразие климата позволяет семье перегонять скот по сезонным пастбищам: весной -из долин в предгорья, а на летний период в высокогорную зону, жайлоо. По мнению Нинакан этот бизнес обладает хорошей рентабельностью. Он был начат еще 15 лет назад, когда родители Нинакан подарили ей первую корову. С тех пор эта деятельность приносит ей и ее семье стабильный доход. Выручку от продажи скота Нинакан вкладывает обратно в оборот. Она просит кредит с целью приобрести холодильник, на который она давно не может отложить средства. 


        --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.
texts.en:
Ninakan Z., 56 years old, is this group’s leader. During the 56 years, her life was successful and intensive. This woman’s life has many facets: she is a mother of five, a schoolteacher with many years of experience, and an experienced agricultural worker. All her children, aside from the youngest 24-year old son, have left the nest long time ago and now fly on their own. The youngest son together with his father, who works at the local tax collection agency of their town, take an active part in caring for the livestock. The Toktogul climate is auspicious for raising cattle. The family raises both  beef and dairy cattle. The unique local climate allows the family to drive their cattle to different pastures according to the season: in the spring from the  valley to the hills, and in the summer to the high mountain areas. 

Ninakan believes that this business is profitable. She launched this work 15 years ago, when Ninakan’s parents first  bought a cow for her. Since then this business bring stable income for her and her family. She reinvests her income in the business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase a refrigerator, as she has not been able to  set funds aside for this purchase for a long time.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Kimberly

texts.en:
Kimberly is a young mother to a 1-year-old child. She is 20 years old and married to a farmer. Kimberly works at the farm with her husband. They till the land for planting and harvesting rice crops. At her young age, Kimberly has learned to work hard and support her family.

Kimberly's loan will be used to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies. She wishes for her business to improve.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia is 55 years old and has three children. She is a member of the communal bank "Musuq Rumi" which means "New Stone" in Quechua. She has a grocery store in her home where she sells general groceries, fruits, vegetables and meat. She will be using her loan of 1,200 PEN to purchase supplies such as sugar, rice, sweets, meat, eggs, and chicken. Lucia has been a member of FINCA Peru for four years now and wants to keep growing her business.

loans.use: to supply her grocery store

loans.name: An

texts.en:
Mrs. An T. (pictured in the photo with her daughter), 63, is a widowed mother with five sons and four daughters. Four of the children are married and live outside the family home, one is a garment factory worker and three assist their mother in the business. The family lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.  

Although An is old, she is still strong enough to work. An grows jasmine flowers. She also buys additional jasmine flowers and bananas from fellow villagers and lets her daughter sell them in the Phnom Penh market. An is asking for a loan of $700 to purchase more small jasmine trees to plant and bananas to resell.

loans.use: To purchase more small jasmine trees to plant and bananas to resell.

loans.name: Marie Chantal

texts.en:
Marie Chantal was born 44 years ago, and she has three children who are between the ages of 18 and 28. They all live apart from the eldest who has completed high school. Marie sells green bananas on a wholesale scale, working together with her husband. 

They have done this business for twelve years and it has enabled them to meet their needs. Marie Chantal also makes banana juice from these green bananas and she sells it. She is requesting a loan to buy more green bananas to sell. She plans to save all her profits.

loans.use: to buy green bananas to sell.

loans.name: Romie

texts.en:
Romie is 45 years old and married with three school-aged children. Romie is a farmer working in the Philippines and earns PHP 30,000 per harvest. 

Romie is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. Romie has been growing rice for almost nine years.

In the future, Romie hopes that his farming business will be more progressive and support the increasing needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Divinas Group

texts.es:
L. A.C. “DIVINAS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por L. señora Victoria. Los negocios que las integrantes D. L. asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta D. comida, venta D. zapatos, venta D. golosinas, venta D. ropa y mantas, venta D. ollas, chofer propietario, venta D. adornos D. porcelana

L. señora Victoria,  indica que hace doce años que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que ingreso, cuando vino a preguntar a L. oficina. En L. actualidad elL. tiene un negocio D. venta D. calzados que inicio hace 29 años, aprendiendo este oficio D. su hermana. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para L. compra mercadería (compra D. calzados). Estos productos los comprará por mayor D. L. ciudad D. Oruro y posteriormente a los venderá en las ferias D. L. cuidad D. El Alto. Esta forma D. trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues elL. es viuda y  tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta D. Pro Mujer, elL. responD. que le gusta el ahorro y L. capacitación.
texts.en:
The “DIVINAS” community bank is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Los Andes regional office.  The bank has nine members and is run by a board of directors, which is led by Victoria.  The business activities that the members are engaged in are varied and incluD.: selling food, selling shoes, selling candies, selling clothes and blankets, selling pans, working as a driver (with own vehicle) and selling china ornaments.

Victoria says that she has been working with Pro Mujer for twelve years and she joined when she came to the office to ask about the program.  She has a business selling footwear which she set up 29 years ago.  She learned the traD. from her sister.

Victoria will use her loan to buy merchandise (footwear).  She will buy her products wholesale in the city of Oruro and then sell them in the street markets in the city of El Alto.  This work allows her to make income with which to support her family.  She is a widow and has three children.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the savings and the training.

loans.use: to buy footwear

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman with four children , three of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. She owns a food stall at  Wandegeya market and works seven days a week. She has been in business for the last 10 years. 

Esther has requested a loan of 600,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more fruits and  vegetables, like baskets of tomatoes, onions and bananas. Esther works from the market and sells to all categories of people. Her major challenges include transportation and perishability. She resides in a rented house and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes feeding the family, rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more baskets of tomatoes, onions and bananas

loans.name: Natavan

texts.ru: Natavan 32 qoda. Ona zamujem i imeyet odnogo rebonka. Natavan jivet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoim mujem i rebonkom. Ona uje 5 let kak imeyet magazin dlya prodaji pishevix produktov. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi uvelichit pomesheniye dlya razmesheniya ne tolko pishevix produktov a i moyushix sredstv. Etomu biznessu ona nauchilas u svoyeyb starshey sestri.
texts.en: Natavan is 32 years old. She is married and has one child. Natavan lives in the Absheron region together with her husband and child. She has owned a grocery store for five years. Right now she needs a loan for 2000 AZN to expand her store to make more room for other inventory, such as household cleaning products. She has learned about this business from her older sister.

loans.use: to expand the store

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El señor Carlos Armando es un hombre trabajador y emprendedor quien se dedica a la compra y venta animales desde 1991. El con este negocio ha sacado adelante a su familia su esposa y cuatro hijos, brindándole lo mejor posible.
Él invertirá el crédito en la compra de gallinas, cerdo, caballos, vacas…etc. con el fin de mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Carlos Armando is a hardworking and enterprising man who has been buying and selling animals for a living since 1991. With this business, he has helped his family (his wife and four children) to get ahead in life, offering them the best that is possible. 
He will use the loan to buy chickens, pigs, horses, cows, etc, with the goal of improving his business.

loans.use: buy chickens, pigs, horses, cows, etc.

loans.name: Mercidia

texts.es: La señora Mercidia tiene 60 años. Su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva. Lo que la afecta es que no tiene mucho capital de trabajo para invertir más. Uno de sus mayores desafíos ha sido su enfermedad que muchas veces no le permite salir a ofrecer sus productos. En su negocio no tiene mucha competencia ya que las ventas se hacen de forma ambulante. Desea continuar creciendo en su negocio y con la ayuda de financiamiento continuara invirtiendo. El financiamiento es para la compra de pantalones camisas, faldas, camisetas, trajes para niños y niñas y ropa de vestir.
texts.en: Mercidia, 60, sells new clothes.  What affects her is not having enough working capital to invest more.  One of her greatest challenges has been her illness which often keeps her from being able to go out to sell.  She doesn’t have much competition in her business because she’s a street vendor.  She wants to continue to grow in business and with help from the loan she’ll continue to invest in it.  The loan is to buy pants, shirts, skirts, t-shirts, outfits for boys and girls and dress clothes.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Uputaua

texts.en:
Uputaua, age 43, owns and operates a business venture that involves baking and selling a variety of baked goods in the local community. She has one year of experience in this business. Uputaua is requesting a loan in the amount of WST $1,000 to purchase sacks of flour, sacks of sugar, baking powder, and cooking utensils used for baking.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or US $104 per week) to improve and expand the business. Uputaua and her husband have five children.

Uputaua joined SPBD earlier this year in order to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Uputaua's first loan through SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of flour, sacks of sugar, baking powder, and cooking utensils for baking

loans.name: Tagayaly

texts.ru: Тагайали житель района Хуросон. Ему 30 лет. Он женат. Имеет одного ребенка. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он более пяти лет занимается животноводством. Разводит скот у себя дома. Он в основном разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Tagayaly lives in the Khuroson district.  He is 30 years old, married and has one child.  His wife is a homemaker.  He has been involved in animal husbandry for over five years and breeds livestock at home.  Tagayaly primarily breeds livestock for future sale.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of cattle.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Linda Estefania

texts.es:
Linda Estefanía tiene 20 años de edad es soltera no tiene hijos vive con los padres en Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC Virgen de Guadalupe se encuentra ubicada en la Ciudadela 10 de noviembre, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedica  a labores comerciales.

Linda es dueña de un local de cervecería,  se dedica a la  venta de bebidas. Las compras lo realizan en Cervecería Nacional cada semana.
 Solicita el credito para poder comprar más producto para posterior venderlo.
El crédito le será de mucha ayuda para poder tener mejores ingresos y poder invertir en otro negocio adquirir mejores utilidades. El sueño es poder comprarse una casa para poder vivir tranquila con los padres.
En los tiempos libres le gusta escuchar música y trabajar.
texts.en:
Linda Estefania, 20, lives with her parents in the Ventanas province of Los Rios.  She is single and has no children.

She is a member of the Virgen de Guadalupe communal bank located in the area of 10 de Noviembre which is part of Ventanas province.  The bank focuses on commerce.

Linda owns a beer stand and she sells drinks.  She buys them in the Cerveceria National (national beer) company each week.

She is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise to sell later on.

The financing will be a big help for increased earnings and her ability to invest in another business for better income.  Her dream is to be able to buy a house so that she can live peacefully with her parents.  In her free time, Linda likes to listen to music and work

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell later

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy bales of used clothes to add to her business

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
This is 46-year-old Daniel. He is married and has 2 children aged 5 and 2. He has 2 additional dependents who live with him because they are his relatives from the village. In 1998, Daniel established his cooking utensils business. He began his business because he needed a permanent source of income to support his family. He discovered that cooking utensils were a big business opportunity in his community. 

Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,300,000 every month. He would like a loan of Le 5,000,000. Daniel has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans and now requires a new loan to buy more cooking utensils for his business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 250,000. In the future, Daniel plans to acquire a permanent shop and open his business in other locations and to educate his children to university level. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for cooking utensils

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es: El señor Ramón es una persona  trabajadora   y  muy responsable,  el cual acudió  con nosotros ya que   nos  comenta   que  el desea  colocar   protecciones  en  su  vivienda,  ya  que  por  diversas  ocasiones  se  han tratado  de  meter  los  ladrones a  su   domicilio, agradece  el apoyo brindado para  la realización de su  proyecto  ya  que  ve  en  el crédito la posibilidad  de  brindar a  su   domicilio y a su   familia  una  mayor  seguridad.
texts.en: Ramon is a hardworking and very responsible person. He approached us because he needs to install protective structures on his house. For various reasons thieves have tried to break in to his house. He is thankful to the support towards the realization of his project. He recognizes this loan as a way to provide his house and his family with greater security.

loans.use: to install protective structures on his house.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 41 years old and married to Cecilia. Together they have two children. He operates a posho (grain) mill and has been in the business for the past four years. He gets a monthly income of about KES 40,000 from the business.

This is his first loan term from KADET LTD. He will use the loan amount to purchase cereals for his business. He will use the anticipated profit to install electricity in his business premises. His dream is to be a large scale business man.

loans.use: to purchase cereals.

loans.name: Mama Salone Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Mama Salone” group from Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. They are petty businesspeople who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, in order to seek a loan of 500,000 SLL for each in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit and consequently improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Nanah. Nanah was born in Magburaka 35 years ago. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are attending primary school. Nanah sells rice, cooking oil, pepper, salt, Maggi cubes (used to give sauce a sweet taste), onions, etc. and has been doing business for eight years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above-mentioned items in bulk to add to her business inventory.

loans.use: to buy rice, cooking oil, pepper, salt, Maggi cubes, onions, etc. in bulk to add to her business inventory.

loans.name: Ederlina

texts.en:
Ederlina is a 41-year-old, married woman with four children.

Ederlina earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. She has been raising livestock for 16 years, and she earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear clothing. Ederlina is seeking to borrow a loan in the amount of 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her livestock.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional feed and vitamins for her livestock

loans.name: Selepa

texts.en:
Selepa is a 47-year-old woman living in the town of Salelavalu Tai. She is married and has two school-aged children.
  
To make a living, Selepa owns and operates a business venture raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. Selepa has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 720 WST a month from these activities.

In 2010, Selepa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.  Selepa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.  

Selepa is now requesting a new loan of 1,500 WST, which will be used to purchase sacks of fertilizers and gromozones (herbicide). The loan will be the third loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. 

 Selepa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizers and gromozones (herbicide).

loans.name: Irene's Group

texts.en:
Irene's group is comprised of five hardworking women. Irene is 20 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past two years, Irene has been working hard to manage her small business, which makes clothes using a borrowed sewing machine. 

To help expand her business, Irene has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy her own sewing machines and new material, and will help Irene to generate greater profits and pay medical expenses and take care of her family. Irene hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a home. 

Irene is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Irene's future prospects by helping her to learn more about womanhood and how to succeed financially.

loans.use: to buy her own sewing machines and new material

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Mrs. Thy appears in the photo with her husband at the side of her own house, located in Prey Chor district. She is 40 years old and has been blessed with three children. Two of her children are already married and live separately, while the other one now is working as a construction worker around the province. 

Thy generates her income by cultivating rice and potato crops on the existing farmland. Now her potato crops are ripe enough to harvest, yet she doesn’t have sufficient funds to hire a few physical laborers to help. Thus, she is looking for a loan from HKL to pay for the labor costs. 

She is an honest client who successfully paid back her previous loans. This is her third loans from HKL and second loan from Kiva as well.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 49 years old and married to Joseph.  They are blessed with two children.  She has been in the farming business for the past ten years with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer.  She will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.  With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. 

Her hopes and dreams are to open a big retail shop to supply fertilizer in her locality.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Dogan Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DOGAN est composé de quatre personnes qui appartiennent à une même collectivité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Jocelyne Ernestine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Jocelyne Ernestine est âgée de 32 ans et vit au Bénin. Jocelyne Ernestine a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Jocelyne Ernestine est mariée à un certain Bruno. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Jocelyne Ernestine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les divers besoins de la maison. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Jocelyne Ernestine vend depuis cinq ans des mèches, des vernis et des vêtements de façon secondaire. Jocelyne Ernestine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Jocelyne Ernestine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe DOGAN, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les trois premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The "Dogan" group comprises four people who belong to the same community. The group representative, named Jocelyne Ernestine, is the one whose hand is raised in the photo. Jocelyne Ernestine is 32 years old and lives in Benin. She ended her studies in primary school. She is married to a man named Bruno. The couple have two children, both of whom are in their care and attend school. Jocelyne Ernestine lives together with her husband and children. The couple provide for the various household needs together. In order to pay for various family expenses, Jocelyne Ernestine has sold hair extensions, nail polish, and clothing on the side for five years. She gets her supplies at a market in Benin. With the goal of satisfying her clientele and increasing her sales volume and income, Jocelyne Ernestine is seeking a fourth loan with ALIDÉ along with the other Dogan group members. The three previous loans were repaid properly.

loans.use: To buy clothing, nail polish, and hair extensions.

loans.name: Parbati

texts.en: Parbati is 36 years-old .  She is Married and has 2 children aged 15 and 13.  In 2000, she established  her cow's ,milk selling business.  Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supoorts her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 6 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buys young cow for her business.  In the future, Parbati plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 0Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal.  Cows are never raised for beef, but for there milk from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made.  Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking.  On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day.  In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50.  In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and can be captured in methane storage tanks.  The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

loans.use: to buys cow

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a 3-year-old married woman with two children, who are both in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Nancy has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a 15000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her business.

Nancy has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es: Doña josefina de 56 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de platanos desde hace mas de 22 años y adicional a eso al cultivo de granos basicos para consumo propio, comercializa los platanos en los pueblos aledaños y con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas platanos por mayor para poder continuar con su trabajo y asi poder tener mejores ingresos economicos.

loans.use: compra de mas platanos por mayor

loans.name: William

texts.en: William is married with seven children.He lives with his family at Vituka area of Dae r es Salaam.William keeps cows and pigs in an area he inherited from his father.He keeps these animals in very  old huts he built about twelve years ago.He usually get into conflict with his neighbours when the animals break the huts and eat some grown vegetables.Local authorities knows William for frequent penalties he pays to his neighbours by damages done by his animals.He want to put out with this problem.He need to build strong and big huts to curb the problem.He still have enough land to so.He also in need to improve the business in general by adding to stock medications for animals,milk carriage vessels,bicycles,wheelbarrows and pork storage equipments.He is in need of USD 1000.

loans.use: Purchasing animal feed,medications,add flock of animals.

loans.name: Mezahir

texts.en:
Mezahir has been in this business for 2 years.
He has his own grocery store.
This 31-year-old man is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region who is settled in the Fizuli region Kayidish village. He is married and has 2 children.
Having borrowed $600 he bough foodstuffs.
Now he needs a loan of $1000 to start to sell all types of industrial  goods.

loans.use: To start the sale of all types of industrial goods

loans.name: Danya

texts.en: Danya lives in district 17 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is single and she lives with her family. She is a traditional embroiderer, and she has good work experience. She took her 2nd cycle group loan and bought all new embroidery materials. Now she wants to take anther loan to expand her business and to find more clients and make a good income to help her family. She is very happy now that she can show her talent.

loans.use: To buy extra embroidery materials

loans.name: Marie Chantal
