texts.en: Z. Marie Chantal is a 31 year old dynamic micro business woman. She lives with her family in Yopougon, a township in the north of Abidjan. She is married and her husband is a modest librarian. She sells meat in Yopougon open market. Her micro business revenue contributes significantly to cover household expenses. She has 3 children who all go to school. Chantal heard about AE&I in October 2004 from her sister. She then joined the AE&I microcredit program. She has been performing very well. Chantal wants to expand her business in order to contribute to her children's school fees payment in October.

loans.use: To purchase goods in bulk

loans.name: Mukarama

texts.en: Mukarama Nasretdinova is 45 years old, she holds secondary school education. She is married and has 5 children. After graduating, Mukarama studied a course in sewing. For fifteen years she has worked in an atelier as a sewer. Ten years ago she became interested in a business which her sister has started. Her sister sewed bags and sold them in a market. Mukarama first borrowed money from her sister and also started sewing bags and widened her business.  Currently she rents a booth in a market and sells bags. For the loan amount of $1000 the client is going to increase sales, buy new materials and renew the range of goods. Take into account that the client is selling bags in a market, her goods have big demand, and sellers and buyer can obtain bags for low prices. The client is going to pay off the loan amount in 12 months.

loans.use: to increase a turnover, trough buying materials and begs for food and other necessary things

loans.name: Betty Julia

texts.es:
Betty is very optimistic, despite the economic hardships that she’s had, she works incessantly to provide a better future for her 3 children. Two of her children are attending university and the youngest one wants to serve his nation. All of this requires a strong investment on Betty’s part and this is why she decided open a little store four years ago, so she could help with the household income. This business has let her welfare rise and provide for her children’s education. Currently, she is also working to help her husband who is in the process of recovery from a very serious surgery, and he has not been able to work as a musician as he used to. With the purpose of seeing her family better every day, Betty will continue to strive to move forward and not let life’s difficulties defeat her.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva volunteer

Betty es muy optimista y a pesar de las carencias económicas por las que ha pasado trabaja incesantemente por un futuro mejor para sus 3 hijos que están con muchos deseos de superarse, dos de sus hijos ya son universitarios y el menor quiere ser un servidor de su patria. Todo esto requiere de una inversión fuerte, es por ello que Betty decidió abrir una pequeña tienda hace cuatro años para ayudar e incrementar los ingresos económicos de su hogar. Así mismo estos le han permitido incrementar el nivel de vida y educación de sus hijos, ahora también trabaja con el propósito de mejorar la salud de su querido esposo que se está recuperando de una dolorosa operación y que por un tiempo no podrá ejercer su oficio de músico.Con el propósito de ver cada vez mejor a su querida familia seguirá esforzándose . Apoyemos a Betty a seguir adelante y a no dejarse vencer por las adversidades de la vida.

loans.use: Incremento de capital para consolidar su pequeño negocio e incrementar el nivel de vida y salud de su querida familia.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Mrs. Kim L., age 55, is a widow who works selling grocery products, making about $4.80 each day. She has one child who is a chef, earning about $2.40 per day. She is requesting a loan of $600 in order to purchase more grocery items to expand her inventory to fulfill her client’s needs.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items to expand her inventory to fulfill her client’s needs.

loans.name: Nawiyah

texts.en: Nawiyah, 32, has a small shop where she sells food, household goods, beverages, etc., at her house. She earns USD10. She opened this shop to earn income for the family because her husband, N., does not work anymore. She is requesting a loan of USD175 to add to her business capital, and as a member of MBK she agrees to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Add to her business capital

loans.name: Kiryoowa Central A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Sarah N.. She is currently in the business of charcoal selling and is requesting a loan to add to her business. Sarah is 40 years old and is married. She has 2 children aged 20 and 25. Both of them do not go to school. Each week, Sarah makes approximately UGX 25000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to construct a commercial house. Sarah has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 250000 in order to buy more charcoal and the loan was paid back on time.

Sarah is joined in her small group by Bena N., Phiona N., Prossy N., and Sylvia N.. Bena N. has a business running a bar and wants to buy a fridge and more beer. Phiona N. is currently operating a business in charcoal selling and wants a loan to purchase more bags of charcoal. Prossy N. operates a piggery business and wants to buy more pigs. Sylvia N. is currently in the poultry business and is requesting a loan to buy more chicks.

loans.use: To boost charcoal business

loans.name: Abdul Khalaq

texts.en:
Abdul Khalaq lives in district 15 of Kabul in Afghanistan. He is married with four children.

He has a retail shop and has good experience. He is planning to increase his business, so he has requested an individual loan to buy more goods for his shop. He looks forward to increasing his income to support his family and make a better business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more goods for his store.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is22 years old and is single woman. Elizabeth owns a small shop which hold different comodities like sugar, cooking oil, kerosine, flour and etc, which she started in 2005. Everyday, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her shop.

loans.use: To buy  more items for her shop.

loans.name: Musharaf

texts.en: Musharaf M.  has been an active client of the MicroInvest since 2002. She is very reliable and respects the loan procedures of  MicroInvest. The stability of her clothing business helped her to return the previous loans and to improve on the business terms of the loan. She started her business practically from the scratch but thanks to the financial support of the MicroInvest loans she has been able to open her own trading outlet in a popular bazaar.  She trades men's, women's and children's clothing and has a rather good assortment so she has many customers who are loyal and only buy from her.  Now Mrs. M. Musharaf applies to KIVA with a request for financial support. She requests a loan pf 2500 TJS for 7 months to expand the existing trade area.

loans.use: To broaden the existing trade area.

loans.name: Áída

texts.es:
Twelve years ago Aida vowed to burgeon in her birthplace in the town of Casacancha. She has also dedicated herself to the diverse farming and livestock chores which she realizes with great efficiency. Because of her efforts she can satisfactorily support her two children. Her wish to improve her livestock business has driven her to request this loan since she desires to diversify and optimize the breeding of her animals.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Aída apostó por desarrollarse plenamente en su tierra natal de Casacancha y dedicarse a las diversas tareas agrícolas y ganaderas también desde hace 12 años en las que viene desarrollándose con gran efectividad, gracias a su esfuerzo puede sostener a sus 2 hijos con satisfacción. Su deseo de mejorar su desempeño ganadero la conducen a solicitar un préstamo ya que tiene anhelo de diversificar y optimizar la crianza de sus pequeños animalitos.

loans.use: Capital to increase and improve the conditions for raising her animals.

loans.name: Claudia America

texts.en:
Click this link to view Claudia's first loan.

Claudia is a member of the Arco Iris Village Bank. She is 38 years old, married with three children. Claudia sells food at night at the street corner near her house and sells traditional food at the small town square in her neighborhood. Furthermore, Claudia has recently started selling chicken kebabs by cart also at night.

Claudia needs a loan of 1200 Peruvian Nuevo Soles ($US450) to invest in rice, noodles, peanuts and potatoes to expand her business.

Claudia's dreams are to improve her home, to move forward, to have a restaurant and to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: To invest in rice, noodles, peanuts and potatoes to expand her business.

loans.name: Sina

texts.en: Sina H. is a Tanzanian business woman. She runs a grocery store in the Lumo area of Dar es Salaam city. She sells a variety of items, including soft drinks. She is requesting a loan to expand her business. Income generated from the business is used to feed her family. Her business dream is to operate a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria, de 42 años, es madre de dos hijos maravillosos, vive junto a su esposo Jorge, a quien la apoya mucho, para juntos, salir adelante.
Ella se dedica a la venta de salchipapa (plato que consiste en papas y salchichas fritas) y gaseosas, en una esquina de su localidad, desde hace 5 años, solo vende por las noches.Sin embargo, no es el único negocio que tiene, ya que también apoya a su esposo, quien se dedica a comprar granos (maíz, fréjol, arroz, y otros) al por mayor en diferentes caseríos, para luego llevarlos a vender a las diferente tiendas de granos. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo, es que conoce mucha gente, y ver que está surgiendo muy lentamente pero seguro. En su negocio de venta de comida y bebidas heladas le va muy bien, como también a su esposo con quien comparten sus ideas de negocio.
Maria trabaja para solventar sus gastos diarios y la educación de sus hijos.
Solicita este préstamo para implementarse con muebles, sillas y mesas, para su negocio de venta de comida, como también alquilar un local para almacenar los granos que trae su esposo.
texts.en:
Maria, a 42 years old lady, and mother of two marvelous children, she lives with her husband Jorge. Maria and Jorge work hard in order to succeed. Maria sells salchipapa (dish that consists of potatoes and fried sausages) and carbonated soft drinks, at a street corner in her neighborhood. It has been five years, since she sells her products at night. Nevertheless, this is not the only business that Maria and Jorge have, they also buy wholesale grain products (corn, beans, rice, etc…) to then sell them at various small food stores. They like this job because they get to meet many people, and to see that they are progressing, slowly but surely. Their businesses are going well, but their marriages also, as they are able to share their entrepreneurial ideas and execute them. Maria works in order to pay for daily expenses and the education of her children. She is requesting this loan to purchase furniture, chairs and tables for her food selling business, and to rent a storage room for the grains her husband buys.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase furniture, chairs and tables for her food selling business and to rent a storage room for the grains her husband buys.

loans.name: Salafai

texts.en:
Salafai A. F., 52, is married with 3 children. She has 2 years of experience in the canteen business. She sells to the general public and villagers 5 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD).

SPBD loans are Salafai's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. A new member of the program running a canteen business, she wishes to supply all the children of their village school.

loans.use: Purchase frying pan, sack of sugar, sack of flour, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity sells juice and noodles. She has been in this business for a long time. Charity buys the juice and noodles from a company and she sells it later in wholesale and retail to her customers. Charity needs the loan to purchase more juice and noodles to sell.  Charity is 44 years old and is married with six children. She lives in Lagos state, Nigeria. She says "thank you" to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more juice and noodles to sell

loans.name: Señor De Potocchi Group

texts.en:
The Señor D. Potochi Village Bank is located in the Ascensión community of the Huancavelica Department. The district is popular with tourists, since it has some thermal baths, which are separated by the Ichu River.

Rosa Muño is married and has a small store, which she runs with the help of her husband. He used to work as a janitor at a local school, but is now retired and receives a pension. “I’ve learned to save and how to distribute my money within my business,” she says. She will use her loan to buy construction materials for her store and to pay the rent.

Aurelia C. is married and has a store where she sells drinks, dry goods, and sweets. Years ago, her husband had an accident and as a result her business suffered, so now she uses her loans to buy more merchandise to restock the store. Her dream is to have a business to train women to weave and do handicrafts.

Blanca A. is married and has an 8-year-old son. She has a boutique which she would like to stock with more things such as cosmetics. She also wants to save up to buy a home.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

El bancomunal Señor D. Potochi, esta ubicado en la comunidad D. Ascensión en el departamento D. Huancavelica. Esta es una zona turística cuenta con aguas termales separadas por el Rio Ichu.

Rosa Muño, es casada, tiene una pequeña tienda que trabaja con el apoyo D. su esposo que trabajaba como personal D. servicio en un Colegio, ya dejo D. trabajar y ahora cobra su seguro. “He aprendido a ahorrar y a saber distribuir el dinero D. mi negocio”. Su préstamo lo utilizará en comprar materiales D. construcción para su tienda y también para dar en alquiler.

Aurelia C., es casada, tiene una tienda D. bebidas, abarrotes y golosinas. Hace años su esposo se accidento y su negocio bajo, por eso ahora sus prestamos los utiliza en comprar mas mercadería, su sueño es tener una empresa para capacitar a mujeres en tejidos y artesanías.

Blanca A., es casada y tiene un hijo D. 8 años, tiene una boutique a la cual le gustaría surtir con mas cosas y así equipar su negocio, le gustaría comprar mas cosméticos y ahorrar para comprar su casa.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, to pay the rent, etc.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Sr. María tiene 48 años de edad, habitante del barrio el recreo de la capital de Managua, estado civil casada, tiene  dos preciosos hijos de 8 y 12 años de edad, los planes para su familia es asegúrale un patrimonio y un futuro mejor para sus hijos.
Doña María se desempeña como comerciante tiene una pulpería con trece años de experiencia en atención al cliente, inicio su pulpería comercializando los productos esenciales de un hogar los granos básico y verduras, sus objetivos para con su negocio es incrementar el volumen de ventas con nuevos y variados productos de consumo a diario y en ocasiones satisfaciendo la demanda de los clientes. Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograra comprar nuevos y variados productos como: productos enlatados,  frutas, artículos de belleza y otros productos de uso, aumentando los ingresos y ofreciéndole mayores beneficios  l obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
María is 48 years old. She lives in the neighborhood called El Recreo in the capital city of Managua. She is in a common-law marriage, and she has two precious children of 8 and 12 years old. Her plans for her family are to ensure an inheritance and better future for her children. Doña María works in sales. She has a general store and thirteen years of experience in attention to clients. She began her store selling essential household products, like grains and vegetables. Her goals for her business is to increase the volume of sales with a new variety of products for daily consumption and for special occasions, in order to meet the demand of her clients. Thanks to the loans from Afodenic, she has managed to buy a new variety of products like canned food, fruits, beauty products, and other useful items, increasing her income and offering her better benefits and a better income.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of items to sell, like canned food, fruit, and vegetables

loans.name: François-Xavier G.

texts.fr: Né le 07 Décembre 1983 à Zassa ; un village de la ville historique d’Abomey dans le Département du Zou, monsieur H. G. François Xavier est originaire de l’OUEME, un autre Département du Bénin. Père de deux enfants tous scolarisés au cours primaire, il s’est marié avec LOKOSSOU Alice Yédmon une ménagère. Le monsieur à un kiosque dans le grand marché international du BENIN (TOKPA) où il gère trois cabines téléphoniques. Il vend aussi des cartes de recharges téléphoniques. Il mène cette activité depuis 2 ans. Il est à son premier crédit pour renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. François Xavier G. H. was born on December 7, 1983 in Zassa; a village in the historical town of Abomey in the department of Zou. He is originally from Oueme, another department of Benin. He is the father of two children, all attending primary school. He is married to Alice Yédmon LOKOSSOU, a homemaker. This gentleman has a kiosk at the large international market of Benin (TOKPA) where he manages three phone booths. He also sells phone cards. He has been in the business for two years. This is his first loan to strengthen his activity.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of phone cards

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Bancomunal Maria de la Paz.
Rosa es conviviente, tiene 38 años dos hijos de 14 y 4 años, que estudian en la escuela nacional.
Rosa estudio contabilidad, trabajó como cajera en varios supermercados y grifos, pero se dedico por varios años a su casa, hasta que empezó a llevarle el menú al trabajo de su esposo, él trabaja en trasporte, es chofer, sus amigos le pidieron que les lleve menú para ellos también; Así empezó, ahora  reparte a  diario menú, solo trabaja por las mañanas. 
Rosa necesita un crédito de 1200 soles, para comprar una cocina, tapers, comestibles como arroz, azúcar, fideo.
Desde que comenzó en Finca, gracias al sistema de ahorros que tiene, pudo  salir del infocor y pagar gastos que tenia, le gusta las reuniones del bancomunal por que conoce mas gente, las socias son solidarias unas con otras, tiene nuevas amigas.  
El sueño que tiene Rosa es que su negocio sea propio, donde ella lo pueda administrar.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the community bank "Maria de la Paz". Rosa is married common-law, 38 years old, and has two children aged 14 and 4 who attend public school. Rosa studied accounting, worked as a cashier in a number of supermarkets and gas stations but stayed at home a number of years until she began bringing her husband lunches. He was working in transportation as a driver and his friends asked her to bring them lunches as well. That is how she started her business. She now delivers lunches daily and works mornings only. Rosa needs a 1,200 soles loan to buy a stove, tupperware, foodstuffs such as rice, sugar and noodles. Since she started with Finca, thanks to the savings system they have, she has been removed from infocor [a governmental organization which maintains a list of debtors; debtors on the list cannot generally obtain credit] and has been able to pay expenses she had. She enjoys the community bank meetings because she knows more people, because the members are supportive of each other, and because she makes new friends. Rosa's dream is to own a business which she would manage.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a stove, tupperware, foodstuffs such as rice, sugar and noodles.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es: Justina E. M. tiene 66 años, su estado civil es casada, y tiene 1 hijo. Doña Justina tiene la actividad económica de una pulpería. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio ya que dio inicio con una pequeña venta de productos como mangos, naranjas, shampoo y granos básicos y decidió realizar un financiamiento que le ayudara a crecer con su negocio y lo consigue. Y ahora sus propósitos son de comprar más vitrinas para exhibir sus productos y así crecer con su negocio. Sus deseos son superar los obstáculos que se le presenten para llevar a cabo sus propósitos que no por ser pequeñas dejan de ser importantes. La cantidad que solicita es de C$ 2.200 a un plazo de 12 meses.
texts.en:
Justina E. M. is 66 years old, married, and has one son. Doña Justina's economic activity is a local store. She dedicated her self to this business four years ago, beginning with a few sales of products like mangos, oranges, shampoo, and basic grains; she decided to do some financing to help her business grow and so she got a loan. Now her intentions are to buy more glass cases to exhibit her products. Her objective is to overcome any obstacles that present themselves and achieve her goals; just because her goals are small does not mean that they aren't important. The quantity that she is requesting is C$ 2.200 over a period of 12 months.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a greater variety of products for the general store

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
La Sra. Luz tiene 23 años es soltera  y vive en la casa de sus padres en Itaugua y es madre soltera ,una nena  de 3 años.

La Sra. Luz se dedica a la compra y venta de chipas en la ciudad de Caacupe hace 5 años, sus ventas lo realiza en un puesto fijo que tiene cerca de la Basilica de Caacupe.

Este credito es para la compra de chipas en mayor cantidad a  menor costo diariamente.

Es una persona que ha progresado mucho en la vida y agradece a la Fundaciòn Paraguaya por el apoyo que le ha brindado.
texts.en:
Luz is 23 years old, single, and lives in her parents' home in Itaugua. She is a single mother with a 3 year old daughter. Luz has been buying and selling "chipas", a type of corn and cheese bread, in the city of Caacupe for 5 years. She has a stand near the Basilica de Caacupe. This loan is to buy chipas in greater quantity and at a lower daily cost. Luz has made great progress in her life and thanks the Fundacion Paraguaya for the support it has given her.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chipas (corn and cheese bread)

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites raises hogs and then sells them after four months. She would like to start an electronic loading business as another source of income. She is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 that she can use as business capital to pursue her plan. This simple business will surely be of great help to her family. Her family wants to experience a better way of life. She and her husband work together to earn a living. She hopes that her loan will be granted and she can start her plans. Hopefully their income will increase so that they can provide for the education of their children.

Marites is married to Edgardo and they were blessed with three children. Chrismary is 15 years old and attends third year high school; Charmaine is 14 years old and attends second year high school; and Mark John is 12 years old and attends first year high school. Marites hopes that they may be able to continue to support the education of their children until college. She is looking forward to seeing them finish their studies.

loans.use: To start a new electronic loading business.

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
Genalyn H. owns a mini store. Her friends, neighbors and passersby are her regular customers. She is 18-years old, a resident of Oroquieta City and married with one child. She is a housewife and her husband works as a private employee.

Genalyn plans to expand her store with the loan she was able to obtain from Paglaum. She started her store with very little money, and now she needs additional capital. She dreams of a better home for her family and wants her business to be more profitable and successful.

loans.use: To buy additional inventory for a store

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria tiene 32 años, es una persona tranquila y dócil, vive con su pareja y padre de sus dos hijos en su casa propia desde hace un año, por la cual trabajó mucho para obtener. Desde pequeña apoyaba en los trabajos agrícolas a sus padres, ahora con su propia familia, su trabajo se ha incrementado porque tiene que preparar los alimentos para después acudir a su chacra a realizar los trabajos agrícolas. A Gloria le gusta mucho su labor y le tiene mucho cariño, ya que en todo este tiempo le han permitido ganar mucho dinero, en especial en ocasiones como semana santa, por la venta de flores, y en los meses de enero, febrero y marzo sus hortalizas llegan a tener un buen  precio en el mercado por ser verano en la ciudad de Lima, meses claves para acumular ingresos para mantener su familia durante el año y ahorrar. Durante los años anteriores mayormente ha sembrado hortalizas y flores, después los comercializaba en los mercados de la ciudad de Tarma, y con esas ganancias pudo construir su casa, donde ahora sus hijos gozan de la comodidad de su hogar, por ello es que ahora va volver a sembrar flores con las semillas que nos muestra en la foto. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, y durante los ciclos que viene trabajando ha demostrado puntualidad en los pagos a su banco comunal, y para este préstamo seguirá trabajando con la  misma responsabilidad. Con el dinero que solicita comprará fertilizantes químicos para la siembra de flores y hortalizas.
texts.en:
Gloria is 32 years old and is a very peaceful person who lives with her couple and father of her two children at their home. Since she was a child she worked in the farm helping her parents, now with her own family, her work has increased as he has to prepare their meals after going to work at the farm. Gloria likes very much her work because it has provided good profit, specially during Holy Week for the flowers sale, and in January, February and march her vegetables get a very good price as it it summer in the city of Lima, those are key months to save profits in order to support her family during the year and save. During the previous years she farmed vegetables and flowers and then she sold them at the city of Tarma, and with those profits she was able to build her house, where her children now have the comfort of a home, this is why she wants to farm flowers again with the seed she shows us in the photo. This is the 5th loan with MFP and during the previous cycles she has paid on time to the community bank, and she will keep on working with responsibility. With the money she is requesting she will buy chemical fertilizers for her flowers and vegetables.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizaers

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.en:
N. Shuhrat is 37 years old. He is married with 4 children. Shuhrat is dedicated to his agricultural business. Having little knowledge in the beginning, he had to learn a lot about farming. As of now, he has acquired fair experience in agriculture. Currently, Shuhrat is very happy and his 4 children are the motivation for his desire to grow his business. He approached IMON International to obtain a loan to buy more ingredients, including seeds and fertilizer to sow a good harvest to help him take care of his children and home.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
When Jenny first started selling beauty products, she didn’t realize how beneficial having a flexible schedule would be for her. She had her first baby in February 2009 and it quickly became clear that as a single mom, being able to make her own schedule and bring her baby with her would prove invaluable. Jenny has sold beauty products for two years now and has been steadily building up her client base. 

She would like a $750 loan from ACCION USA to make a bulk order of new and popular merchandise that will allow her to build up her business equity. This way she will be able to create steady income and to provide for herself and her baby. Although sales have been good and have gone back up after the birth of her child, she realizes that to be more profitable, she needs to have the products on hand. In the past, without a proper inventory, she has lost out on sales and potential clients. 

Jenny gives her clients the best service possible and helps build awareness of the benefits of her products by giving facial demonstrations. Her customers have responded well to the new costume jewelry she has begun selling and she looks forward to incorporating other products.

loans.use: To purchase more beauty products in bulk

loans.name: George William's Group

texts.en: George William L. is the leader of the Kyaterekera group in Lugazi. He is 68 years old and married with 10 children aged 10 to 45 years, of which 4 are still in school. He also cares for 6 dependants. George is a farmer and deals in the sale of produce. In addition, he has been selling fish for 6 years in Sanga, Mabira Township. He is able to make a weekly profit of  about 30,000 and this is mainly due to his experience, quality supplies and good customer handling. He plans to own a market stall with a hope of making more money. He would like to build a better family house and ensure that all his children are educated. He needs a loan to increase his capital and purchase more stock for his business.

loans.use: Buying more produce and fish for resale.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 33-year-old married man with two children. He has owned a car-repair shop since 2007 and draws customers from his own and neighboring villages. Mohamad is applying for a loan of $1,000 to buy additional supplies for his shop, and to satisfy the needs of his customers.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies for a car-repair shop

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris A. is from the village of Liposong, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old. Doris is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Doris owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising poultry. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising chickens for sale. Doris has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 20000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Doris joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Doris is requesting a new loan of 50000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Doris from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Mirzoali

texts.en:
Since he was very young, N. Mirzoali has dedicated himself to the raising of livestock. He is a married father who needs to support his children though they no longer need his help to complete their studies. His wife also helps him with the business. Mirzoali is faced with the need is to purchase calves. In order to then commercialize the derivative products, the raised animals are sold to farmers who resupply the small farmers with calves. To acquire the animals, Mirzoali comes to IMON International to obtain the necessary credit to purchase them and in this way continue to maintain his dear home.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing calves

loans.name: Viselyn

texts.en: A rice farmer in the town of Magsaysay, Veruela, Agusan Del Sur, Viselyn C. seeks additional financial support to help sustain her farm. She is 30 years old and has been the program they are offering, especially the low interest rates or borrowing and the savings policy. She applied for PHP6,000 to purchase farm supplies.

loans.use: Farm Financing.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To pay for new walls and a ceiling in her home and business

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en: Cresencia A. is from the village of Catuan, Lunao, Gingoog City. She is 40 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Cresencia owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years. In 2009, Cresencia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Cresencia is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Modou

texts.fr:
M. Modou B. est une tailleur experiencé à Baye Laye, une quartier de Guediwawe, une banlieue de Dakar.  Le tailleur est un métier qu'il a aimé à bas age, même s'il y a été former pour être commerçant, il a choisi son métier.  Il est active dans le métier depuis 1990.  

M. B. voudrais compléter le construction de la plafond de sa maison laquelle il a acheté en 2007.  La maison a 150 m2, avec quatre chambres, une cuisine et la toilette.  Il va habiter à la maison avec sa femme et ses deux enfants.  Cette pret est le deuxieme pour M. B..

Merci pour votre soutien d'UIMCEC!  Rejoignez-vous notre équipe Team Taff Taff 
www.kiva.org/team/tafftaff
texts.en:
M. Modou Bodine is an experienced tailor in Baye Laye, a neighborhood of Guediwawe, a suburb of Dakar. The work of a tailor is what he liked at a young age even though he had been trained to be a trader, he prefered his work. He is active in the work since 1990. Mr B. would like to complete the roof of his house which he bought in 2007. The house is 150 m2 with four rooms, a kitchen and toilet. He is going to live in the house with his wife and two children. This is the second loan for Mr. B.. UIMCEC thanks you for your support! . Join our team, Team Taff Taff at www.kiva.org/team/tafftaff

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Roof construction

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: Mrs. Lem K. lives in Krang Banteay village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land and cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Paen Phat, is a plow maker. Since his business is doing well, he wants to expand it. In order to do this, Mrs. Lem K. decided to ask for a loan to buy raw materials for her husband to make more plows to sell. She is 39 years old and the mother of four children: one is a construction worker while the others are attending the local school. Her husband is present in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her husband to make more plows to sell

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida C.'s main source of income comes from a phone retailing business. She is 54 years old, married and has five grown-up children. She is from the city of Cataggaman Nuevo, Tuguegarao City. Zenaida is just starting this business.

Zenaida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Zenaida is requesting a new loan of 13,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her seventh loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios C., 58, is busy managing her variety store and computer café. A mother of one and married to Alfredo C., she finds pleasure in making her business a lot better by expanding her product line whenever she has the chance.

Remedios has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than three years now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to take out a loan nine times in CCT’s Cooperative. The reason why she was consistent in paying her loans was because she used almost all the money she loaned to buy additional stock for her variety store .

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 16,000 loan. This amount will be mostly used as a source of additional capital to her expanding business by buying additional stocks like snacks, beverages and other household commodities. 

She dreams that her business will continue to grow through God’s blessing and prays for good family relationships.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks like snacks, beverages and other household commodities.

loans.name: Annalyn

texts.en: Annalyn D. is from the village of Binuangan, Misamis Oriental. She is 30 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Annalyn owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling different spices like garlic, black pepper and more in the local community. She is just starting this business. In 2009, Annalyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Flamboyan Group

texts.en:
The Flamboyan Group consists of 11 members, all women who have married. Their ages range between 25 and 50 years. They have two to four children each. Their children's education levels range between elementary school through high school. One woman has been able to finance her child's university education. 

This group proposed a loan of Rp. 11,000,000 and each member will receive Rp. 1,000,000. This loan will be used to buy piglets and pig food. The group is chaired by Ni Kade Citra Dewi. They hold monthly meetings to share information about their businesses, to collect savings and as a social gathering.

Note to Kiva Lenders: This group uses a community lending model (commonly referred to as village banking) that is very common throughout Asia. In this model, a select number of group representatives will take out a large loan on behalf of their entire group (often an entire village). They will then distribute and manage the loan and collect repayments for the lender. This is a common and efficient practice in the region, but it makes reporting on Kiva somewhat unusual. Unlike most other loans, Kiva’s partner MUK will be in contact primarily with the group representatives who in turn will be overseeing the end borrowers.  As such, journal updates likely will reflect the performance of the lending group rather than the individual end borrowers. This collection of 11 women is a subset of a larger 60-woman community loan that is being offered by MUK.

To learn more about village banking on Wikipedia, please copy and paste this URL into a new browser window: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Village_Banking

loans.use: Used to buy piglets and pig food

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
El señor Rafael Riquelme  tiene 63 años , es casado tienen tres hijos adultos, con quines trabajan en el Taller confeccionando Escobas de Pajas este trabajo los viene realizando desde hace mas de 30 años con su familias pero ya desde joven trabajaba con su Padre de quien Heredo este oficio .
Aporte de sus hijos estan trabajando 2 personas  mas con ellos    o sea  da mano de obra a dos familias mas..La idea de el es ir creciendo el Taller ya que su producto tiene mucha salida y pesar  de la competencia con la esobas de plasticos.
texts.en:
Rafael is 63 years old. He is married and has three adult children who work with him in his shop making straw brooms. He has been doing this with his family for more than 30 years and, as a child, he used to work with his father, from who he inherited this business. Besides his children, two other persons work in his shop, so it provides work for two families. His goal is to continue to grow the shop, now that his brooms are selling well, despite the competition from plastic brooms.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for manufacture of brooms

loans.name: Savet

texts.en:
Mrs. Savet K. (in the photo), 57, and her husband, Mr. Sam-ol Chab, 61, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 1971 and have 8 children: 2 sons and 6 daughters. Four of them are married and live in separate homes, and two are garment factory workers. The other two are in school. One weaves silk at home and another is a construction worker. 

Savet has been a silk weaver since she was 22 years old. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh market. Her husband also works. She is requesting a loan of US$ 800 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Esperanza Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Esperanza del Carmen H. T. tiene una propiedad ubicada en una comunidad que se llama la labranza a unos 20 km del municipio  de Condega ella se dedica a actividades de trabajo agrícolas por las condiciones y características de la finca que son aptas para el cultivo de granos básicos y cultivos de riego.
El financiamiento lo utilizara para la compra de insumos agrícolas 4 quintales de abono 4 quintales de urea y pago de mano de obra ya que estos productos son los más caros que ella tiene que comprar, ella quiere comprar estos productos para aplicarlos y darle la asistencia en insumos a su cultivo y así poder sembrar y asegurar la cosecha de este cultivo del tomate, doña Esperanza del Carmen H. comenzó su actividad de trabajo sembrando únicamente granos básicos 2 manzanas de frijol y 2 manzanas de maíz, con la ganancia de esto ella ha venido invirtiendo para poder realizar esta otra actividad de cultivos de riego que es más costosa pero como es semi tecnificado se garantiza mas la cosecha. Antes y ahora ósea todo el tiempo se ha dedicado a esta actividad de trabajo ya que ella vive en el campo y es la única alternativa de trabajo que tiene en el lugar donde ella vive, en lo que ella ha venido mejorando es que antes solamente sembraba granos básicos frijol y maíz en épocas de invierno y ahora siempre continua sembrando este mismo tipo de cultivo y también cultivos de riegos semi tecnificado como es el cultivo del tomate. Con la siembra de este cultivo de riego ella espera mejorar su actividad de trabajo hasta llegar  alcanzar y tener una actividad  más diversificada y tecnificada de sus  cultivos, para poder asegurar más sus cosechas. Doña esperanza es una señora que trabaja con la ayuda de su familia ella es casada y su marido le ayuda en la labores del campo y siembra de estos cultivos, tiene tres hijos que están estudiando la primaria y le ayudan también a trabajar ya que a estos sus padres les enseñan tradicionalmente desde la infancia a los trabajos agrícolas de campo. Doña Esperanza tiene 4 años de trabajar con Ceprodel y en todo ese tiempo se le han otorgado 5 créditos para este mismo rubro de trabajo. 
El impacto que ella ha tenido con estos créditos que se le han dado es bastante considerable y de mucha importancia ya que esto le ha permitido mejorar su forma de trabajo y a la vez esto le genera más ingresos a ella y su familia mejorando su nivel de vida o permitiéndole al menos tener un poco de condiciones mas dignas para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Doña Esperanza del Carmen H. T. has a parcel of land in a community called La Labranza, 20 kilometers from the town of Condega. She works in agriculture, since the conditions and features of her farm are suitable for the cultivation of staple grains and irrigated crops. She will use her financing to buy agricultural supplies--400 pounds of fertilizer and 400 pounds of urea--as well as to pay for labor, since these are the most expensive products she has to buy. She wants to buy them in order to enrich her crops and guarantee the harvest of the tomatoes she sows. At first, Doña Esperanza del Carmen H. grew staple crops like beans and corn, but as her profits increased, she's invested in order to be able to grow irrigated crops. Those crops are more expensive but, since they're semi-technified, their harvests are more reliable. Up to this point she has put all her efforts into this business, since she lives in the country and it's the only work option she has in her area. She has made good progress, since at first she only grew staple crops like beans and corn during the rainy season, and now in addition to those crops she sows irrigated crops like tomatoes. By cultivating irrigated crops, she hopes to improve her business and be able to grow a wider variety of produce, using more technology to make her harvests more reliable. Doña Esperanza depends on her family's help with the business. She is married and her husband works with her in the fields and sows the crops. Her three children also help her when they're not in school, since she and her husband have been teaching them about cultivating crops since they were very young. Doña Esperanza has been working with Ceprodel for four years, during which time she's received five loans for the same purpose. The difference these loans has made has been considerable and very important, since they've permitted her to improve her business and generate more income for her family, raising their standard of living or at least allowing them more decent living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase agricultural supplies: 400 pounds of fertilizer and 400 pounds of urea, plus manpower, for growing tomatoes

loans.name: Mwatu

texts.en: Mwatu is 36 years old and married with two children who go to school. He has been running a retail shop where he sells general merchandise such as cooking fat, sugar, soaps, maize flour, rice, plastic containers and energy-saving jikos. He has been involved in this business for three years and has two employees. He rears animals together with his wife to improve their living standards. He hopes to grow his business and also add more cattle in the future. He has requested for a loan from Faulu Kenya to add stock of maize flour and rice.

loans.use: To buy maize flour and rice

loans.name: Men

texts.en: Mrs. Men K. is a 48 year-old, married woman who resides in a district of Phnom Penh city in Cambodia. She sells pork to earn a living. She has had this job for years. She has a life partner in her husband who is a chef for wedding parties. The couple is blessed with six children: three are married and three are unmarried. To help be responsible for the family, three of the children are working at different jobs. Men K. is applying for a loan to improve the financial capital of her pork sale business.

loans.use: To provide additional capital

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luís tiene 40 años de edad, es soltero, no tiene hijos, vive en casa de su madre. El 
se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte ya dedicándose a esta actividad hace 4 
años. El tiene amplia experiencia en el servicio, brindándole buen servicio y 
seguridad, en la actualidad también se esta dedicando a la comercialización de pecana, 
el compra por huertas y la cosecha, el sueño de Luís es tener mayores ingresos 
y así poder seguir ayudando a su madre a la construcción de su vivienda, antes de 
poder iniciar su familia, solicita el crédito para la compra de una huerta de pecana 
de cerca de 10 plantas.
texts.en:
Luis is 40 years old, single, and has no children. He lives in his mother's house. He has been providing transportation services for 4 years. He has a lot of experience doing this; he provides good service and security. Currently he also sells pecans, which he buys from the orchards during the harvest. Luis dreams of having a better income. This way he could continue helping his mother with the construction of her house before starting his own family. He requests a loan to buy a pecan orchard nearby with 10 plants.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a pecan orchard

loans.name: Mujeres Progresando Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres Progresando”  cumple actualmente su 9no ciclo, sus integrantes  ya se desenvuelven cada una en su propia microempresa.
Una de las microempresarias es la señora Rossana quien posee una tienda donde vende todo tipo de artículos.
Actualmente quiere invertir en su negocio, pero como cuenta con otros gastos familiares solicita el préstamo para cubrirlos.
Ella se dedica a su casa y a su negocio mientras que el marido se dedica a la construcción y plomería,  los dos desean mucho ampliar  el negocio para obtener mejor ganancia y de esa manera mejorar la vivienda que actualmente tienen.  
Todas las integrantes procuran por que desean que sus hijos puedan optar por una buena educación y posteriormente un obtener un empleo por eso agradecen a la Fundación por el apoyo recibido.
texts.en:
The committee “Mujeres Progresando” (Women in Progress) is currently completing its ninth cycle, and its members are all doing very well with their micro-businesses. One of the micro-entrepreneurs is Mrs. Rossana, who has a store where she sells all types of goods. Currently, she wants to invest in her business, but since she has other family expenses, she’s asking for a loan to cover these investments. She takes care of her house and her business while her husband takes care of the construction and plumbing. Both of them really want to grow the business to earn more profits, and in this way make improvements to their home. All the members work hard because they want their children to be able to receive a good education and, later, get a good job. This is why they thank the Foundation for the help they receive.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal expenses, gas and light bills

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita M. is from the village of Little Tadian. She is 50 years old. Merlita is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Merlita owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Merlita has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3500 PHP when she sells her raised pigs.

In 2010, Merlita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Merlita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of the borrower's children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita M. is a married woman who lives in Prk 2, Barangay Basak, Cauayan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures:  Food vending and farming. Her husband Romeo M., who is 56 years old, works as a farmer and welder to earn his living.  He also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have 5 children who range in age from 17 to  28 years old. 

Teresita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family.  With the help of her past 10 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Teresita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 28,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, improving the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 11th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500, which she intends to use to buy ingredients and fertilizer so that she can continue to save to expand her land holdings and buy more livestock in the future.

Teresita M. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through this program, NWTF is empowering women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To save toward expanding land holdings and buying livestock.

loans.name: Chhut

texts.en:
Mrs. H. is 46 years of age and lives in a village located in the rural area of Siem Reap province. She weaves thatch to sell to earn her living. The product is used to cover houses. 

H. has been depending on the income from her husband’s job fishing along the river. The couple has two single children, while another three are now married. H. is taking out her first loan in order to buy extra materials for their fishing operation.

loans.use: To buy extra materials for fishing operation.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary J. is currently in the business of brewing and selling local alcohol (siko) and beer at a bar and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell. Mary is 45 years old and widowed. She has seven children and three of her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build another bar in a different location.

loans.use: Stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Sope Sa Jeker Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOPE SA JEKER est né le 20 décembre 2009. Il est composé de 05 femmes issues du même village. Elles se sont organisées par voisinage et par affinité. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageoise de KOUNOUNE AIR France

Madame SAKOU K. à droite de la photo, levant la main gauche, est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 39 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants en charge.

Elle développe un petit commerce de vaisselles et de tissus. Elle pratique cette activité depuis son adhésion dans le Banc Villageois.

Son objectif est de participer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille. Elle soutient son mari dans la prise en charge financière de la famille.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Sope Sa Jeker was created on December 20, 2009. It is composed of five women living in the same village. They have decided to form a group together because they are friends and neighbors. The group belongs to the Banc Villageois of Kounoune Air France. Mrs. Sakou Kanei, to the far right in the photo and raising her left hand, is the group’s leader. She is 39 years old. She is married and the mother of five dependent children. Her business is selling dishes and textiles. She has been in this line of business since joining Banc Villageois. Her goal is to help improve her family’s life conditions. She helps her husband provide for the family needs.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing textiles and dishes

loans.name: Gissell Norvelia

texts.es: La señora Gissell Norvelia, inicio su negocio con su esposo de venta de artículos ferreteros desde hace de 5 años, en los cuales ofrece: repuestos para bicicletas, motos, materiales de construcción y artículos varios. Ella siempre está pendiente de los que sus diferentes clientes le solicitan, es así que los atrae todos los días. Tiene un hijo pequeño a su cargo. Necesita de un financiamiento para la compra de más artículos y poder mejorar las ventas, con las ganancias del negocio mantiene el hogar y la educación de su hijo.
texts.en:
Señora Gissell Norvelia, along with her husband, started her hardware business five years ago. She sells bicycle and scooter spare parts, construction materials, and various other items. She always takes notice of what her customers are asking for, and that’s what attracts them to her store. Gissell has a young son. She needs a loan to buy more products so she can increase sales. With the money she earns she will support the household and pay for her son’s education.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.es: Vladimir B. Ávila, tiene la edad de 20 años, es soltero y no tiene hijos a su cargo pues vive con su madre. El quiere comprar matas de café para resembrar una parte de su terreno en producción y sembrar una parte que está en buenas condiciones. Así puede explotar al máximo su finca y generarse unas ganancias para su bienestar. Además, su finca  cuenta con una parte de café que está en malas condiciones por falta de las lluvias fuertes este año la cual quiere mejorar. Tiene varios años que se dedica a su finca y quiere crecer. Es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no tenía problemas en su propiedad, pero si tiene el deseo de que sea una finca productiva y de buenas condiciones para la producción. También, el no ha realizados otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le brindó el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de interés es mucho más baja. El también tiene el deseo de superarse como persona y como productor de café, y a su vez ir generando ganancias para su bienestar personal y el de su madre en el futuro.
texts.en:
Vladimir B. Ávila, 20, is single and has no children; he lives with his mother. He wants to buy coffee plants to replant in part of his farmlands that are in good condition. This way he can get the most out of his farm and earn profits for his wellbeing. In addition, part of the area of his farm planted with coffee is in poor condition due to the extreme drought this year and he’d like to improve it. He has devoted several years to his farm and he’d like to see it develop. This is the first loan he’s gotten from FUDECOSUR. He didn’t have problems on his property but he does wish it to be a productive farm with good conditions for production. Also, he’s never had any other loans with state banks. FUDECOSUR, however, offered the loan with easier terms and a much lower interest rate. He also wants to better himself both as a person and as a coffee grower as well as to generate income for his personal and his mother’s wellbeing in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For coffee planting.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La Sra. Juana es cliente antigua D. emprender desD. el año 2002,ella trabajo con el grupo solidario wilacota en 9 secuencias ,posteriormente se individualizó siendo esta su 6ta secuencia la Sra. tiene un negocio D. venta D. verduras  por mayor  y menor, ella es productora, tiene tierras D. cultivo  en su pueblo  Cohoni por el lado D. Palca y con los créditos  que solicito en emprender logro construir su casa, también  se debe señalar que  la Sra.  Mantiene  a su  nieta la misma que quedo huérfana  a la  cual hace estudiar, su esposo es jardinero en una casa D. Achumani, la Sra. Necesita el crédito para comprar verduras por cantidad y así poder  incrementar su capital, razón por la cual  solicita este financiamiento kiva.
texts.en:
Juana is a former Emprender client. Since 2002, she worked with the Grupo Solidario Wilacota through 9 loan cycles. Later, she became independent and this is now her 6th loan cycle. Juana sells vegetables, both wholesale and retail. She is a producer and she has her own farming lands in her town, Cohoni, located in the municipality of Palca. With the loans requested at Emprender, she was able to build her house. It should also be noted that Juana is responsible for her granddaughter who became an orphan. Her granddaughter currently studies. Her husband is a gardener at a house in Achumani. Juana needs this loan to purchase vegetables by quantity so that she can increase her capital, which is why she is requesting this funding through Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase vegetables

loans.name: Ana Estela

texts.es:
En la localidad el Cadí de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal Nueva Ilusión.

La señora Ana tiene 46 años y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la que tiene 5 hijos, dos de ellos ya son mayores de edad pero  aún viven con ella y estudian en Universidad, sus hijos menores  estudian en el colegio. Su marido es taxista.

Es una ama de casa que al ver que a su marido no le alcanza para los gastos familiares ha decidido poner una pequeña tienda de víveres de consumo en su casa, ha adecuado las perchas las cuales las mando a hacer de madera y solo le falta surtirla de los productos de primera necesidad, tiene sus ahorros  que los va a invertir en esto pero no le alcanza, es para esto que solicito el crédito, para comprar lo necesario para surtir su tienda.

Está en el Banco Comunal hace tres ciclos y le ha gustado las charlas.
 
Sus sueños son tener una casa bien construida ya que la que tiene es de caña y que su tienda tenga el éxito.
texts.en:
The district of Cadi, Colon in the city of Portoviejo is a well known for its dedicated and hardworking population made up of mostly agriculturists and farmers. The members of the community bank Nueva Ilusion meets every two weeks.

Ana is 46 years old and she lives with her boyfriend. Together they have 5 children, two of them are grown but they still live with her and are attending university. Her youngest children are in school. Her partner is a taxi driver. 

She is a stay at home Mom but she noted that her husband does not make enough money to cover the family's expenses. She decided to set up a small grocery store in her home.  She has had display cases made up of wood and the only thing she's missing is to stock the store with basic needs items. She has some savings that she will use to this end but it will not be enough for her goal. For this reason she requests a loan, to purchase the necessary merchandise to stock the store. 

She has been a member of this community bank for the past three loan cycles and she has greatly enjoyed the information sessions.

Her dream is to have her home in a good state of repair. Her home is made of sugar canes and he dreams of having a successful store.

loans.use: To purchase basic grocery store items.

loans.name: Rejoice

texts.en: Rejoice R. is currently in the business of selling fish and onions at the market and is requesting a loan to stock tomatoes to sell.  Rejoice is 30 years old and is married to a farmer. She has no children yet.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a restaurant.

loans.use: Stock tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Elshad

texts.en: Elshad K. is a 53 year-old farmer who breeds sheep and cows in the region of Agsu. He is married and has four children. He started his business in 2005 and since that time he is doing very well serving meat to the local people. Meat is very popular among Azerbaijani people as they use it in everyday cuisine. This business generates his main income, but he also has a small grocery store. He already took a loan from KIVA through AqroInvest and successfully repaid it. Now he applied for a 1000 AZN loan to purchase more cattle and sheep.

loans.use: To purchase 10 sheep and one cow

loans.name: Huoy's Group

texts.en:
These four members make up a group loan in Ba Noy village,Takeo province. All the members will use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their family living. 

Mrs. Huoy H. is the group leader. She was born in 1962, has been selected by the other members. She and her husband, Mr. Seng Kul, are farmers who own a two-hectare plot of land to grow rice that they sell to support their family. This is the growing season so Mrs. Huoy H. would like to request a loan to support her farming this year. She is a mother of four children; two of whom are employed ina  garment factory, while the others are students.

loans.use: To support their farming business

loans.name: Florence Muthoni

texts.en:
Florence has been selling clothes and teddy bears in Naivasha town since 2005.  She is 43 years old, married to Stephen Karanja and they have three children.

She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her third loan.  She paid back all her previous loans on time.  She plans to use the loan to buy more clothes to sell as her stock has gone down.

In the future, Florence hopes to open up a boutique and start selling new clothes of all types.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell as her stock has gone down.

loans.name: Deth

texts.en:
Deth T. presently earns her income by weaving bamboo baskets at her house for sale.  She sells her finished products to buyers who come directly to her house.  She makes over 50 sets of baskets before selling out.  She also orders baskets from the other villagers and sells them to make additional income. 

Her husband helps her buy the raw materials and weaves baskets.  Recently, Deth T. also became a domestic rice trader.  She buys rice in bulk from people who live in the village and then she stores the rice in her stock supply in order to sell it to gain at a profit.  Due to the fact that the rice-harvesting season is coming, Deth T. has decided to seek a loan from Kiva for capital to buy more rice during the time when rice is commanding its lowest price. Then she will sell it later when the price is higher.

loans.use: To buy more rice during the time when rice is commanding its lowest price. Then she will sell it later when the price is higher.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 37-year-old single woman living with her parents and 3 siblings. She is from Lebanon. She contributes, together with her father and brothers, to meeting the family income goal. She worked in a clothing shop for more than 5 years and in 2008 she opened her own clothing store. She purchases her products from a local clothing center.

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy clothes in various designs and models so she can offer her clients a wide choice which will expand her profitability.

loans.use: buy clothes in various designs and models

loans.name: Annie Sumalpong's Group

texts.en:
Annie S. is from Cogon, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 22 years old and married with one school-age child. She is the group leader of this four-member group loan offered by PMPC. The official name of this borrowing group is Annie S.’s Group. 

To make a living, Annie sells fish. She has been engaged in her business for almost a year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Annie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP for additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. 

About Group Loans
In a group loan, each member of the group receives an individual loan but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

loans.use: for addtional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Mairambu's Group

texts.en:
Mairambu A. is the treasurer of this group. She is 52 and married. Together with her husband she has raised two daughters and a son. All the children are married and live separately with their families. Seven years ago, with the initial investment of 10,000 soms, the family bought a cow for breeding. Since that moment the family breeds livestock to earn money. With money received from the loan, Mairambu wants to purchase livestock. In the future she wants to enlarge her shed and expand her business.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Irenia

texts.es: La señora Irenia se dedica a la producción de leche la cual vende a una de sus vecinas quien comercializa el producto, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace diez años tiene vaquitas  que le regalaron su padres, el domicilio donde vive es de propiedad de sus padres y ella se encarga de cuidarlos por la avanzada edad de ellos, ella tiene una niña que se encuentra en edad escolar, solicita el crédito para compra de material de construcción para construir muralla alrededor de su domicilio, demostró buen comportamiento en la cancelación de su anterior crédito.
texts.en:
Sra. Irenia engages in milk production and sells her product to one of her neighbors for eventual resale. She has been in this business for ten years. Irenia has cows that were given to her by her parents. The home where she lives is owned by her parents. She takes care of her parents since they are elderly. Irenia has a daughter who is of school age.

She is requesting a loan to buy construction materials to build a wall around her home. Irenia demonstrated good performance upon the repayment of her previous loan.

loans.use: Construction of a wall around her home

loans.name: Gina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MOSOQ ALLPA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Gina; La socia tiene 31años de edad, la socia  es conviviente,  tiene 1 hijo de 9 años,  la socia trabaja   junto  a su conyugue en el taller de mecánica, ella ayuda a su pareja en el taller  en diferentes actividades, la socia desea el préstamo para invertir en su vivienda y poder mejorarla. La socia desea el préstamo para invertir en la vivienda y poder mejorarla poco a apoco.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Gina is a member of the Communal Bank “Mosoq Allpa” which is located in the District of Huanchac, Province and Department of Cusco.
