De façon secondaire, Anne vend également des fagots de bois. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Anne achète ses produits. Anne est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, qui a toujours bien effectué ses remboursements. La clientèle de Anne s'accroit au jour le jour, et Anne n'arrive plus à satisfaire tous ses clients, compte tenu du peu de moyens financiers dont elle dispose. C'est donc pour renforcer son activité que Anne sollicite un autre prêt.
texts.en:
Anne B. G. has lived in the Irédé neighborhood of Cotonou, the economic capitol of Bénin for a decade. Married to Tidjani Raman, Anne is the mother of two children whom she sends to school. Anne lives with her husband and children. The couple shares the family responsibilities. Having never been to school, Anne was lead to the sale of corn and akassa (a local food made from a base of corn starch) from her home as a job. As a supplemental income, Anne also sells bundles of firewood. Anne buys her product at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Anne is a former client of ALIDé who has always well carried out her repayments. Anne's cliental increases from day to day, and she no longer manages to satisfy all of her customers considering the small amount of cash she has at her disposal. It is for this reason she would like to strengthen her business with another loan.

Translated from French by Colleen Creegan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of bags of corn

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en:
Sergei is married with one small daughter. He has a business selling cleaning supplies at a market in Nova Kahovka. Sergei started this business several years ago after he was unable to make enough as a farmer to support his family. He enjoys his business now because inventory sells quickly. Having many repeat clients ensures the sales.

Sergei is requesting a loan of 20,000 UAH to help purchase new inventory to sell. He wants to increase the assortment to be able to increase his sales. He hopes to receive additional income and spend it for his family needs.

loans.use: To increase the assortment for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is divorced and has a grown daughter. She sells toys and games at Angolenko market in Zaporozhye city. Galina owns two vending locations. She offers a flexible pricing policy and very friendly customer service which has helped her business grow and flourish. Galina has been in the trade for 15 years. Currently, she has about 20,000 UAH in inventory. Her monthly profit is about 5,000 UAH. 

Galina is requesting a loan of 15,000 UAH to purchase water games for the summer season. As a good manager, she has succeeded in managing all of her previous loans and repaid all of them in a timely fashion. Galina is thankful for the opportunity to use KIVA loans because they strengthen her trade and provide an important profit margin to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase water games for summer season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy corn, firewood, lime, and ceramic hotplates.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret W. is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs in a restaurant in Konyokonyo market. She is requesting a loan to stock more foodstuffs to cook and sell in the restaurant.  Margret is 30 years old and is divorced. She has three children, who are all in school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a plot, build on it, and rent it out.

loans.use: Buy more foodstuffs

loans.name: Tatasuthekeh Group

texts.en:
Sallay K. (pictured second from left) is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Sallay was born in Mile 91, a small town in Northern Sierra Leone.  She is married with five children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are attending school – two in primary school and three in secondary school. Sallay has been a businesswoman for seventeen years now. Currently, Sallay sells ready-to-wear-clothes, shoes and locally produced food items. With a loan of SLL 1,000,000 she will buy the above-mentioned items wholesale to add to her current stock.

This is not the first loan that members of this group have enjoyed from SMT/Kiva lenders. Previous Kiva loans have created significant impacts in the lives of these borrowers. Having repaid their last loan successfully, they are again seeking a new loan of SLL 1,000,000. With the help of this loan, they will be able to further expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve their living conditions.

loans.use: Buy ready-to-wear-clothes, shoes and locally produced food items

loans.name: David Salomon

texts.es:
Don David es padre de familia de dos hijos, casado y con un pequeño negocio de soldadura que viene realizando desde joven ya que su padre le enseño a trabajar para ganarse el pan de cada día.
Durante varios años trabajo con herramientas prestada, por no tener el dinero con que comprarla lo que abecés se le hacia difícil.
Es por eso nace la iniciativa de hacer  un financiamiento en donde le permitiera poder realizarse mejor a través de la compra de sus herramientas.
Hoy en día tiene su propio soldador, herramientas, para trabajar, lo que esta contento ya que ha sido gracias a los préstamos que ha logrado fortalecer su negocio.
Con esta solicitud comprara materia prima para lograr la elaboración de soldadura.
Sus planes es poder hacer mejoras a su casa, lo cual no ha podido ya que con los trabajos que hace solo ha podido cubrir la alimentación y otros. Pero que espera tener mejores proyecciones para este año próximo.
texts.en:
David is married and the father of two children. He has a small welding business, which he has been operating since he was a young man, because his father taught him to work to earn his daily bread. For several years, he worked with borrowed tools, because he did not have the money to buy them, which sometimes made things difficult for him. For this reason, he came up with the idea to take out a loan which would permit him to advance in his business by purchasing his own tools. Today, he has his own welding machine and other tools to work with, and he is happy that thanks to the loans, he has been able to strengthen his business. With this loan, he will buy supplies to prepare materials for welding. His plans are to carry out improvements to his home, which he has not been able to do, since he has only been able to cover food and other expenses with his work. However, he hopes to have better prospects for the coming year.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying supplies for his welding business, so he can do more work and pay for food and other expenses

loans.name: El Panama Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Panama se encuentra conformado por tres mujeres luchadoras y con distintas actividades económias, María Auxiliadora Sánchez P. se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y de ropa interior de manera ambulante, Ana del Rosario C. G. vende repuestos para bicicleta en su casa de habitación y Rebeca M. vende ropa interior de manera ambulante en las calles de Ticuantepe.
texts.en:
The Panama communal bank’s members are three tenacious women who have different economic activities. María Auxiliadora Sánchez P. is a roving cosmetics and underwear merchant. Ana del Rosario C. Gutiérrez sells bicycle replacement parts from home. Rebeca Martínez is a roving underwear merchant throughout Ticuantepe’s streets.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products.

loans.name: Camilo Jose

texts.es: Camilo José de 26 años, vende plata tiene 1 hijo menor de 7 años que está a su cargo. Comenzó a vender porque su esposa se hacía cargo del negocio luego ella consiguió un trabajo y juntos deciden que Camilo se haga cargo del negocio invirtiendo sus ahorros. El es un hombre muy trabajador y que disfruta de su trabajo, por la buena clientela continua con su negocio hasta ahora trabaja. Para mejorar sus ventas él quiere con el financiamiento comprar pulseras, cadenas, aretes, anillos entre otras cosas. En el futuro quiere que su negocio crezca y que su hijo termine los estudios con éxito.
texts.en:
26-year old Camilo José sells silver jewelry. He provides for his young son aged seven. Originally his wife was in charge of the business, but when she found other work, they decided that Camilo would take over and invest his savings. He is a very hardworking man who enjoys his work because of the good customers that he has. In order to improve sales, he wishes to use the loan to buy bracelets, chains, ear-rings, rings etc. He would like to see his business expand in the future, and he hopes that his son will complete his education successfully.

Translated from Spanish by Jane A, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina V. is from the village of Cabisera 27. She is 50 years old, married and has one adult child. To make a living, Marina owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Marina has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Marina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. As with her previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI which she has successfully repaid, this new loan of 5,000 PHP will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fifth loan that Marina has taken out from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and north-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Globena

texts.en:
Globena R. is from the village of Tambagan, Gingoog City. She is 39 years old. She has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Globena owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as sweet bananas, breads, and biscuits in the local community. Globena has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Globena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Globena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Globena is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and build working capital. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Globena from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and build working capital

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
Adelfa U. is from the village of Lagonglong, Misamis Oriental. She is 44 years old and married with four adult children. To make a living, Adelfa owns a retail store selling of bananas and coconuts. Adelfa has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Adelfa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from HSPFI and is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Adelfa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: working capital to purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Lun

texts.en:
Lun R., 28, is married and resides with his wife and three children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, an area known for being the most populated city in the country. R. is a "tuk-tuk" driver, earning an income of about USD 7 each per day. His wife is a nail decorator, earning an income of about USD 2.50 per day. R. has to spend USD 75 on food, USD 20 on electricity and water, and USD 30 on other necessary expenses every month. 

R. is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase a new motorbike to improve his business. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to repair his house.  This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a new motorbike to improve the current business

loans.name: Sabira's Group

texts.en:
Sabira K. is the leader of this group.  She is 68 and married. Her husband is retired so he has free time, which he spends breeding cattle. Sabira has five daughters and three sons. All the children are married and live separately with their families, except the youngest son. In order to make money, the family breeds cattle and earns 5,000 KGS monthly reselling them after they are fattened. With money received from this loan, Sabira wants to purchase more cattle to resell.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Kheav

texts.en: Kheav K. is a 50-year-old married woman who has been living in Kompong Tom Province. Kheav K. owns a piece of land that she inherited from her grandparent. She and her husband grow rice crops and cashews, which they will sell to buyers every two or three months when the plants mature. The couple has six children, four of whom are single, and the remaining two are married. They have had great success growing cashews, which is an annual process. For earning more profit, Kheav K. would like to request a loan as capital to buy more cashew seeds for ongoing planting.

loans.use: To buy more cashew seeds to plant

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
Ana Isabel V. A. tiene 24 años y vive con su esposo en el cantón de Babahoyo en la provincia de Los Ríos. Ella tiene dos hijos: Jostin Javier Vaicilla V. de 6 años y Edgar Daniel Vaicilla V. de 1 año.

Ana Isabel es miembro de la ventanilla rural Unidos Somos Más. Esta nueva ventanilla hace parte de la comunidad Matilde Esther en la provincia de Guayas. Esta comunidad esta ubicada a 2 horas de la oficina de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. El grupo cuenta con 23 socios y se dedican a diferentes actividades como agricultura, cría de ganados y pequeños restaurantes y comedores.   

Ana Isabel se dedica a quehaceres domésticos. Ella solicita el crédito para poner su negocio propio. El préstamo ayuda a mejorar la situación económica de su familia. 

El sueño de Ana Isabel es aumentar su negocio para poder mejorar el estado económico de su familia y en especial sus hijos. El mayor desafío que ella y su familia enfrenta es la carencia del dinero.

En su tiempo libre le gusta salir a caminar y hacer repostería.
texts.en:
Ana Isabel V. A. is 24 years old and lives with her husband in Babahoyo canton, in Los Ríos province.  She has two children: 6 year-old Jostin Javier Vaicilla V. and 1 year-old Edgar Daniel Vaicilla V.. 

Ana Isabel is a member of the 'Unidos Somos Más' (United We Are Stronger) rural loan group.  This new group is located in the community of Matilde Esther, in Guayas province, 2 hours from our Chillanes office in Bolívar province.  The group has 23 members who work in different business activities such as farming, livestock raising and running small restaurants and eateries.

Ana Isabel does household chores.  She is requesting this loan to set up her own business.  The loan will help to improve her family's finances.  Ana Isabel's dream is to increase her business so that she can improve her family's economic situation and particularly that of her children.  The greatest challenge she and her family face is a lack of money.  In her spare time she likes going for walks and making confectionery.

loans.use: To set up her own business

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a thirty-four-year-old married man with three children living in his own permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda, with a dream of educating his children. For ten years he has been farming tea. He started by hiring land and now has his own. His main challenge is lack of enough funds and his future plan is to plant twenty more acres of tea.

loans.use: Planting tea

loans.name: Anelita

texts.en:
Anelita is a married woman who lives in Tanjay City, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating 2 businesses: dressmaking and buying and selling rice. Her husband, Rustico S., 57 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living. They have 6 children between the ages of 13 and 28. Anelita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she hoped for something better for her family. With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon and her own efforts, Anelita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty. Her previous loan of PHP 16,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,000, raising the family's standard of living.

For her 17th loan, Anelita is borrowing PHP 19,000, which she intends to use to purchase more tailoring materials in order to save up for future food and education. Anelita is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to purchase more materials

loans.name: German

texts.es: El sr. German se dedica al transporte publico en una de las empresas de radio taxi de la zona sur actividad con la que mantiene a su hogar de dos hijos pequeños que están en edad escolar y la esposa que trabaja en una limpieza en la zona sur, con el dinero del credito comprara repuestos y llantas para su movilidad, por la zona se pudo verificar con los vecinos que los clientes son muy responsables y bastante trabajadores por lo que se hizo acreedor del fondo kiva, el Sr. German esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado
texts.en:
Señor German works in public transportation for a living for one of the radio taxi businesses in the south.  This allows him to support his two young, school age children and his wife who cleans for a living.  With the loan he will buy spare parts and tires for his vehicle.  In his district, his neighbors vouched for his responsible and hard-working customers so he was granted a Kiva loan.  

Señor German is grateful to the institution for the support offered.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts and tires for his car.

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion is a married woman who lives in Bais City, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by selling vegetables.  Her husband Hermoso, who is 56 years old, works as a vendor to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have six children who are between 13 and 34 years old.  Visitacion joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family.  With the help of her past eight loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Visitacion has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her ninth loan, she is borrowing PHP 24,000 to purchase more stock to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children.  Visitacion is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Akylai's Group

texts.en:
Akylai C., 43, is a leader of this group. She is a resident of Tashkomur. She is married and has three children, the oldest of whom is 16 years old. Akylai’s husband is employed in electrical maintenance, while her mother helps Akylai in feeding and raising cattle. The idea of raising and reselling cattle was not unique or creative, because that’s the major activity for all residents in a local area. The business was started 5 years ago with an initial capital of 4,000, and now it brings Akylai twice as much per month. Akylai gathered this group of entrepreneurs in order to purchase more cattle. The expected returns from the business can be spent on purchasing an automobile, a valuable gift for her husband. 


        --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en: Annabelle is 41 years old, married and has three children who range in age from 15 to 10. For the last three years, she has made a living as a rice farmer in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. She sells her rice in local markets and works very hard to support her family. Her goal in life is to make sure that her children finish college and have bright futures. She has applied for a loan to buy fertilizer and fuel for her tractor.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and gasoline.

loans.name: Mujeres Vencedoras Group

texts.es:
El comité fue formado gracias a la gestión de la señora Teresa Dávalos, integrante del comité Virgen de Fátima, domiciliada en el km 16 Acaray de Minga Guazú, Ciudad del Este, quien tiene muchas conocidas en la zona del km 22 de dicha ciudad, con quienes contactó para formar el comité en esa localidad.
El comité se denomina “Mujeres Vencedoras”, están en el Primer Ciclo con 12  integrantes. Es un grupo conformado por personas muy unidas, solidarias y responsables, las integrantes poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor, por lo que se comprometen en cumplir con cabalidad los compromisos asumidos con la Fundación;  desean realizar actividades de recaudación de fondos para ayudarse mutuamente. 
La sra.  María del Pilar se dedica a la venta de ropas, como Ciudad del Este es una ciudad comercial por excelencia, ella posee muchos clientes pero también mucha competencia, por eso dfesea poder comprar ropas de otoño – invierno para poder ofrecer las mejores prendas a sus consumidores.
Es una mujer con ganas de superarse y ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, en especial a sus hijos, demostrándoles que con esfuerzo todo se puede lograr.
texts.en:
The committee was formed thanks to the initiative of Mrs. Teresa Dávalos, a member of the Virgen de Fátima committee, located in Kilometer 16 Acaray de Minga Guazú, Ciudad del Este.  She has a lot of acquaintances in the Kilometer 22 zone of this city that she gathered together to form a committee in this location.

It’s called “Mujeres Vencedoras” (Triumphant Women) and they are in their first cycle with 12 members.  The group consists of very united, mutually supportive and responsible people.  They have a strong enterprising spirit and are committed to meet the responsibilities they’ve taken on with the Fundación.  They want to carry out fund raising activities to help each other out.

Mrs. María del Pilar sells clothing.  Because Ciudad del Este is a commercial city of note, she has many customers but also much competition.  Because of this she wants to buy fall-winter clothes in order to offer the best items to her consumers.

She is a woman with a desire to de better and provide a better quality of life for her family, especially her children, showing them that everything can be attained with effort.

loans.use: to buy fall-winter clothing.

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias is 29 years old and married. He and his wife do not yet have children. For the past two years, Elias has owned a general store where he sells sugar, cassava flour, and peanuts. His wife runs the business with him and the store allows them to easily meet their needs. 

Elias is requesting a loan to buy more food items such as cassava flour and peanuts to sell. With the profit he hopes to make, Elias would like to finalize the construction of his house.

loans.use: to buy food items such as cassava flour and peanuts to sell

loans.name: Jafar

texts.en:
Jafar is 36 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and mother. For more than 3 years, he has been selling cell phones and accessories. Jafar also has a good skills on the computer and provides a service  teaching computer programmers. Jafar believes that this business is profitable and the generated income allows him to support his family. 

Currently, his business is doing well, but Jafar needs to increase his stock of goods and also wants to buy a new computer in order to serve the demands of his clientele.   He requests 11,500 Somoni.  Jafar is grateful to all supporting him and promises to repay the loan promptly.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase cell phones and a computer.

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Chantal is 47 years old. She stays with her 6 year old granddaughter. She is separated from her husband. 

Chantal is very hardworking; she sells sorghum. She has sold sorghum for 2 years and her business is going on well. With the profits of her business she built her own family house. She is requesting a loan to buy more sorghum and to make more profits. With the profits, she plans to finish her house because some things are missing in her house.

loans.use: to buy sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martín de 30 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, ubicada en la zona rural del departamento de Lambayeque.  Los pobladores de ésta zona se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y turismo.

Martín maneja su mototaxi (transporte que se utiliza para movilizarse en distancias cortas, con un cupo máximo de 3 personas) desde hace 2 años aproximadamente, está actividad la realiza en la misma zona donde vive. A pesar de la gran cantidad de personas que realizan el mismo trabajo, el cuenta con clientes fijos que transporte desde muy temprano a sus diferentes destinos. Esto le permite a Martín contar con mayor cantidad de ingresos para solventar sus gastos y necesidades del hogar.

El crédito que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es de 1500 nuevos soles y su destino será para el mantenimiento y renovación de asientos y carpa que necesita su mototaxi para seguir brindando un buen servicio a su clientela y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  

Martín es una persona responsable y trabajadora  que tiene muchos deseos de darles a sus hijos un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Martín, 30, lives with is wife and children in his own house in the rural area of the department of Lambayeque.  The inhabitants in this area are involved mainly in agriculture, livestock farming and tourism.

Martín has been in the moto-taxi service (short-distance transportation for up to three people) for approximately two years.  He works in the same area where he lives, and despite the fact that there are many people active in this same type of work, he has fixed customers that rely on him from very early in the morning to get them to their respective destinations.  This gives Martín more income to cover his household needs and expenditures.

The loan in the amount of 1,500 PEN that he has requested through Edpyme Alternativa will be used for maintenance and renovation of the seats and top of his moto-taxi so he can continue providing optimum service to customers and improve his family's lifestyle.

Martín is a responsible, hard-working person who is intent on giving his children a better quality of life.

loans.use: To renovate his motorcycle seats.

loans.name: Brissawé

texts.fr:
Brissawé est une femme âgée de 38 ans. Elle est marié å un comptable. Ils ont deux enfants.
Brissawé a travaillé comme revendeuse depuis 1996. Elle vend de pagne et de bazin de façon ambulante. Elle achète les produits au Grand Marché de Lomé et au Mali.
Brissawé a requis son deuxième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter 10 paires de bazin riche.
texts.en:
Brissawé is a 38-year-old woman. She is married to an accountant. They have two children.
Brissawé has worked as a retailer since 1996. She sells pagnes (a type of brightly-printed West African cloth) and damask door-to-door. She buys her goods at the Grand Market in Lomé and in Mali.
Brissawé has requested her second loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners) in order to buy 10 sets of damask of the "riche" variety.

loans.use: To buy pagnes (a type of West African cloth) and damask.

loans.name: Fass Diom Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 22 juin 2010. Le groupe est  constitué de quinze femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Coura qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 54 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge cinq autres enfants confié par ses parents.

Elle s’active dans la vente de légumes et de beignet Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, car étant pratiquer depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was established on June 22, 2010. The group is made up of 15 women who live in the same neighborhood. Their primary occupation is small business.

Mrs. Coura, who is raising her hand at right in the photo, is the group's leader. She is 54 years old. She is married and the mother of three. She also cares for five other children entrusted to her by their parents.

She occupies herself with the sale of vegetables and fritters. She has solid experience in this line of business since she has been practicing it for several years.

This loan will allow Mrs. Coura to strengthen her capital and to better grow her business.

The profits will allow her to improve her family's living conditions (health, food, clothing, etc.) and to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and products for making fritters.

loans.name: Thavouen

texts.en: Thavouen, 38 years old, is a food seller. Her husband is an animal seller. Their income is $11 per day. They have three children, all of whom are studying.  Every month she has to spend $50 on food, $40 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy male pigs for others who need male pigs for their female pigs to get babies. With this career, she can get some more income. In the future, she wants to enlarge her food shop to be bigger than now. For her children, she will support them to study and at least finish high school.

loans.use: To buy a male pig

loans.name: Wendy Consuelo

texts.es: Wendy Consuelo de 26 años, reside en casa propia con su hijo menor de edad. Wendy vende: desodorantes, variedad de cremas, maquillaje, champo, etc. Este negocio es el que le ha permitido sobrevivir durante muchos años ya que ha sido su principal fuente de ingresos. Es por esta razón que desea mantenerlo activo por muchos años más y seguir recibiendo los frutos del mismo. Ella es una mujer arriesgada y sobre todo responsable se pone muchas metas y una de ellas es ampliar su negocio ya que su sueño es verlo crecer y poder obtener mayores ganancias para aspirar a una mejor calidad de vida. El crédito se utilizara para la compra de cremas para el cabello, cremas para el cuerpo y para manos, champo, lociones, cosméticos, desodorantes.
texts.en:
Wendy Consuelo is 26 years old and resides in her own home with her young son. She sells deodorants, a variety of crèmes, make-up, shampoo, and other items. This business has allowed her to survive for many years and is her main source of income. For this reason, she wants to remain active for many years to come and to continue receiving the fruits of her labor. She is a fearless woman and takes full responsibility for her many goals, one of which is to expand her business. Her dream is to see it grow so that she can generate more income and aspire to a better quality of life.

This loan is being used to buy hair crèmes, body crèmes, hand crèmes, shampoo, lotions, cosmetics, and deodorants.

loans.use: to buy hair crèmes, body crèmes, hand crèmes, shampoo, lotions, cosmetics, and deodorants.

loans.name: Jenely

texts.en:
Jenely works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling detergents in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years. Jenely has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Jenely would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: purchase more detergent to sell

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a mother of nine dependents, and she is 46 years old. She owns and operates a tailoring shop in Libertad Bajo, Misamis Occidental, Philippines, where she lives. The business commenced 13 years ago and continues today. She really has skills in mending, creating and designing dresses of any kind - uniforms, casual dresses, capes, etc. She earns approximately 6,000 Philippines pesos (PHP)  a month.

In 2006, Zenaida joined GDMPC. She enjoys the benefits of the services offered by the organization. It is an advantage to help carry out her business plans, and they are a good partner too. She took out loans before from GDMPC and has paid them in full. This year, Zenaida wants to borrow PHP 15,000 to purchase sewing tools such as scissors, textiles, threads, etc. She hopes to expand her business operations and not be left behind in society's current trends of fashion by keeping materials at all times.

loans.use: To purchase sewing tools such as scissors, textiles, threads, etc.

loans.name: Maria Trinidad

texts.es: María Trinidad es una señora trabajadora de un colegio privado como asistente de Dirección desde hace 5 años, hace algunos años se separo de su esposo por lo que tuvo que hacerse cargo de sus 2 hijos. Para que Trinidad no dejara el empleo la mama le ofreció su casa que en algún futuro será de ella, para cuidar de sus pequeños y convivir juntas. Como Trinidad esta agradecida con su madre por que es quien le dio la vida y una buena educación, desea agradecerle con lo que su economía le permita. Por tal motivo quiere hacer algunas mejoras a la casa para que se vea presentable, su proyecto es cambiar la fachada de la casa instalándole algunas vistas en la ventanas para poder realizar su proyecto necesita comprar material de construcción y pagar la mano de obra.
texts.en: María Trinidad is a hard-working woman who has worked in a private school as assistant principal for five years. Some years ago she separated from her husband and had to take charge of their two children. So that Trinidad would not have to leave her job, her mother invited her to move in with her so that they could live together and her mother could take care of the little ones. The home will one day belong to Trinidad. Because Trinidad is grateful to her mother, who gave her life and a good education, she wants to thank her in a way that her budget will allow. So, she wants to make some improvements to make the home more presentable. Her project is to change the front of the house by changing the windows. In order to complete her project she needs to buy construction materials and pay for the labour.

loans.use: to make home improvements.

loans.name: Samvel

texts.ru:
Самвелу 33 года, он живет в городе Иджеване (Ijevan). После службы в армии, он женился и сейчас у него двое детей: мальчик и девочка, оба учатся в средней школе. Жена Самвела домохозяйка. 
С 1999 года Самвел арендует мастерскую, где занимается переработкой древесины. Древесину он закупает у Иджеванского лесного хозяйства и изготавливает из нее паркет, детали для ящиков, плинтусы, а также выполняет частные заказы. Свои товары Самвел реализует в Иджеване, Ереване, а также продает своим постоянным покупателям из Октемберянского (Hoktemberyan) и Эчмиадзинского (Echmiadzin) района.  
Благодаря своему бизнесу Самвел содержит свою семью. 
Самвелу необходим кредит на сумму 900.000 драм для приобретения партии древесины и деревообрабатывающего станка.  
Данный кредит является четвертым по счету, получаемым Самвелом от организации Нор Оризон (Nor Horizon), и он никогда не задерживал выплат по кредиту.
texts.en: Samvel is 33 years old.  He lives in the town of Ijevan.  After completing military service, he got married and now has two children - a boy and a girl, both of whom attend a secondary school.  Samvel's wife is a homemaker.  Samvel has been leasing a shop since 1999, where he has been involved in processing wood.  He buys wood from the Ijevan forestry and uses it to make parquet flooring, box details, floor plinths and also fills private orders.  Samvel sells his products in Ijevan, Yerevan and also sells them to his loyal customers from Hoktemberyan and Echmiadzin districts.  Thanks to this business, Samvel is able to provide for his family.  He needs a loan in the sum of 900 000 dram to buy an inventory of wood and a woodworking machine.  This is Samvel's fourth loan from the Nor Horizon organization, and he has never been late on loan repayments.

loans.use: to buy wood and woodworking machine for his business

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
Doña Veronica, sigue laborando en zona Franca, hoy en dia tiene un compañero que trabaja como conductor, y le esta apoyando, lo que esta contenta al poder sentirse mas respaldada. sus hijos siguen cursando el año escolar.
Pues atraves de estos prestamo, ha logrado la mejora  a su casa, lo que hara con este prestamo es botar toda la division que divide los cuarto, ya que es de durpanel y muy viejo. Lo que coompra pyecem que es de mejor calidad, firmeza, quedando como pared, cuartones, clavos, entre otros para hacer el cambio.
texts.en: Verónica continues working in the free zone.  Today, she has a companion who works as a driver and is helping to support her.  She is happy to feel more supported.  Her children are still in school.  She has managed to improve her house through these loans.  What she’ll do with this loan is remove all the interior walls in the house because they are made from durpanel [pressboard] and are very old.  She will buy plycem [fiber cement] which is of better quality and stronger for the walls and will still need to buy beams and nails, among others, to do the remodel.

loans.use: to replace the interior walls of her house.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro de 48 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, la cual cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicado en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura. Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

La actividad que desarrolla Alejandro es la agricultura, cuenta con sus propias tierras de cultivo donde siembra limón, productos que se comercializan diariamente, una vez que realiza su cosecha su producto los ofrece a los diferentes mercados de Piura y así puede obtener ingresos para cubrir sus gastos diarios de su familia.  También comercializa aves de corral, permitiéndole obtener otro ingreso económico para su casa.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para compra de fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras como su producto y alimento balanceado para sus animales, una vez que se engorden los vende a los diferentes mercados de su zona, con la finalidad de que obtenga un mejor precio por ellos y así pueda tener más ingresos mejorando su calidad de vida.  Alejandro es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que su familia salga adelante y se supere.
texts.en:
Alejandro, age 48, lives with his wife and children in his own house.  The house only has electrical service.  It is located in the rural zone of the Tambogrande district, Piura department.  The zone is known for its farming, livestock, and handicrafts.

Alejandro is a farmer.  He has his own fields where he grows lemons.  This product is sold every day.  Once they are harvested he sells his product at the different markets in Piura.  That way he is able to get income to cover his family’s daily expenses.  He also sells poultry, which allows him to get another income for his household.

He has requested a loan for 1,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  The loan is to buy fertilizers in order to improve his crops and to buy balanced feed for his animals.  Once they are fattened, he sells them at the different markets in his area.  His objective is to get a better price for them in order to have more income to improve his quality of life.

Alejandro is a hard-working and very responsible person.  The only thing that he wants is for his family to get ahead and do well.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers in order to improve his crops and to buy balanced feed for his animals.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is 42 years old and married with six children.

Carolina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a 11,000 Philippines pesos loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her sari sari store.

Carolina has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari sari store for five years and also earns an income from selling charcoal.

Carolina aspires to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her sari sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
La señora Irma se ha dedicado a la venta de ropa usada y también a la elaboración y venta de tacos, desde hace tres años. Apoyando de esta manera a su esposo quien trabaja de albañil en una construcción, con lo que solventan los gastos familiares. 
Solicita el préstamo para invertir en comprar ropa de invierno y así tener más ganancias a su negocio. Y podrá darle es estudio necesaR. a su hijo.
texts.en:
Irma has been selling used clothing and making and selling tacos for three years.  This allows her to support her husband who works as a builder on  construction jobs.  This is how they cover their family expenses.

Irma is requesting a loan to invest in buying winter clothes so that she can make more profits from her business and be able to provide her son with the education he needs.

loans.use: to invest in buying clothes for her business

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Mrs. Sam, a 34-year-old married woman and the mother of three single children, lives in Pouk district, Siem Reap province. She is a hardworking farmer. She grows rice crops in the rainy season and raises some piglets as well as poultry in her yard. Besides those farming activities, she also sells fish in the local market. Sometimes Mrs. Sam cannot tend to all the businesses at the same time, but she has her three children who always help her with this work besides their classes. Through these businesses, Mrs. Sam is able to make a profit of $4.50 per day to cover her daily expenses. With the loan amount of $1,100, she will purchase additional stock of fish, piglets and poultry. She hopes to lift her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of fish, piglets and poultry.

loans.name: Manino

texts.en:
Manino, a 54-year-old woman living in the town of Sili, is engaged and has nine grown children. To make a living, Manino plants and harvests taro for sale. Engaged in this business for over three years, she earns approximately 720 WST a month.

In 2010, Manino joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid a previous loan of 1000 WST that was used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment, she is now requesting a new loan of 1000 WST to purchase sacks of fertilizers and gromozones. Manino plans to use the additional revenue arising from the loan to improve/expand her enterprise.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizers and gromozones.

loans.name: Sanare

texts.en:
Sanare is 36 years old, married and they have five children. He has been farming on his piece of land for the past 15 years.

He has applied for his third loan with KADET Ltd. to purchase farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizers and to buy more animals. He has been a good client who hopes to make profits that he plans to use to educate his children and expand his farming activities.

He hopes to make profit and re-invest it in other business. He is a persevering man who can do more if funded.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Perveen is 45 years old, married, and has 2 sons. Both of her sons are young and illiterate. They are butchers and sell chicken meat. Her husband also sells chicken meat. He is 53 years of age and has been operating his business for the past many years. He is very fair in his rates and deals with his customers in a professional manner.

Perveen is a seamstress and sews clothes for her neighboring clients. She is very skillful and receives a good number of orders every month.

She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan investment, he will buy chickens in larger numbers that will allow him to fill larger orders on time and increase his profits. The wedding season is going on and Perveen is confident that an investment will help her husband make his business more profitable.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Perveen.

loans.use: To buy chickens for her family's meat-selling business.

loans.name: Philomène

texts.fr: Philomène est âgée de 38 ans et vit au Bénin. Philomène n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Philomène est mariée à un soudeur du nom de Victor. Le couple a sept enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Le couple vit ensemble avec leurs sept enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Philomène vend depuis une quinzaine d’années, divers produits et des condiments au Bénin. Grâce au revenu que lui génère cette activité, Philomène contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Philomène sollicite un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les quatre premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Philomène is 38 and lives in Benin. She never went to school. She is married to Victor, a welder. They have 7 children, who all attend school and live with them. They both take care of the family financially. To meet the financial needs of her family, Philomène has been selling various products and condiments in Benin for about 15 years. Thanks to the profits generated by this activity, Philomène is able to help support her family. In order to meet the needs of her ever-growing customer base, she is applying for a fifth loan from ALIDÉ. The first four loans have been successfully paid back.

loans.use: to buy various condiments and drinks.

loans.name: Binta's Group

texts.fr:
Crée depuis le 14 Décembre 2014, ce groupe est composé de  femmes qui ont un idéal de cheminer ensemble. Elles partagent des valeurs de solidarité et d’entre aide fruit d’un long voisinage, car vivant toutes dans le même village. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Binta  (accroupit à l’extrême droite avec la main droite levée), est emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est  âgée de 18 ans, mariée et sans enfants. Elle  s’active dans la vente de thé et de sucre.

Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter du sucre  et du thé d’une valeur de 10000f chacun pour le revendre en détails au marché.

 Avec ses bénéfices, elle compte  participer à la dépense quotidienne de sa famille et aider son mari à améliorer leurs conditions de vie.
texts.en:
This group was created on December 14, 2014, and it consists of women who stand together on their journey. They all live in the same village and as long-time neighbors they have developed bonds of solidarity and support. Their main business activity is small trade. 

Mrs. Binta (seen front row at the far right and raising her left hand) is the group’s featured borrower. She is an 18-year-old married woman without children. She sells tea and sugar. 

She will use this loan to buy 10,000F worth each of tea and sugar to retail at the market. 

Her profits will allow her to help with her household’s day-to-day expenses and to support her husband’s efforts to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy 10,000F worth each of tea and sugar to retail at the market.

loans.name: Akpayaka

texts.fr: Marié et  père de quatre enfants, Akpayaka est un homme âgé de 53 ans qui vit à Adidogomé. Akpayaka est un tailleur qui confectionne des habits de prêt à porter dans son atelier de couture à domicile et les revendent dans une boutique. Pour s’approvisionner du nécessaire pour la confection, Akpayaka se rend une fois par mois au marché. Akpayaka demande ce prêt pour commander des pièces des unités de ceintures et des habits en vue de bien revendre ses marchandises puis de gagner un gain et pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation scolaire.

loans.use: Acheter 22 unités des habits et 63 unités de ceintures.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane wants to invest in shares on the stock market.

loans.name: Rahela

texts.en:
Rahela was born in 1958. She lives in a household of 8 in district 7 of Kabul, Afghanistan.

Rahela wants a loan to increase her stock of poultry and pet birds and to buy seeds for them. Due to bird flu she lost 30 hens and chickens and then she sold the rest because no-one could buys birds and chickens at that time.

Rahela took a 6th cycle loan from AFSG to buy a cart and materials for her son. She believes that if the disease will be completely removed from the country she will be able to start her lost business again with the help of her son.

loans.use: To buy more poultry and pet birds

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen was born in 1937. She is a widow with five children. She says that the most traumatizing thing that has ever happened to her was the dead of her child and later the dead of her husband. These two deaths in her family were so painful to the extent that she herself developed sickness for some time before recovering. She has taken GHAPE loan before and paid back. She says that her business is good and some customers buy in large quantities now, that is why she wants to get this loan which will enable her expand her business and the poultry farm she has been running for some years now. She has been in this business now for many years and everybody in her neighbourhood knows her and she is of great help to them and other widows suffering with children that their husbands have left them with. She says that the conditions given by GHAPE for the repayment of the loans are very encouraging because interest rate is low. The profit will help her open workshops for those her children who learned a trade and complete education for those still schooling.


First loan repayment installment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: Trading/Poultry

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is a 23-year-old single female who lives with her father. She has a hair salon and she wants to borrow $1200 to purchase new salon equipment. She wants to hire three women to work with her so that she can develop herself and her business and improve her income.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new equipment & hire assistants

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Señora Isabel is 57 years old and has 5 children. She belongs to the Ayaymaman Community Bank, and works in the sale of floral arrangements. She decided to start her enterprise because she liked the business and was the first to open a market for flowers in Moyabamba, Department of San Martín. With a loan of 2,000 Sol (US$643) approved by Manuela Ramos , Isabel will purchase a greater volume of flowers, of better diversity, which she will take in from the capital of Lima and abroad from Ecuador, as well as accessories and preservatives to prepare the flower arrangements so she can better attend to her clients with her quality work. She is also considering purchasing clothing bundles to put on sale in her space at market. One of her daughters now helps her in the business and in the upkeep of their home. Her goal is to expand the business since, grace of its transactions, she is also able to help other people (housing and food to two elderly persons and two children).

Translated from Spanish by Eric Strader, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Isabel, tiene 57 años y 5 hijos, pertenece al Banco Comunal Ayaymaman, se dedica la venta de arreglos florales. Decidió iniciar su negocio porque le gusta el negocio y fue la primera en abrirse camino en el negocio de las flores en Moyabamba, Departamento de San Martín. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 2,000.00 ( US$ 643.00 aprox.), comprará flores al por mayor, de diversas variedades que son traídas de la capital (Lima) y de fuera del país (Ecuador), así como accesorios y conservantes para preparar los arreglos florales y atender bien a sus clientes con un trabajo de calidad. También piensa invertir en la compra de ropa usada por fardos para ponerlo a la venta en sus puestos de venta que tiene en el mercado. Una de sus hijas ahora le apoya en el negocio y las actividades de la casa, su meta es crecer en el negocio porque gracias a esta actividad ella también puede apoyar a otras personas (brinda casa y comida a 2 ancianos y 2 niños).

loans.use: Purchase of greater inventory of flowers

loans.name: Mosan Ali

texts.en: Mosan Ali lives in district 10 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married with two children, and he has a retail shop. He has been involved in this business for a number of years and is looking to increase his business. He requested an individual loan to complete his stock so he can make a good monthly income to help his family. He wants to send his two children to a better education center. He is happy now, and he would like to thank AFSG.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Ung

texts.en: Mrs. Ung S., age 25, works as a housewife. Her husband is employed at a hotel, earning about $6 per day. They have one child who is too young to attend school. She would like to request a loan of $1000 in order to finish building the rest of her house to shelter her family.

loans.use: To finish building her house.

loans.name: Kitooro 2 (A) Group

texts.en:
Teddy is 35 years old and married with five children. She has a market stall where she sells raw foodstuffs - mainly matooke (banana food). With the extra profits, she intends to renovate her rental houses and pay school fees for the children.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more matooke from the villages.

loans.name: Titilayo

texts.en: Titielewa E. is 35-years-old and a mother of two. Her family lives in Mushin, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells loaves of bread. Mrs. E. has been in business since 2001 and requests a loan amount of $450 to purchase additional ingredients from which to bake bread and increase her sales inventory.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for baking bread and increasing production

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a 39 year-old single woman who owns a small general store, which she started in 2007. She works everyday from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. and can earn a monthly profit of about $240 from her sales.

Saumu now hopes for a loan of $150 to buy more items for her store.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for her business.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Mr. Pablo Fernández lives in his own home in the area of Pasankeri, on the east side of the city of La Paz with his wife, Rosa Álvarez and his 2 children. Mr. F. is a public transit chauffeur and his wife sells vegetables in a local market. With a previous Kiva loan, they were able to build a bathroom with shower in their home, for the family to use. The loan solicited will be used to refurbish the floor of the patio that is currenlty made of exposed brick. This is the 2nd time they apply for a loan. Their credit history is in good standing which qualifies them for a new loan.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Pablo Fernández vive en casa propia en la zona de Pasankeri ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposa la señora Rosa Álvarez y sus dos hijos, el señor Pablo es chofer de transporte público y su esposa vende verduras en un mercado de la zona. Con el crédito otorgado anteriormente a través de Kiva, realizó la construcción de un baño con ducha en su vivienda que ahora la usa su familia. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la refacción del piso del patio de su domicilio que se encuentra solo empedrado (es decir, con piedra solamente). Esta es la segunda ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: To refurbish the floor of the patio.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap T. and her husband, Mr. Hoeun Hong were married in 1999 with no children. The couple lives on an Island in the Mekong River about twelve kilometers from Phnom Penh.  Hoeun has been a wood carver for many years. He buys wood for carving by himself at home and sell the products to a wholesaler in Phnom Penh. 

Sopheap has been silk weaver for ten years. It’s a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village who takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. 

Sopheap is requesting a loan of US$1000 to purchase silk material for weaving and purchase wood for her husband's carving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving and purchase wood for her husband's wood carving business.

loans.name: Winder Alberto

texts.es:
Winder P. is an expert in vehicle mechanics and repair. He has his own workshop in his home where he attends to his faithful clients on his patio.

He is the father of two children whom it is his responsibility to support. He works very hard to offer his children everything they need for their development and education. He has asked for a loan from Ceprodel in order to purchase metal sheets to weld and some work tools. He hopes that his loan will be approved so that he can continue maintaining his humble home.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

Winder P. es un caballero experto en el ramo de la mecánica y reparación de los vehículos. Tiene su propio taller en su casa de habitación donde atiende en un patio bastante amplio a sus fieles clientes que le visitan.

Es padre de dos hijos el cual tiene el deber de mantener. Por este motivo es que se esfuerza grandemente para brindarles siempre lo que ello s necesiten para su desarrollo y educación. Actualmente ha solicitado un crédito en Ceprodel para la compra de láminas para soldar y algunas herramientas de trabajo. Espera confiadamente que el crédito le sea aprobado y de esta manera continuar con el mantenimiento de su humilde hogar.

loans.use: Purchase of work tools

loans.name: Maria Verónica

texts.es:
Maria Verónica G. is 35 years old, and the single mother of three school-aged children. She has run a general store from her home for the past 10 years, a business she was able to start thanks to a small inheritance left to her by her mother. She has had to take great care of the business, and manage it well, as it is the only means of income for the family.

What she worries most about is having enough money to provide an education for her children, which is why she wants to invest further into her enterprise to augment her income.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Verónica G. tiene 35 años de edad, es madre soltera de tres hijos, quienes están en edad escolar. Tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación desde hace ya 10 años, negocio que pudo empezar gracias a una pequeña herencia dejada por su mamá, y la que ha tendio que cuidar y administrar muy bien ya que es la única fuente de ingresos para su familia. Lo que más le preocupa es poder tener suficiente capital para poder darle la educación necesaria a sus hijos, y por eso va a invertir más en su negocio para generar más ganacias, va a comprar granos básicos para invertirlos en su pulpería y tener más utilidades

loans.use: Purchase staple grains for her general store.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Fatoumata is a young woman who has recently opened a beauty shop. She is requesting this loan to acquire more equipment for her shop. With the modest income she makes from her work, she is able to support herself. She would also like to hire one or two girls to help her in putting the new equipment to use.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Fatoumata est jeune qui a ouvert un salon de coiffure ces temps-ci. Elle sollicite ce pret pour renforcer son equipement ; Avec le modeste revenu, elle parvient a se prendre en charge. Aussi elle veut en acquerant ce nouveau materiel recruter une a deux filles pour l'aider.

loans.use:
acquire new equipment for her beauty shop

Coiffure

loans.name: Nolberta

texts.es:
Nolberta tiene 45 años, en la actualidad vive con 5 de sus 7 hijos y su esposo. Es una mujer de mucho coraje y valor para seguir adelante, y así lo viene haciendo con las actividades ganaderas, para ello, ocupa la mayor parte de su tiempo en las diversas tareas  que ella misma se ha puesto como meta, de cuidar a sus animales diariamente, limpiando su establo y alimentándolos, esta labor es la primordial, esporádicamente se dedicó al cultivo del campo, pero reconoce que esto no le ha traído las recompensas que esperaba, por ello, hace un año decide dedicarse enteramente a las tareas ganaderas. 
El motivo diario de sus esfuerzos es sostener la educación de sus hijos.
Nolberta solicita un préstamo con el que comprará un toro adicional para la mejora y crecimiento de su ganado.
texts.en:
Nolberta is 45 years old, and currently lives with five of her seven children and her husband. She is a very courageous and brave woman with a desire to get ahead, which she does by conducting her livestock activities. This endeavor occupies much of her time, including many of the related tasks that she herself has set as her goal in this area: caring for her animals on a daily basis, cleaning their stalls and feeding them, duties that are paramount in her work. She also dedicated herself to farming sporadically, but recognized that this did not bring her the economic return she had hoped for. For this reason, it’s been one year since she’s dedicated herself solely to the livestock trade.

Her daily motivation is her desire to support her childrens’ educations.

Nolberta solicits this loan to purchase an additional bull, in order to grow and improve her herd.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a bull to increase her livestock herd.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia baji is a wife of M. and lives in a small area named Yadgar in the city Lahore, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the last 22 years. She is the mother of six sons. Her elder son has a spare parts business. The next to him is a driver by profession. The others are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood.

Razia baji's husband has a harvester machine. He has been working with this machine for the last 5 years.

Razia baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to repair her husband's harvester machine.

Note: The harvester machine is showed in this picture. Razia baji is holding the pictures of the machine.

loans.use: To repair a harvester machine

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Mr. Touch T. is a villager in Smaung village in Takeo Province. He is a farmer and owns a small piece of land used to cultivate rice and earn an income. His wife, Mrs. Soun Yen, is a pig breeder. In this business, she is facing some problems because she does not make enough money to feed her stock. Thus, Mr. Touch T. decided to request a loan to buy pig food and eight pigs to add to his wife's business. He hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan. He is 59 years old and the father of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory and other three children are attending the local school. His wife is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy pig food and eight pigs to add to his wife's business.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz tiene 44 años de edad, es casada tiene dos hijos y hace poco acaba de construir su casa propia. Desde que era niña es  agricultora, apoyaba a sus padres en sus actividades, desde que se casó abrió una tienda donde útiles de oficina y verduras en general, esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 7 años, y todo este tiempo le ha servido para incrementar su clientela, a Luz le agrada mucho conversar, procura que  sus clientes se vayan satisfechos. Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP. El dinero que solicita será usado para incrementar la cantidad de productos para su tienda.
texts.en:
Luz is 44 years old, married with two children and she just finished building her own home. She has been a farmer since she was a young girl, she used to support her parents in their work. When she married she opened a store selling office supplies and groceries, and has had this business for 7 years. During these years she has grown her clientele. Luz likes to talk, and she indicates that her customers are very satisfied. This is her third loan with MFP. The money will be used to increase the quantity of products in her store.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the products in her store

loans.name: Nupcia Nuvinia

texts.es: Doña Nupcia es casada, de 53 años de edad, tiene 6 hijos, 5 casados y 1 estudiante de secundaria, de los casados uno habita con ella y trabaja como vigilante en SERVIPRO, su esposo trabaja como CPF en un Hotel y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar.  Nupcia esta solicitando su 3er credito y lo utilizara para la compra de perlines y puertas para su casa y tener mayor seguridad, los creditos anteriores los utilizó para comprar materiales de construccion, ella es una persona responsable con el pago de sus cuotas y desea continuar trabajando con AFODENIC, pues es la unica financiera que tiene politicas flexibles para con sus clientes, ademas su personal da un trato especial a los clientes por lo que se siente satisfecha.  El mayor deseo de doña Nupcia es tener un techo digno para cuando su esposo y ella esten jubilados.
texts.en:
Doña Nupcia is married, is 53, and has 6 children. Five are married and one is a high school student. Of the ones who are married, one lives with her and works as a security guard at SERVIPRO. Her husband works as a watchman at a hotel and helps her with the home's expenses. Nupcia is requesting her third credit and will use it to purchase beams and gates for her house to have more security. Her previous credits were used to purchase construction materials. She is responsible with her payments and hopes to continue working with AFODENIC since it is the only financier that has flexible policies with its clients. Its personnel also gives good treatment to their clients so they feel satisfied. Doña Nupcia's biggest wish is to have a decent roof for when she and her husband are retired.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beams and gates

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es:
La Señora de Nombre Candida Rosa M. tiene la edad de 35 años, su estado civil es casada, Doña Candida tiene 2 hijos sus edades son las siguientes su hijo mayor de 15 años de edad cursa el 4 año de secundaria y su hijo menor de 9 años cursa el 3 grado de primaria, su compañero de vida labora con su esposa, sus propósitos son de mantener su negocio activo ya que este es la fuente de ingresos mas importante para su familia y es por medio de su negocio que puede ofrecerle a sus hijos el pan de cada día en sus deseos esta el  de proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda por lo que son necesarias para que su familia pueda vivir  mejor ya que debido a lo poco que gana no ha podido realizar los cambios que desea para con su vivienda sus sueños son que sus hijos se formen de manera profesional ya que Doña Candida ha hecho muchos sacrificios para que sus hijos puedan tener estudio, vestimenta y hogar también en sus sueños esta que todas las personas aprendan a reciclar para tener limpio nuestro planeta.

La actividad económica de Doña Candida es la recolecta de chatarra como: hierro, papel, cobre y aluminio la ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 14 años, cuando Doña Candida inicia este negocio fue con un monto pequeño y con capital propio ya que ella misma consiguo el dinero para establecer el negocio, es  un trabajo muy difícil ya que se debe caminar mucho hasta juntar la cantidad suficiente por libras, luego llevarla hasta su casa de habitación y hasta entonces se trasladan las chatarras ya pesadas a las empresas recicladoras ubicadas en los diferentes países de Centroamérica, esto es un proceso largo, su esposo la apoyo en este negocio quien mas tarde empezó a trabajar con ella y actualmente ambos generan ingresos para su familia, Doña Candida utilizara el financiamiento para capital de trabajo por que ella debe pagar gastos de transporte, la compra del papel para reciclar, el hierro y el aluminio, ya que en las recolectas que realiza no obtiene mucho material y se le hace necesario comprar los materiales a otras personas que llegan a ofertarlas a la casa de Doña Candida.
texts.en:
Candida Rosa M. is 35 years old, married, and has 2 children. Her eldest son is 15 years old and is in his 4th year of secondary school, and her youngest son who is 9 years old is in the 3rd grade in primary school. Her life partner works with his wife, and their purpose is to maintain the business active, as it is the most important source of income for the family, and is the means by which they have been able to provide for their sons. Amongst their wishes is to be able to carry out much needed home improvements so that the family can live better. Due to the fact that she earns very little, Candida has not been able to realize the changes that she wishes for their home. Her dream is that her sons graduate and become professionals given that Candida has made many sacrifices so that her sons could carry out their studies, have clothing on their back, and a home. She also dreams that all people will learn to recycle so that we can preserve a clean planet. Candida’s main economic activity is the collection of junk goods such as: iron, paper, copper, and aluminum. Candida has owned her business for 14 years and it is located in the home in which she lives. When Candida began her business it was with a small amount and with her own capital since she herself found the money to establish her business. It is a very difficult job due to the fact that she has to walk a lot until she has collected a sufficient quantity by pounds, she then takes it to her home, where the heavy collections of junk goods are later moved to recycling companies located in the different countries of Central America. This is a long process, her husband who supported her in this business venture later began working with her, and currently they both generate income for their family. Candida will use this loan as capital for her work since she has to pay for transportation costs, and the purchase of the paper to recycle, iron, and aluminum given that during the collection rounds that she carries out she does acquire a lot of material, and as such it is necessary for her to buy materials from other people who arrive to offer them at Candida’s home.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital to cover transportation costs and the purchase of materials.

loans.name: Eliaich

texts.en:
