She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy additional stocks of used clothing or ukay-ukay to sell.  Marisil has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Marisil hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of used clothing, or ukay-ukay, to sell

loans.name: Twubakerugume Group

texts.fr:
Rosette est une commerçante âgée de 34ans qui habite  la localité de Bukirasazi de la Province de Gitega au centre du pays. Elle fait le commerce de café et des bananes depuis 19ans. Elle était élève avant de commencer cette activité. Elle a  fait ses études jusqu’en 6e année primaire. Elle est mariée et mère de  5 enfants dont 3qui étudient.  
Le crédit Kiva  de 100,000 francs burundais qu’elle obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter une grande quantité de café et des bananes à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  communautaire« TWUBAKERUGUME».
texts.en:
Rosette is a 34-year-old merchant who lives in the district of Bukirasazi, in the province of Gitega, which is at the center of the country. She is a member of the community group TWUBAKERUGUME.

She started trading in coffee and bananas 19 years ago. Prior to embarking on this activity, she was a student and remained in school up to the 6th grade. She is married with five children, three of whom attend school.

The loan of 100,000 Burundian francs will allow her to increase her working capital. She will buy large quantities of coffee and bananas, which she will sell to earn substantial profits.

loans.use: to increase her working capital and buy large quantities of coffee and bananas for resale

loans.name: Meuling Elizabeth

texts.es: Meuling de 31 años de edad es casada, tiene una trabajo donde devenga un salario, ademas cuenta con su propio negocio de venta de ropa usada y nueva, negocio el cual maneja en su propia casa. Solicita su 1er crédito a la institución de AFODENIC para realizar compra de productos de su pequeño negocio, pues como tiene demanda de otras comerciantes que viajan a  las diferentes  colonias del municipio a vender estos articulos necesita consolidar mas su inventario para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes que la visitan. cuenta con el apoyo de su marido que aporta en los gastos del hogar, y que ademas es dueño de un taller de mecanica. Su mayor sueño es aumentar el inventario de su negocio para en el futuro poder dedicarse a el y no trabajar a otras instituciones.
texts.en: Meuling, 31, is married and works for a firm.  She also has her own business selling new and used clothes, a business she runs from home.  She’s asking AFODENIC for her first loan to buy products for her small business because she has orders from other merchants that go to various neighborhoods in town to sell these items so she needs to better consolidate her inventory to meet customer demand.  Her husband supports her efforts and contributes toward household expenses; he also owns an auto repair shop.  Her greatest dream is to increase the inventory in her business so that in the future she can dedicate herself just to it and not work for other institutions.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Maida Lidia

texts.es: Maida Lidia es casada tiene 2 hijos que aun dependen económicamente de ella tiene 2 años viviendo en su domicilio y se dedica a la venta de artículos de segunda mano como lo son ropa, calzado, juguetes y accesorios para dama. Su esposo cuenta con un pequeño negocio dedicado a la venta de accesorios para automóvil e instalación de estéreos y bocinas para carros. Maida es una persona muy emprendedora y es por ello que desde hace 8 años se dedica a la venta de artículos de segunda mano para poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Ella solicita el apoyo para compra de ropa de invierno como lo son pantalanes, chaquetas, sudaderas y tenis para así poder vender mas y su ingreso familiar aumente.
texts.en: Maida Lidia is married and she has 2 children who still depend on her financially. She has been living her house for the past 2 years and she sells second hand goods, such as clothing, shoes, toys, and ladies' accessories. Her husband has a small business selling automotive accessories and the also installs stereos and speakers in cars. Maida is a very enterprising woman who has been selling second hand goods for the past 8 years to help her husband with the household expenses. She requests support to purchase winter clothing such as pants, jackets, sweaters, and sneakers to increase her sales and to increase her family income.

loans.use: to purchase winter clothing.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. Marilou has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & green bananas. She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & bananas. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Marilou hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & bananas.

loans.name: Orlando Jose

texts.es:
Orlando su oficio es taxista, padre de familia, tiene planes mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda ya que en algunas partes de ella están en mal estado. Con el préstamo anterior logro darle mantenimiento a su vehículo, el cual es su medio de trabajo y fuente de ingreso. 
El motor del auto ha presentado fallas muy graves las cuales requieren de cambio por completo. Con el préstamo comprara los siguientes repuestos a cambiar: bielas, bancadas, anillos std, pistones std, camisas s/f, guías válvulas, empaques del motor entre otros para  elaborar lo que se le llama overjoll, el desarme y el arme del motor. También la calibración y rectificación de los asientos. 
Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo al mejoramiento de su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Orlando works as a taxi driver, is the head of a family, and his dream is to make improvements to his housing because some parts of it are in poor condition. With his last loan he was able to give maintenance to his car, which he uses for work and is his source of income. 

The engine of the car is seriously in need of work and requires a complete change. With this loan he will buy rods, work benches, piston rings, pistons standard, S/F sleeves, valve guides, engine gaskets and other necessary items to complete an overhaul, disassembling, and reassembling the engine. He also needs to make adjustments to the  calibration.

He is grateful to the community bank for the support that improves his standard of living.

loans.use: to overhaul his engine

loans.name: Sokkhim

texts.en:
Sokkhim is 30 years old and her husband, Sambath, is 32 years old. They live in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. The couple has been married since 2002 and has two children, one son and one daughter. All of them are in school.

Sokkhim sells steamed corn, while her husband is a construction worker. In addition, they are also rice farmers. Sokkhim is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to assist in her rice farming by purchasing a tractor. 

Photo: Sokkhim is pictured. She looks like a man because she just shaved her hair.

loans.use: To buy a tractor for use on her farm.

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es: Domitila, de 30 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su  conviviente Justiniano de 39 años y sus 03 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo al que Domitila se dedica, es el cultivo de cacao y plátano. Todos los días, muy temprano por la mañana, trabaja en sus cultivos, ya que sabe que el dinero que obtenga de la venta de su cosecha dependerá mucho de la calidad de sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que los meses de trabajo han tenido sus frutos. Lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras. En adelante, espera contratar jornalero para que realicen el mantenimiento de sus productos como sacar la maleza y fertilizar sus cultivos, para obtener mejores ingresos. Este será su primer crédito con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Con los 500 nuevos soles, contratará  jornalero para que realicen el mantenimiento de sus productos como sacar la maleza y fertilizar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Domitila is 30 years old and is a simple hardworking woman.  She lives in a home of her own with her husband, 39 year old Justiniano, and her three loving children, to whom she wants to provide a better quality of life.  Domitilia raises cacao and bananas.  She gets up very early each morning and works her fields.  She knows that the money she gets for her harvest depends very much on the quality of her products.

What she likes the best is harvesting the land; the fruits of her many months of work.  She’s been doing this for 10 years and she considers the most difficult part to be fumigating her land.  She hopes to hire field hands to maintain her crops, including weeding and fertilizing them to obtain greater income.

This will be her first loan through MFP and she is very happy to know that she will have financial backing that will allow her to advance her work.  She will use the 500 PEN to hire field workers to maintain her crop, such as weeding and fertilizing.

loans.use: to hire field workers

loans.name: Narantuya

texts.en:
Mrs. Narantuya, 46 runs a passenger transportation business around the districts of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been doing her business since 2005 and already she has permanent customers. Her monthly earning does not meet with her family necessities often. She lives with her children in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar. 
Lately her business income has been reduced notably in due to damages in her minivan. It influences badly to the number of rides she can provide in a day.  And she could not provide the satisfaction and security of service to her customers. Therefore she decided to make renovation to her minivan. The loan she is taking will be dedicated to purchasing the spare-parts for the renovation of her minivan.

loans.use: To purchase the spare-parts for the renovation of her minivan.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 49 years old, married, and has a 13-year-old child. She lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol with her family.

Veronica runs a small eatery in her town. She cooks viands to sell to her community. She also runs a small sari-sari (variety) store business, where she sells items like canned goods. Veronica also makes wind chimes and other house decorations. Veronica works hard for her family.

Veronica has requested this loan to purchase ingredients such as meat and vegetables and more items to sell. Veronica hopes her businesses will grow. She hopes to purchase her own car in the future.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as meat and vegetables and more items to sell.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 56 years old married to Lucy and they have five children.  He has been in the housing business building semi-permanent rental houses for the last ten years, from which he earns a monthly income of KES 15,000.

He is applying for his first loan of KES 19,000 with KADET Ltd.  He was introduced to KADET Ltd by a credit officer.  He will use the funds to renovate the rental houses.  With the anticipated profits he will save to build more houses.

He hopes and dreams are build permanent rental houses in prime areas of his locality and to educate his children.

loans.use: to renovate his rental houses for his tenants.

loans.name: Soleil Plus Group

texts.en:
July is a leader of a community bank named “Soleil Plus,” which is composed of 11 micro-entrepreneurs united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

July is 57 years old and the father of six children between 7 and 21 years old. Four of his children go to school. Since 2000, July sells miscellaneous products at a market located to the east of Kinshasa. He currently earns 400 USD each month. After learning about Hope's loan program from a friend, he decided to join one of its groups in late 2009. July has already received ten loans from Hope that he has successfully repaid. 

July is requesting a loan to increase the inventory of his goods to generate additional profit. His ambition is to be a large retail provider in his area.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus, of Kyabashenyi Ntungamo, has applied for UGX 2,300,000 for completing the building of his residential house in rural Ntungamo. She has a challenge with his homestead, which is not well closed and has holes in the iron sheets,so the rains and cold do not spare his family members during the rainy season. 

She will buy better iron sheets to improve the comfort of her family and also try plastering his house to give it a better look. She is an active farmer who will partly invest in agriculture, buying bananas for sale. She is a hardworking woman.In the photo is the Ugafode credit officer, the client, her husband, the chairperson of the village and her daughter, they were all excited when told about Kiva and eagerly loved to appear in the photo and therefore signed the waiver form.

loans.use: To buy roofing materials and iron sheets.

loans.name: Umedjon

texts.en:
Umedjon is 29 years old. He is married and has two children. His wife is a housewife. Umedjon is only the only provider for his family. He has been busy with producing benches, fences, urns, etc. He produces these items from iron and cement. He has a workshop. Umedjon has worked in this field for more than five years. He has three workers. 

Umedjon wants to increase his working capital. He is asking for a loan of $3,000 USD to buy iron and cement. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy iron and cement to produce benches, fences, urns, etc.

loans.name: Hana's Group

texts.en:
Hana is a member of this group from Iraq. Hana is 60 years old widow mother of three . She is one of the many entrepreneur Iraqi women that started their own business to meet the financial needs of their families.
She has fourteen years of experience with her sewing business activity. When she heard about Izdiharona's qard hassan product (without interest) for widow women she took a loan to buy generator and iron to increase her products.
She is aiming to develop her business and increase her profits by open big factory and hire jobless women.
They preferred to blur their face for cultural reason.

loans.use: A portion of Hana's Group's $ 3,000 loan helps a member to buy generator and iron.

loans.name: Leidy Del Pilar

texts.es: Leidy de 33 años es una emprendedora mujer que decidió apoyar a su cónyuge con los gastos en el hogar e inició hace seis meses una venta de comida rápida al considera su experiencia en la culinaria.  Ella vende a sus vecinos, amigos y transeúntes residenciados en el municipio de Madrid arepas rellenas con chorizo y sus clientes están encantados, diariamente llegan hasta su punto de comidas a degustar de sus productos. Leidy necesita mejorar la indumentaria de su negocio, específicamente su carrito de comidas por ello realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para adquirirlo. Ella es madre de dos hijos de 6 y 4 años a quienes les ofrece bienestar con el fruto de su trabajo y su anhelo es crecer en su negocio y poder escriturar su vivienda.

loans.use: comprar su carrito de comidas

loans.name: Abibatou

texts.en:
Abibatou D. was born in Atakpamé in 1972. Her husband is medical assistant assigned to Tsévié, the city where she owns a cafeteria called \"Café d’Or\". She is the mother of three children. Very energetic and friendly, she contributes enormously towards covering household expenses, since what her husband makes is not enough. With her 7th grade education, Mrs. D. runs her business well. As an honest woman with an instinct for overseeing other people’s property, she seems to be trustworthy, having repaid two initial loans without a problem. Her cafeteria would have been more profitable if she had obtained a bigger loan. So, to enhance her business and augment her income, Abibatou is requesting a loan of $750 to outfit her cafeteria and to stock up on cartons of milk, glasses, egg trays, and other cafeteria items. Her plan will certainly help improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Mariée à un infirmier affecté à Tsévié d’où elle tient une cafétéria, Madame D. Abibatou, née en 1972 à Atakpamé est mère de trois (03) enfants. Dynamique et très sociable, elle participe énormément aux besoins de son foyer car les seuls salaires de son mari ne suffisent pour couvrir toutes les charges de la famille. Avec son niveau de la classe de 5ème, Madame D. gère au mieux ses activités. Honnête et ayant le sens de la bonne gestion du bien d’autrui, elle a donné l’impression d’une femme de confiance à travers ses deux premiers obtenus et remboursés sans incident. Ses affaires auraient pu être plus rentable si elle avait bénéficié d’un crédit plus consistant. Ainsi, pour accroître ses activités et augmenter ses revenus, Abibatou sollicite un crédit de $750 qui va servir à aménager sa cafétéria et s’approvisionner en cartons de lait, des tasses, de plateaux d’œufs, et d’autres éléments qui entrent dans le domaine de cafétéria. Avec ce projet, elle pourra, d’une certaine manière, contribuer au mieux à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille.

loans.use: To outfit and supply her cafeteria with necessities

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria P.'s saying for how life in the village of Pruteni is, "Viata este gheata" which is a Romanian proverb which literally translates to "Life is like ice" or times are hard and difficult. Maria is 60 years old and she receives a pension from the government, but that consists of only about $40 a month. This is not enough for her to live off of and she still works on her farmstead everyday. Her farm consists of 15 chickens, 1 pig and 5 rabbits and 1 hectare of land. She is requesting a loan to purchase material to build better cages for her animals and to purchase seeds to plant her land this spring.

loans.use: To purchase material to build animal cages and seeds

loans.name: Stéphane

texts.en:
Born in Aklakou in 1980, Stéphane G. is married and the father of two. This responsibility obliged him to take on income-producing work. He opted to sell lamp fuel. Known by his customers for his generosity and effort, Mr. G. has been working in this type of business for over ten years. He has now mastered the intricacies of his business, which has earned him the nickname « PAPA BOUDE ».

He is now requesting a loan of $1,000 to increase his inventory in order to meet the demand, which is growing constantly. Mr. G. will then be able to achieve some improvement in living conditions for his family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer:

Monsieur G. Stéphane, né en 1980 à Aklakou est marié et père de deux enfants. Cette responsabilité l’oblige à entreprendre des activités génératrices de revenus. Il a opté pour la vente du pétrole lampant. Reconnu par ses clients pour sa générosité et son effort, G. Stéphane exerce ce type de commerce il y a plus de dix ans déjà. Aujourd’hui, il a la maîtrise des rouages de cette activité, ce qui lui fait porter le surnom de « PAPA BOUDE ».

Il sollicite aujourd’hui un crédit de $1000 pour augmenter son stock afin de satisfaire la demande qui ne cesse d’accroître. Par là Monsieur G. Stéphane pourra atteindre une amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Increasing his inventory of lamp fuel

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her fish-selling business

loans.name: Thelma

texts.es:
This is a follow-up to a previous loan. Thank to the support I have received in the past, I have been able to increase my sales. Now I need to better stock my business since Christmas time is approaching and my customers are looking to purchase clothing and small gifts at good prices. I need to purchase lotions, creams, shampoos and clothing to meet their demands. I'm grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Este es un credito subsiguiente, gracias al apoyo que he recibido he podido acrecentar mis ventas, ahora necesito surtir mas mi negocio ya que vienen la temporada navideña y las personas buscan comprar ropa a buenos precios, igual que pequeños regalitos. Necesito comprar lociones, cremas, shampoo y ropa por lo que les agradecere su ayuda.

loans.use: Purchase personal hygiene products and clothing for men, women and children.

loans.name: Shungen Nchangwa

texts.en:
Born in 1968, M. is the widow of the late Emmanuel Ngwa. Her hopes of seeing her four children educated were dashed when her husband died. She now has to work hard to be able to provide for her children. This led her to start selling groundnuts and bananas, which could not give her much profit because she had little investment capital.

She then sought a loan from GHAPE. With a loan of $100 (40,000 FCFA), she plans to continue in the same line of business and also start cultivating ginger and cassava. She will use the profit to pay house rent and buy food for her children.

She plans to repay the loan in 12 -15 months, with the first installment on the day the loan is received.

loans.use: To purchase bananas, groundnuts and ginger

loans.name: Tuon

texts.en: Mrs. Tuon O., age 57, works as a chef, making about $4 each day. Her husband is an electrician, earning around $4 per day. They have two children, one who is an electrician and one who is a masseuse. She would like to request a loan of $500 in order to purchase a new motorcycle for her family’s transportation. This will make it easier for everyone to get to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her family's transportation.

loans.name: Kabowa 2(A) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year. Zaituni is 38 years old, married and has seven children. She runs a small canteen, and wants to use the extra profits made possible by the loan to pay her rent and school fees for her children. Jane has a retail shop and will use the loan to buy more goods to sell to her customers. Zaria wants to buy more raw food to sell. Irene wants to use the loan to buy poultry, and Nulu will use it to add to the stock available for sale in her boutique.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To enlarge several businesses by buying additional items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase supplies for farming of rice crop and care for herd of pigs.

loans.name: Djalal

texts.en: Djalal has run a taxi business for 5 years. He is 38 years old, married, has 2 children, and has settled in Binagadi. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Khodjavand region in the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan. Now he is requesting a loan of $850 to buy spare parts to maintain his taxi.

loans.use: To buy spare parts to maintain taxi

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Aminata S. is married and takes care of seven children. She is a member of the TP Takku Liguèye village bank in Kolda. She buys fruit at the weekly market in order to sell them in Kolda, and she makes clothing from dyed cotton damask. The clothing will be sold on credit for a duration of one month. She wants to built up her investment capital. The income earned from her commerce enables her to improve her family's living conditions. She is requesting this 13th loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

AMINATA S., mariée, 07 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois TP Takku Liguèye à Kolda. Elle achète les fruits au niveau des marchés hebdomadaire pour les vendre à Kolda et confectionne des habits teintés avec le bazin. Les habits seront vendus à crédit pour une durée de un mois. Elle veut renforcer son capital d’investissement. Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent d'améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille Aminata sollicite ce 13ème prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de 6 mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy fruit, egg cartons, damask, and supplies for a table-top stall

loans.name: Srean

texts.en:
Mr. Srean S. and his wife were married in 2002. They have two little sons. His wife, Mrs. Vanny SEAM has been a weaver for ten years. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village who will take them to sell in Phnom Penh. The family lives across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Srean has been a motorcycle repairer for seven years. He buys motorcycle spare part from market in Phnom Penh for sell at his motorcycle’s repairing shop in front of his house. Now, he is requesting a loan of US$1000 to purchase motorcycle spare parts for his business of repairing motorcycles.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle spare parts for the business of repairing motorcycles.

loans.name: Mirsa Elizabeth

texts.es:
Ms. Mirsa is 30 years old and she lives in Sabana Grande, she is married and has two young children. Her husband works as a driver and provides income for home expenses. Ms. Mirsa sells clothes and cosmetics and has six years of experience in the business. She started her business with the help of her husband. She will use the loan as capital to buy clothes and vouge and zermat beauty products in order to offer a variety of products to her clients. In the future she hopes to increase sales and increase earnings, improving her quality of live, and to be able to give her children an education.

Translated from Spanish by Sandy Juárez, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Mirsa tiene 30 años de edad, habita en el barrio Sabana Grande, es casada y tiene dos hijos menores de edad, su esposo trabaja como chofer y aporta para los gastos del hogar, La Sra. Mirsa vende ropa y cosméticos, lleva seis años de experiencia, apoyada por su esposo comenzó este negocio. Con el préstamo que está solicitando es para capital de trabajo en la compra de productos zermat y vogue, ropa. Para ofrecer a sus clientes diversos productos. A futuro es incrementar ventas y tener mejores ganancias, mejorar su nivel de vida, brindarles educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy clothing, shoes and beauty products

loans.name: Sonia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Sonia lives in the Hialeah neighborhood of the city of Managua. She is 35 years-old and a single mother of a 10 year-old girl. Sonia has been working offering auditing services for 16 years.

She began as an accounting assistant and has been rising in her profession due to her hard work and dedication. Sonia needs to build a kitchen in her house, and, with the loan, she will buy the necessary materials. She hopes to finish the construction project soon so that she can provide a good life for her young daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva Volunteer

Sonia habita en el barrio Hialeah de la ciudad de Managua, tiene 35 años, es madre soltera de una niña de 10 años de edad. Sonia tiene 16 años de experiencia brindando los servicios de auditorias a empresas.

Empezó como auxiliar de contabilidad y ha ido escalando peldaños gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación. Sonia necesita construir la cocina de su casa de habitación y con el préstamo comprará materiales para hacer dicha construcción, espera en un lapso corto de tiempo poder terminar de construir su casa para darle una casa y una vida digna a su pequeña hija.

loans.use:
Build a kitchen in her home

Construir cocina de su casa de habitación

loans.name: Hanna

texts.en:
Hanna E. sells cereals and other food items. She is married, but her husband's income as an electrician is not sufficient for Hanna and her 3 children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is a great Mom with two grown children, a husband and a happy family. She has invested much of her life in her most precious endeavor, raising her children. However, she could always successfully balance work and family without any damage to either. That has probably been one the secrets of her success. Olga launched her own venture only 7 years ago. However, she already has about $2000 in inventory. Her net profit is about $500 a month.

Olga is a very reliable client. She has been prompt with all her payments to Nadiya Ukraine and has never had a late payment. Today, as Olga and her husband are both retired, their business provides a stable source of income and security in life. Olga is hoping to continue keeping this business stable. She is requesting a loan of 5000 Grivnas to construct a vending kiosk and increase the assortment of merchandise she offers for retail sale in her stand. She is hoping to keep her business running and bringing her a profit in the future as well.

loans.use: To construct a vending stall

loans.name: Khayal

texts.en:
Khayal M. is 22 years old, recently married, and has one child. Khayal is a young market vendor. He has four years experience selling women clothes in the local market. His wife is a housekeeper, thus his business is the only source of income for his family. For this reason, he works hard to bring sustenance back to his home. Khayal wants his current child and future children to get a good education to have a better chance to succeed in the future. This is what makes his sacrifice worthwhile.

To grow his business, Khayal is requesting a loan of $1000 USD. He will use the loan to purchase merchandise so he can offer a wider selection to his customers and increase his income. The well being of Khayal's family and his business are in your hands. Khayal and his family are sincerely grateful for your support.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Sheriffat

texts.en: Aderenti is a hardworking mother of six children. Three of her children are in higher institutions of learning. She is 45 years old and married to Mr. Sherifatt. Aderenti sells firewood and also supplies clothes to her customers. She needs the loan to buy more clothes to sell. This is a festive period and there will be high demand for her clothes. She says "thank you" to all of the people that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Rita

texts.es: Rita tiene 28 años, es madre soltera, vive su hijo y su madre que la acompaña y ayuda. Hace 10 años trabajaba en la ciudad de Lima, en un puesto de venta ropa, al tener su hijo ya le fue imposible seguir trabajando, por ello vio por conveniente volver a su tierra natal. Ahí estuvo trabajando en la chacra hasta juntar capital, ahora ha podido implementar una bodega, donde también vende ropa. La venta de estas prendas le es más rentable que la de comestibles, además no tiene competencia. Rita está muy feliz con su negocio. Este es su 4to préstamo con MFP. El dinero es derivado a la compra de ropa para todas las edades, sobre todo para niños.
texts.en:
Rita is a 28 year old single mother. She lives with her son and her mother who helps her and keeps her company. 10 years ago she worked selling clothes in Lima, but after having her son it was impossible to continue working, so she thought it best to return to her hometown. She worked on the farm to save up money, and has now opened a small clothing store. Selling these garments is more profitable than selling food and in addition, she has no competition. Rita is very happy with her business. This is her fourth loan from Kiva partner Microfinanzas Prisma. The money will be spent buying clothing for all ages, especially children.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing the amount of clothing for sale

loans.name: Tam

texts.en:
Tam P., 45, is married and lives with three of her six children in Kampong Cham Province. She and her husband are rubber workers and they earns a combined income of approximately $6 a day. Two of their children attend school.
Mrs. Tam P. would like to take out a loan of $600 to purchase rice. This rice will be sold to the rubber workers in her area. 

Her husband is pictured.

loans.use: To purchase rice

loans.name: Lafia (Le Soulagement) Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Lafia (composé de 4 femmes  mariées) ont une moyenne d’âge de 26 ans avec en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles resident dans le quartier  Hamdallaye de la ville de Sikasso(troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles exercent des activités commerciales différentes tels que : l’achat vente d’habits pour enfants, du savon de fabrication locale, du bois de chauffe et du sel de cuisine.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis 1 an et sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe).Le prêt précédent a été correctement remboursé. 
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 2 sacs de 100 morceaux de savon traditionnel (farakourouni), une douzaine d’habits pour enfants, des slips, un  chargement de camionnette en bois de chauffe et 5 sacs de 25 kg sel de cuisine Elles s’approvisionnent soit à Bamako (capitale du Mali),  ou sur place à Sikasso ville  et les villages environnants.
Les produits sont vendus en détail et  au comptant dans les marchés de la ville de Sikasso et dans les quartiers à une clientèle composée de femmes en majorité. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 10 000 FCFA par mois qu’elles utiliseront  pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the group Lafia (composed of four married women) average 26 years of age and two children. They reside in the Hamdallaye district of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They do different commerce-related work, such as: buying and selling children’s clothing, locally-made soap, firewood, and kitchen salt. They have been collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso for a year and are on their second solidarity loan (group loan). The preceding loan has been correctly repaid.

They intend to use this loan to buy two 100-piece sacks of traditional soap (farakourouni), a dozen childrens’ outfits, some underwear, a truck-load of firewood, and five 25-kg sacks of salt. They get their supplies either in Bamako (capital of Mali) or locally in Sikasso and surrounding villages.

The goods are sold retail, for cash, in the marketplaces of Sikasso and the districts to customers composed mostly of women. They each hope to realize a monthly profit of 10,000 francs CFA that they will use to provide for their families and to invest in their work.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy childrens' clothing, soap, firewood, and salt

loans.name: Abdul Malek

texts.en:
A. Malek is married and lives with his family. He has owned his own restaurant business for a long time. He received a first cycle loan and used it to improve his business. Now he plans to enlarge it and wants to take out his second-cycle loan.

He has requested an individual loan of 40,000 AFN with a term of nine months to enlarge his restaurant, increase his stock and change the design. He would love to be a good business dealer in the future. A. plans to open another restaurant in the next five years. He wants to say that without this loan it was impossible to get his restaurant to be its best and he hopes that he is going to continue to be the best in the future. He is happy.

loans.use: To expand and improve his restaurant

loans.name: Fiaaluae

texts.en: Fiaaluae S., 37, is married with 1 child.  She has 1 year of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the general public and local villagers, 4 days per week. She has had no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~187 USD).  SPBD loans are Fiaaluae’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to buy a plantsprayer, chemicals and sacks of fertilizers to maintain and improve her business.

loans.use: To buy a plantsprayer, chemicals and sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda A. is engaged in selling fish. She is 36 years old, married and has four children. She started her fish business so long ago that she can't remember exactly when.  Her husband, Narceso A., is a fisherman. He is the one who goes out to sea trying to catch more fish for Melinda to sell. 

She is asking for a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy more fish to sell in the market. In that way, she could sell more and earn more for her family. She is sure she will be able to provide better for her family's needs by seeking a loan for additional income.

CEVI is a non-profit organization that helps people start and have their own business. They provide not only credit but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Miza

texts.en:
Miza has been a firewood and bites (bread-like rolls) seller in the Darajabovu neighborhood of Zanzibar for six years. She belongs to Msikitu group loan (Group code 2073). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $35. Each day she works at her business for 12 hours.

Miza is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more firewood, wheat flour and cooking oil for her business. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Miza is 35 years old, divorced, and has eight children.

loans.use: To buy more firewood, wheat flour and cooking oil for her business

loans.name: Mr. Nan Chhoem's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty-seven people living in Preak Svay village in Kandal province comprise this village bank, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mr. Nan C. is the 28-year-old village bank president. He is employed in a garment factory. His wife, Mrs. Hor Nary, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice.

In this plantation, she needs the money to buy rice seed, fertilizer, and gasoline to pump water to support the field to make her crop more productive. Thus, Mr. Nan C. decided to ask for a loan for his wife’s purpose. He has two children who are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer, and gasoline to pump water

loans.name: Dugarjav

texts.en:
Dugarjav N. lives with his wife in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. All four of his children have grown. The oldest son is married and lives with his family. The next oldest son is a soldier in the Mongolian army. The two youngest children are college students in Darhan, the second largest city in Mongolia.

Dugarjav has a small sewing business. He has been working for his family's sewing business with his wife for the last three years. They sew various clothes for women and men, by request. His two children in Darhan contribute to their parents' business by selling some of the clothes in Darhan. In the future, they would like to expand their family business by adding more clients and seeking different possible channels to sell their products in the local market.

Dugarjav requests a loan to purchase more raw materials, such as various cottons, and one new sewing machine.

loans.use: To purchase more raw materials and one new sewing machine.

loans.name: Trịnh Thị

texts.en:
Hòa Trịnh Thị (831011141) is a 55-year-old woman living in the town of Ý Yên. She is married and has 2 adult children. To earn a living, Hòa owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Hòa has been engaged in this business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3,100,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2001, Hòa joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hòa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Hòa is now requesting a new loan of 10,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be the 8th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. Hòa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further improve/expand her business.

loans.use: invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Celestina Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Celestina del Carmen, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Marginal II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 40 años y es madre de 06 hijos, todos ellos que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando.

Lleva 15 años dedicándose a la Venta de Almidón, producto elaborado a base de yuca se inicio con S/. 100.00 y junto con su esposo, emprendieron su negocio, que se encuentra ubicada, en su misma; donde cuenta con una huerta grande, espacio que le permite rallar, cernir  y secar el producto, antes de ser vendidos.

En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio de Venta de Almidón que sirve para la preparación de dulces regionales, cuenta con clientes fijos y también trabaja con panaderías  y bodegas, que hacen sus pedidos mensualmente y diariamente.

Con el préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, lo invertirá comprando 01 tonelada de yuca.
Con parte del dinero también comprara planchas de calamina y plásticos, herramientas principales para secar  al sol el almidón que produce, cuidando siempre la higiene y limpieza.
 
Ella y su esposo, son quienes  toman  las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio. En lo personal, se siente más independiente, tranquila, capaz y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. 
Celestina, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Celestina del Carmen belongs to the La Marginal II Community Bank in the Tarapoto district, San Martín department. She is 40 and in a common law marriage. She has six dependent children who attend school. For 15 years she has been selling starch, a product made from yucca. She started with 100 PEN, and together with her husband they initiated their business. The business is located at her home where they have a large orchard. The space allows them to grate, sift, and dry the product before selling it. She currently continues with the same business of selling starch, which is used to prepare regional sweets. She has a client base. She also works with bakeries and stores who place monthly and daily orders. With this loan for 3,000 PEN she will buy one ton of yucca. She will use part of the money to buy corrugated metal and plastic sheets. These are the primary tools used to dry the starch in the sun, always being careful about hygiene and cleanliness. She and her husband make the decisions about the earnings from the business. Personally, she feels more independent, calm, capable, and responsible about making her payments. Celestina is grateful to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as an entrepreneur and as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tons of yucca

loans.name: Hà Thị

texts.en:
H. Hà Thị (1122060648) is a 35-year-old woman living in the town of Kim Động. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. To making a living, H. owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector selling religious items. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling flowers and other votive offerings to tourists and local community members. H. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3500000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2004, H. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. H. successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund, which was used to purchase additional religious items and materials. H. is now requesting a new loan of 20000000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be the sixth loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Minerva

texts.es:
La persona que aparece en la fotografía es el señor Crispin Rivera esposo de la solicitante.
El señor Crispin por mucho tiempo trabajo en un hospital con esto mantuvo su familia y formo un patrimonio para cada uno de sus hijos ahora el esta pensionado, pero su tiempo lo quiso dedicar a poner un negocio donde los dos pudieran trabajar sin mucho esfuerzo y sobre todo por su edad.
El negocio lo llamo “Daisy” que es de  papelería y mercería; ya tiene  4 años el negocio, tiene muy buena ubicación  ya que por ahí pasan los niños de la escuela, pero este crédito es para  comprar mas mercancía ya que se viene la temporada las listas  escolares; donde los padres buscan variedad de artículos para que sus hijos lleven a la escuela.
Minerva y su esposo quieren invertirle a esta papelería aunque esta  surtida; no quieren quedarse sin mercancía para que el cliente encuentre variedad de útiles escolares y entren buenos ingresos a esta familia.
texts.en:
The person in the photograph is Mr. Crispin Rivera, the husband of the applicant. Mr. Crispin had worked in a hospital for a long time, this way supporting his family and putting together an inheritance for each one of his children. He is now retired and decided to use his time to start a business that him and his wife could easily run given their ages. He called the business "Daisy", it is a paper and notions store. The business is already 4 years old and has a good location, since the children go by it on their way to school. This loan is to purchase merchandise because the time of school supply lists is coming and parents will be looking for a variety of items for their children to take to school. Minerva and her husband want to invest in this stationary store, they do not want to be left short of merchandise and want their customers to find a variety of useful school supplies. This will bring good income for the family.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Djiguiya 3 De Wayere Farakala Group

texts.fr:
Les sept  membres du groupe Djiguiya 3 sont tous des hommes mariés  avec une moyenne d’âge de 31ans, 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies à WAYERE un des villages de la commune rurale de FARAKALA, préfecture  de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs cultures de maïs. 
Ils sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution et comptent acheter, des engrais et des herbicides pour entretenir 7 hectares. 
Leurs productions sont vendues au niveau du village, dans les marchés de FARAKALA  et  de SIKASSO après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes souvent venant de BAMAKO ou du SENEGAL. 
Ils comptent réaliser un bénefice moyen de 55.000FCFA par campagne.
Les producteurs du groupe Djiguiya souhaitent avoir des montants à hauteur de souhait.
texts.en:
The seven members of the Djiguiya 3 group are all married men with an average age of 31 and on average, 3 children. They mostly live in traditional extended families in Wayere, one of the villages of the rural township of Farakala, prefecture of Sikasso, 3rd administrative region of Mali.

They work together with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso so that they can successfully raise their maize crops. They are working with the institution for the first time, and they intend to buy fertilizer and herbicides to maintain 7 hectares.

Their crops are sold in the village, in the markets of Farakala and Sikasso, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women, often coming from Bamako or from Senegal. They expect to make an average profit of 55,000 F CFA per growing season. The agriculturalists of the Djiguiya 1 group would like to have unlimited amounts.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of fertilizer and herbicides

loans.name: Diakhou

texts.fr: Diakhou N. est une jeune femme marié, âgée de 36 ans et mère de 5 enfants. Elle fait un petit commerce d’oseille. Son objectif est de renforcer son commerce et contribuer à la prise en charge des dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Diakhou N. is a young married woman, is 36 years old, and is the mother of 5 children. She has a small business selling sorrel. Her goal is to increase her business and to contribute to the payment of the family expenses.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sorrel business

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie E. is from the village of Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis, Occidental. She is 32-years-old. Virgie is married and has two school-age children. To make a living, Virgie owns and operates a "sari-sari" general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Virgie has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Virgie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virgie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Virgie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Virgie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es:
Herminia tiene 29 años, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 3 hijos en una casa alquilada. Se dedica a la agricultura, siembra paltas y café; pero su cultivo preferido es el café, por ello con mucha alegría y dedicación cuida sus plantas, podando y quitando todos los arbustos para que se ramifiquen y desarrollen rápidamente para que en menos de 9 meses ya pueda estar cosechando. Herminia vende su café a una acopiadora llamada “Mina”, la cual le compra toda su producción a un buen precio y sin engañarla en el peso, como otros compradores. Para ello, debe transportar los sacos de su producto durante 2 horas en carro desde su chacra. Las ganancias que obtiene por su café las usa para comprar vestimenta para sus hijos y otras necesidades de su hogar.
Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y manifiesta su agradecimiento a los integrantes de su banco comunal, quienes le permitieron ser parte de ellos y confiaron en su trabajo responsable. Con el dinero que ahora solicita quiere comprar un motocarro para poder trasladarse rápidamente a las tierras de cultivo que tiene en zonas más alejadas, donde no pueden ingresar los autos.
texts.en:
Herminia is 29 years old. She lives with her partner, the father of her 3 children, in a rented house. Her work is in agriculture; she cultivates both avocados and coffee, but her preferred crop is coffee. She tends her plants with great joy and dedication, pruning them and removing the brush so that they will branch properly and develop rapidly, providing a harvest in less than 9 months. Herminia sells her coffee to a wholesaler called "Mina," which purchases all of her production at a good price and does not cheat her on the weight as some other buyers do. For this, she has to transport her products in sacks 2 hours by car from her farm. She uses the profits from her coffee to buy clothes for her children and other necessities for her home. This is Herminia's second loan with MFP, and she expresses her gratitude to the members of her communal bank who have allowed her to join them and who have shown faith in her as a responsible worker. With the funds she is currently requesting, she will buy a motocarro (a 3-wheeled vehicle with cargo space in the back), so that she can move around quickly on her cultivated land, some of which is in isolated areas not accessible by car.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a motocarro (3-wheeled vehicle)

loans.name: Najjanakumbi J Namugamba Margaret Group

texts.en: N. Margaret, a 32-year-old married woman, has been selling charcoal for three years so far. She is blessed with four children and two dependents, all in school. She is a hardworking business lady whose dream is to purchase a plot of land and construct a house. She is using this loan to purchase bags of charcoal, trying to improve upon her business. Margaret is the president of this group.

loans.use: To purchase bags of charcoal

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.en:
Nicolasa is 47 years old and has been married for 15 years. She and her husband have two children, ages 17 and 15. Nicolasa is a dairy cow farmer. She uses the raw milk to make cheese, and then sells the cheese in the market. She learned dairy cow farming from her mother when she was a little girl.  Nicolasa and her family have a small home in Maica Norte, an area just outside of the city of Cochabamba.  This is where her six dairy cows are located.

Currently, Nicolasa's husband is working in Spain, so she has been taking care of the business herself. He has been sending his earnings back to the family, so she has been remodeling their home with the extra income. Recently, however, due to the economic crisis, he has not been able to contribute as much. Her oldest child is studying to become an auditor and she is in her second semester of studies.

With this loan from CIDRE, Nicolasa plans to purchase one more dairy cow. This will help her to increase her level of milk production incrementally.  Nicolasa's dream is for her husband to return from Spain that they can work together in Bolivia and they don't have to be separated anymore.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie P. is from the village of Antipolo. She is 44 years old. Elsie is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Elsie owns and operates a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes from selling ground pork and beef products known as "longganisa" in the local community. Elsie has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Elsie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. Elsie is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Elsie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en: Fatmeh is a 27-year-old single woman living with her parents and sister. She has been working in clothing sales since 2005, servicing the neighboring villages. Today, Fatmeh is asking to borrow $1,100 to buy additional clothes—that's how she will augment her business sales and make a good income.

loans.use: To buy additional clothes

loans.name: Hyguor

texts.es:
Hyguor, de 22 años, es un joven muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en la casa de sus padres y está dispuesto a trabajar muy duro con tal de mejorar su calidad de vida.
Su juventud no fue un impedimento para que pudiera implementar un local con cabinas para el servicio de Internet, el cual es muy concurrido, ya que está ubicado en un lugar muy céntrico, como es el mercado Manco Cápac (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca).
Él cuenta actualmente con 9 computadoras, las cuales le dan los ingresos necesarios para pagar sus estudios.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede aprovechar el Internet para realizar sus trabajos universitarios e investigar sobre algunos temas, lleva 2 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su negocio, pues sólo cierra para ir a la universidad. 
En el futuro anhela terminar sus estudios y progresar con su profesión.

Este es el primer préstamo de Hyguor con MFP y está dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo; en su banco comunal es muy querido, ya que es el más joven del grupo. Con los setecientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará una computadora para incrementar el número de cabinas que tiene.
texts.en:
Hyguor, 22 years old, is a modest and hard working youth, he lives with his parents and is willing to work very hard so that he can improve his quality of life. His youth was not an obstacle in being able to set up a business with booths for internet services, which is very popular, since it is located very centrally, like the Manco Cápac market (important market in Juliaca city). He has 9 computers at present, which give him the necessary income to pay for his studies. What he likes most about his work is that he can use the internet for his university studies and research various topics, he has spent 2 years in this business and what he considers the most difficult is to have to spend all day inside his place of business, as he only closes to go to university. In the future he longs to complete his studies and make progress in his profession. This is Hyguor's first loan with MFP and he is committed to pay all his installments on time; it is very nice at his communal bank, since he is the youngest in the group. With the PEN700 he is asking for he will buy a computer to increase the number of booths.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a computer

loans.name: Jovelyn's Group

texts.en:
Jovelyn C. is from the village of Maluno Norte. She is 37 years old. Jovelyn is the group leader of a 13-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Jovelyn C.'s group.

Jovelyn is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Jovelyn owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling meats, fruits and vegetables in the local community. Jovelyn has been engaged in her business for over 17 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jovelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jovelyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jovelyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Deysi Concepción

texts.es: Deysi Concepción C. C. de 31 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Soyapango, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja para una empresa privada, así mismo junto a su único hijo de 7 años de edad quien es estudiante. Ella posee una tienda en la cual vende productos alimenticios, detergentes, golosinas, bebidas y otros más. Durante todo un año Deysi ha trabajado mucho por mejorar las ventas de su negocio, y a pesar que cuenta con poco tiempo de poseerlo, está muy bien establecida con la tienda, es gran parte gracias a sus buenas relaciones con sus vecinos quienes la aprecian mucho por ser una mujer muy emprendedora y responsable con su familia. Deysi solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de productos, sobre todo bebidas frías, pan, huevos y granos básicos, los cuales son más vendidos y que está segura que generan mayores ganancias. Deysi desea poder brindarle una estabilidad económica a su hijo, de manera que cuente con todo lo necesario para tener una vida digna.
texts.en:
Deysi Concepción C. C. is 31 years old and lives in the Soyapango municipality in the San Salvador department. She lives with her husband who works in a private company and also with her 7 year-old son, a student. She has a store in which she sells food, detergent, snacks, drinks and other items. For a full year Deysi has worked hard to improve her business´ sales, and because of this hard work her store is now well established despite the fact that she has only had it a short time. Another reason for this success is the good relationship she has with her neighbors who very much appreciate the fact that she is hard working and a very responsible family member. Deysi would like a loan so she can buy a greater amount of products. Above all, she would like to buy more cold drinks, bread, eggs, and basic grains. Since these items sell so well, she is sure to improve her earnings. She would like to provide her son with a more stable economic situation which she says is necessary for a dignified life.

Translated from Spanish by Sierra Visher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cold drinks, eggs, bread and basic grains

loans.name: Darlina

texts.en: Darlina Z.'s main source of income comes from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. She is 30 years old, married and has three school-age children. They are from the village of Banquero. Darlina has been in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Darlina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Darlina is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase products to sell. This will be her first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sofia Nakaggwe ‘S Group

texts.en:
Sofia is 35 years of age.  She is married with five children aged between 3 and 16 years. All her children go to school. The family owns a four-room house where she lives with eight other people. She takes care of additional family members.  The family has access to electricity but no running water at home.  The family has three meals a day. Her greatest monthly expenses include: utility bills, school fees for her children, medication and food. 

Sofia operates a retail shop selling all kinds of merchandise in Ndeeba. She serves an average of 30 customers a day, and has had this business for over twenty years.  Sofia buys her merchandise from shops in Kikuubo, one of the busiest places in Kampala.  Thus she incurs transport costs to go to Kikuubo and to bring her goods back. Her main business challenges are defaulters, the rainy season (because she works from a muddy place) and the ever-increasing prices of merchandise.

Sofia has been with MCDT for over nine years.  She is requesting her twentieth loan with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and jerrycans of cooking oil. She hopes to grow her business and start selling at wholesale prices only. 
.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
La Sra. Catalina Z. está casada con el señor Luciano Gamarra.
Catalina desde desde hace aproximadamente 10 años decidió abrir un pequeño almacén de ventas de artículos de primera necesidad. 
En la actualidad es la única despensa en la zona por lo que la citada cliente le vende sus productos a todo el barrio.
La señora Catalina como siempre hizo, todos los créditos que retira de la Fundación los destina a la compra de mercaderías y así poder satisfacer la demanda y obtener una mayor ganancia.
Para fines de este año Catalina quiere ampliar mas su local de ventas ya que le es pequeño su salón por la cantidad de mercaderías que posee.
texts.en:
Catalina is married to Luciano. About ten years ago she decided to open a small shop to sell basic need items. Now she has the only shop in the zone and she sells to the entire neighborhood. Catalina has used all of the loans she has received through the foundation to buy merchandise to be able to satisfy her customers’ needs and increase her income. By the end of this year, Catalina would like to be able to expand her store, since it’s too small, given the quantity of merchandise that she has.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es:
Haydee es una mujer muy amable y sociable de 25 años, es casada y fruto de ello tienen una hermosa hijita. Vive en la selva ayacuchana, en la localidad de “Quimbiri”, donde tienen una humilde casa construida a base de madera.

Cuando Haydee observó de cerca a los comerciantes de comestibles, tanto mayoristas y minoristas, y las ganancias que obtenían por ello, decidió incursionar en el mismo negocio. Hasta el momento le va muy bien, tanto en el aspecto económico y familiar, pues logra cubrir los gastos de su pequeña hija, ya que para ella y su esposo es la razón de poder seguir trabajando incansablemente. Ocasionalmente recibe la ayuda de su esposo cuando él dispone de tiempo libre, pero por lo general trabaja sola en su tienda de abarrotes desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. Para el futuro tiene pensado ampliar su tienda, para poder captar a más clientes y a la vez fidelizar a los que ya tiene, ofreciendo productos acorde a su poder adquisitivo.

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y se siente seguro de cumplir con sus pagos, además agradece por las facilidades que le otorgan con el crédito. El dinero solicitado lo usará para la compra de más productos con los cuales surtir su tienda, con la finalidad de incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Haydee is a very kind and sociable 25 year old woman, married, and has a beautiful little daughter. She lives in the jungle in Ayacucho, in the locality of "Quimbiri," where she has a humble home constructed from wood.

When Haydee looked at nearby food sellers, both wholesale and retail, and the profits they made, she decide to enter the same business. From the moment she started, things have been going well, both with the business and with her family, The business helps to cover the expenses of her baby girl, who is the reason she and her husband work incessantly. Occasionally her husband helps out when he has free time, but generally she works alone in her grocery store from 6 in the morning until 8 at night. In the future she wants to expand her store to be able to gain more clients while staying loyal to those she already has, offering them greater purchasing power.

This is her first loan with MFP and she is sure that she will be able to complete her payments. Also she is grateful for being offered this loan. The loan will be used to buy more products to stock her store to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her merchandise

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a 45-year-old widow with six children. She has been selling clothes for the past six years and is a member of a group of young entrepreneurs under Faulu Kenya. This group has helped her get new business ideas and has even guaranteed a loan which she took out from Faulu Kenya. Josephine has requested a loan of Kes.20,000 to buy women's clothes to sell. She is a hard-working lady who hopes to build her own house in the future.

loans.use: To buy women's clothes to sell

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es:
Alexander A. S., tiene la edad de 31 años, está casado, y vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos de 9,8 y 7años de edad, y son su mayor prioridad. El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar el abono y el fertilizante. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café para lograr una mejor calidad y para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Alexander  también trabaja desde hace muchos años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor. 
About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Alexander A. S., age 31, is married and lives with his wife and their 3 children, ages 9, 8, and 7. His family is his greatest priority. The loan that he seeks will assist on his farm, specifically with the cultivation of coffee. He plans to buy fertilizer in order to give his coffee fields adequate maintenance so that he obtains better quality crops and as much income as possible from his harvest.

This is the first time that he has sought a loan from FUDECOSUR, and he is very pleased with the assistance he has been offered. Don Alexander has worked in agriculture for many years. For the future, he hopes to offer his family a better quality of life and greater economic stability. He also hopes to continue improving as a person and as a farmer, About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Assistance for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Lyndis

texts.es: Lyndis tiene 30 años, está casada con Orlando de 39 años, con quien tiene dos hijos, juntos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la selva central. Hace mas de 6 años, se dedica al cultivo de café, plátano y plata, esta actividad lo realiza en compañía de su esposo, ambos tiene el mismo objetivo de ofrece un mejor beneficio a sus hijos. De es manera se levanta desde muy temprano por la mañana a preparar los alimentos de sus hijos y luego se disponen a ir a los campos agrícolas. Lo que más le agrada hacer es retirar la maleza de sus tierras, sin embargo el tener que colocar trampas para las plagas le resulta muy complicado y peligroso. Por otro lado reconoce que esta actividad le resulta muy rentable porque gracias a eso construyó su casa, vive cómodamente sin preocupaciones, además puede cubrir la educación de sus hijos. Por tal motivo desea aumentar su producción con la compra de más terrenos productivos, asimismo desea dedicarse a la compra y venta de plátanos la por mayor y menor. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP y asegura estar entusiasmada de continuar laborando en grupo comunal, quienes le enseñaron a ser responsables y honestos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos de abono para cuidar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Lyndis is 30-years-old. She is married to Orlando, who is 39, and with whom she has two children. Together, they live in their own home, located in the central jungle. For more than 6 years, she has grown coffee and plantains. She does this with her husband, and they both have the goal of offering a better quality of life to their children. She wakes up very early every morning to prepare breakfast for her children, and later goes off to her fields. What she likes best is to weed her fields, however, having to place traps for the pests is very dangerous and difficult for her. On the other hand, she realizes that this activity is very profitable, and thanks to this she has built her house. She lives a worry-free and comfortable life, and she can cover the costs of schooling for her children. For this reason she would like to increase her production by purchasing more productive land, and she would like to concentrate on buying and selling plantains and wholesale and retail prices. This is her fifth loan with MFP, and she assures you that she is very enthused to continue working in her communal group, who have shown themselves to be responsible and honest. With the loan she is asking for, she will buy bags of fertilizer to care for her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Sararn

texts.en: Mrs. Sararn C. is 38 years old and lives in Angk village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to grow crops. Her husband, Mr. Vanna Song, is a construction worker who earns a small income to support his family. Since her husband's workplace is far from the house, Mrs. Sararn C. decided to ask for a loan to purchase a motorcycle for transportation. This couple has six children: five attend the local school and help their mother farm and the youngest one is 3 years old. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Gladys Marlene

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Gladys B. es socia del banco comunal Renacer Uncovia, vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es la capital de la provincia del Azuay, reconocida por sus escritores y artistas, su bella arquitectura, sus 4 ríos quienes bañan esta hermosa ciudad, las manos hábiles de sus artesanos y su rica gastronomía.

La Señora. Gladis es socia del banco comunal hace 2 ciclos y ha sido invitada por una amiga de la banca comunal, los créditos el han beneficiado para su tienda ya se dedica a la venta de víveres, en la cual lleva trabajando 4 años y le va muy bien ya que cuenta con una clientela muy fiel, le hace falta dinero para surtirle mucho mas a su tienda, en la cual está abierta para todos los días de la semana desde las 6 a.m. hasta las 10 p.m.

Doña Gladys tiene 53 años de edad, es casada y fruto de su unión ha concebido 7 hijos quienes se encuentran de 30, 29, 28, 27, 17, 16 y 10 años de edad, sus 4  hijos mayores son casados y viven de manera independiente con sus familias que han formado, sus tres hijos últimos estudian los dos en un colegio y uno en la escuela respectivamente, su esposo trabaja como empleado privado en una empresa en la ciudad, con el esfuerzo del trabajo conyugal han logrado comprar su casa propia la que están pagando.

Este nuevo crédito lo va a invertir comprando víveres para surtir un poco mas su tienda, su meta es tener una tienda mas grande y también terminar de pagar su casa.
texts.en:
Gladys B. is a member of Communal Bank “Renacer Uncovia” (Uncovia Rebirth). She lives in the large city of Cuenca, the capital of Azuay Province. Cuenca is known for its writers and artists, its beautiful architecture, the four rivers that bathe this beautiful city, the skillful hands of its artisans, and its delicious cuisine.

Gladys has been a member of the Communal Bank for two loan cycles after being invited by a friend who is also a member. The loans have benefitted the store where she sells provisions. She has worked at her business for four years and has done very well because she has a very loyal customer base. However, she does not have the money to restock her store with more products. Her business is open every day of the week from 6am until 10pm.

Doña Gladys is 53 years old, married, and has given birth to seven children who are now 30, 29, 28, 27, 17, 16, and 10 years of age. Her four oldest children are married and live independently with families of their own. The three youngest children are students, two in high school and one in elementary school respectively. Her husband works as an employee for a private business in the city. By working together as a married couple, Gladys and her husband have been able to pay for their own home.

This new loan will be invested in provisions to slightly increase the inventory of her store. Her goal is to have a large store and also finish the payments on her house.
