Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sugar, oil, rice, soap, flour, eggs, cheese, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Chona

texts.en:
Ma. Chona B. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 41 years old. Ma. Chona is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Ma. Chona owns & operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from catching and selling shrimp, crabs and assorted fish at the market. Ma. Chona has been engaged in her business for over 21 years and earns approximately 20,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

Ma. Chona joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Ma. Chona is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to expand the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income and pay for her children's school fees.

“Asenso Loans are a new product offered by CEVI for clients showing strong performance in previous loans, and who need a larger loan in order to continue to develop. CEVI recognises the importance of helping people out of poverty, as well as providing continuous support and training as these clients progress. 

CEVI aims to provide financial services, not only our poorest clients, but also to our developing clients who should be rewarded for the way in which they display promising business skills. Please help us provide support for these clients”

loans.use: to expand the business

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice is 48 years old. She is married and has one 25-year-old child who is currently attending school. She has been practicing mixed farming for over 20 years in Kisii town, Western Kenya. Her farm produces maize, milk, tea and bananas which she sells to the local market. She also earns income from the sale of secondhand clothes and bricks.

Her primary challenges have been the high cost of transportation and the fluctuation in the prices of commodities.

Loice has requested this loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to expand her cereal business. The extra income from this loan will help her educate her child. She would like to expand her dairy business in the future.

She appreciates the good relationship between herself and Juhudi and hopes for the best through the partnership.

loans.use: To expand her cereal business.

loans.name: Otto

texts.es:
Otto G. N.  es un señor de  60 años de edad, que vive con su esposa y 3 hijos  en una comunidad de Costa Rica llamada General Viejo de Pérez Zeledón; está comunidad se destaca por estar ubicada en el Valle del General. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería, la agricultura y comercio este último ha crecido en gran manera brindando nuevas oportunidades de trabajo.

Don Otto se ha  dedicado  toda su vida  a la ganadería. Ahora la cría de cerdo  para engorde ha sido uno de sus principales actividades en la cual ya tiene 5 años de experiencia. El y dos socios más están construyendo la porqueriza más  grande de la comunidad.

El   desea obtener un micro crédito por un monto de ¢615 000 (seiscientos quince   mil colones) para comprar más cerdos y mejorar las condicione s de cuido e Infraestructura de su porqueriza. Con este préstamo espera alcanzar su meta de tener 150 cerdos para engorde y aprovechar el buen precio que tiene el producto en este momento.
Don Otto es socio de la Asociación de Productores El General, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su Sexto préstamo  y considera que su negocio va ser todo un éxito.
texts.en:
Otto G. N. is a 60 year old man that lives with his wife and 3 children in a community in Costa Rica called General Viejo de Pérez Zeledón. This community is noted for being located in the Valle del General. Its main economic activities are livestock breeding, agriculture and commerce, the last having grown tremendously offering new work opportunities. Don Otto has worked as a livestock breeder his whole life. Raising and fattening pigs has been one of his main activities for 5 years. He and two partners are building the largest pigsty in the community. He wants to obtain a micro loan for ¢615,000 (six hundred fifteen thousand colones - Costa Rican currency) to buy more pigs and make improvements to the infrastructure of the pigsty. With this loan he hopes to achieve his goal of having 150 pigs to fatten and take advantage of the good price that pigs are going for right now. Don Otto is a member of the Asociación de Productores El General, one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his sixth loan and he thinks that his business is going to be a success.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pigs and make improvements to the pigsty

loans.name: Marvin

texts.es:
Marvin A. N. es un señor de 45  años de edad quien en una pequeña comunidad llamada La Trinchera de Pital localizada en la provincia de Alajuela; cuyas principales actividades productivas son la ganadería y la agricultura, donde destaca el cultivo de la piña; siendo estas comercializadas principalmente en los mercados internacionales.  
	
Don Marvin es otro de los habitantes de esta comunidad que se han visto beneficiados por el desarrollo agroindustrial de esta zona. El se encarga de la jardinería y la corta de césped, asegura que tiene mucho trabajo y que la gente le gusta como lo hace. Sin embargo el ha tenido que frenar su trabajo ya que su desbrozadora se encuentra en muy mal estado. Es por eso que  necesita un préstamo de ¢300,000 (trescientos mil colones) para comprar una desbrozadora nueva y poder seguir con su trabajo.
 Dice que lo necesita urgente porque en 5 meses piensa casarse  y necesita trabajar para pagar sus gastos.

Marvin es socio de la Empresa Comunal de Mujeres al Éxito de la Trinchera de Pital, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico.
texts.en:
Marvin A. N. is a 45 year old man who lives in a small community named La Trinchera de Pital, located in the province of Alajuela. The main economic activities of Alajuela are ranching and agriculture- mainly the cultivation of pineapple, which is sold mainly on international markets. Marvin is one of the members of this community who has benefited from the agro-industrial development in this area. He is a gardener and a grass-cutter. He has a lot of business and people like the way he does his work. However, he has had to stop working because his trimmer is in very bad condition. This is why he needs a loan of ¢300,000 (300,000 colones) to purchase a new trimmer and continue with his work. He says that he needs this urgently because he is getting married in 5 months and he needs to work to pay their expenses. Marvin is a member of the Empresa Comunal de Mujeres al Exito de la Trinchera de Pital [Communal Enterprise of the Successful Women of La Trinchera de Pital], one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan and with it he hopes to continue growing personally and economically.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of a trimmer

loans.name: Lina

texts.es:
La Señora Lina es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Perlas II”, ubicado en la provincia de Huancané y departamento de Puno, tiene 36 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y tiene 02 hijo.
La señora Lina estudió educación secundaria (completo).

La señora Lina esta trabajando con Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde este ciclo,  nos cuenta que con el  préstamo solicitado de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, podrá incrementar su capital para su negocio de  venta de artefactos electrodomésticos.

Su sueño para el futuro  es tener una  tienda propia y tener una casa en el centro de la ciudad.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las  capacitaciones que se dan.
texts.en:
Lina is a member of the communal bank “Las Perlas II”, located in the province of Huancané, Puno department. She is 36 years old, married and has 2 children. Lina finished her secondary education. Lina has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos since this cycle. She tells us that with the loan she has asked for in the amount of S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, she will be able to increase the capital for her business selling appliances. Her dream for the future is to have her own store and have a house in the center of town. What she likes the most about her communal bank are the trainings that it has.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy appliances

loans.name: Eloy

texts.es:
El señor Eloy B. vive en la ciudad de Carapeguá, es casado, tiene 2 hijos, todos dependen de él económicamente. El se dedica al venta ambulante de productos varios (ropas, productos de limpieza, lencerias y analgesicos y otros.), cuenta con más de 100 clientes activos y tiene una antigüedad de 4 años en el ramo.
El señor Eloy trabaja con su esposa quien también firma como codeudora; cuenta con casa propia ubicada en la compañía Tajy Loma de la ciudad de Carapeguá.
Este préstamo invertirá en la compra de mercaderías que serán destinadas a la venta, de modo a obtener mayor cantidad de clientes.
Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir de forma puntual con el pago.
texts.en:
Eloy B. lives in the city of Carapeguá. He is married and has 2 children, both of which are economically dependent upon him. He works selling various products on foot (clothing, cleaning products, lingerie, painkillers, and other items). He has more than 100 active customers and he has been in the business for 4 years. Eloy works with his wife who is borrowing the loan with him. He has his own house located in Compañía Tajy Loma in the city of Carapeguá.

He will invest this loan in the purchase of merchandise to be sold so that he can get more customers.

He appreciates the Fundación Paraguaya for the loan and he promises to make his loan payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase various merchandise at wholesale price to then sell in retail.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a 33-year-old man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a father to two children aged 11 and 1. He owns a residential house where he lives. He is into the motorcycle business and has been in it for nine years now. He says he has managed to buy land and also construct a semi-permanent house through his business gains.

 William says it is tough for his business during the rainy seasons  as customers are hard to come by because of the rain and that competition has increased in his business sector of motorcycle transport. He intends to use the loan to buy a motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.use: Buying a motorcycle for transport business

loans.name: Mher

texts.en:
Mher P. manages his own business: trading of spare parts for cars, which he runs in a stall. He buys merchandise (tyre casings, wheel disks, steering wheels, machine oil, etc.) from Yerevan once a week and resell its in his business place in Kapan city. 

Mher was born in 1981 in Kapan city. He lives separately from his parents in a rented apartment. Thanks to his business’s incomes, he pays for his apartment, supports himself and his parents with the money he earns. 

Mher is asking for a $ 2.100 loan to buy winter tyre casings to resell.

loans.use: To buy winter tyre casings to resell

loans.name: Ma. Rochel

texts.en:
Ma. Rochel D. P. is a married woman who lives in Prk. Republic, Brgy. 4, Roxas, Palawan. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  sari-sari (general) store and tricycle (public transport) operator businesses. Her husband Allan D. P., who is 26 years old, works as a tricycle driver to earn his living. They have 2 children who are 3 and 6 years old. 

Ma. Rochel joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ma. Rochel has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 24,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 12,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 14th loan, she is borrowing PHP 27,000 which she intends to use as additional capital for her business so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children and to purchase a parcel of land. 

Ma. Rochel D. P. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:  

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Tin's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tin S. is a 32 year old married woman, and she has been selected the group leader by its four members.  She and her spouse have three children: two are attending the local school and the last one is 5 years old and not in school yet. 

They are located in Tboung Kdei village in Kandal province.  Each member of this village group will use their portion of the loan to support a different purpose.  
 
Mrs. Tin S. earns her living by selling fish in the market.  Her husband, Mr. Yung Van Chum, 35 years old, works as a car mechanic.  With their occupations, they still do not earn enough income to support the family.  In order to increase their income and improve the family condition, Mrs. Tin S. decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets for raise for sale.

loans.use: To buy piglets for raise for sale.

loans.name: Bazar

texts.en:
Bazar Y. is 52 years old and lives with his wife in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in Hovd province in Mongolia. Bazar sells firewood with the help of his wife at a local market in his town only during the winter months. In the summer they have a meat trading business to supplement their earnings.

Bazar started his business in 1998 and has since gained much experience in his trade. After many years of successful operation, their business has grown into a stable operation. 

Bazar is a very optimistic and hardworking man. “In the future,” he says, "I would like to expand my business and buy my own car." He is requesting a 2,600,000 MNT loan to purchase more firewood for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more firewood

loans.name: Roeun

texts.en: Roeun C. is a girl who presently lives with her family in the province of Kompong Chhnang. She is a sewing worker in private factory which is located in her province. She supports her family's daily expenses with her monthly salary. Roeun C. has 2 years experience in this sector. Previous repairs have been made on Roeun C.’s house, but now she lacks cash to pay for construction fees. To clear this problem, Roeun C. would like to borrow some funds to add with her personal savings to pay for construction costs.

loans.use: To pay for construction cost.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Pro Desarrollo” cooperative bank, located in the Pisac district of the province of Calca.

His name is Alfredo and he is 43 years old. He is married and has three children. He is planning to use the loan to invest in his transportation business.  Several times a week he will transport goods from Pisac to Calca or Urubamba in the Sacred Valley.

He is very happy with the loan granted and commits to making his payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: To invest in transportation business.

loans.name: Metrine

texts.en:
Metrine is a married woman who lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is rent.

She has been operating her business for the past two years, selling clothes and detergents from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. Metrine faces a major challenge in the seasonality of demands in her business. During the rainy winter season, the demand for heavy clothing is high compared to the hot summer season. She hopes to establish a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase two bundles of clothes and detergents for resale. She decided to join Yehu because of its good reputation in the community.

loans.use: To purchase clothes & detergents to resell

loans.name: Ngoun

texts.en: Mrs. Ngoun S. is 61 years old and has nine children. Three of them are married, two live outside the family home, and the others are garment factory workers. Her source of income is from her children’ salaries.  Nguon is applying for his first loan of $1,000 to build a shop for her son-in-law to operate business repairing motorbikes.

loans.use: To build a shop for her son-in-law to operate a motorbike repair business

loans.name: Maria Natividad

texts.es:
Maria tiene 47 años de edad, tiene tres hijos y vive en la ciudad de Cusco, Perú.  Maria se dedica a la confección de chompas de lana para bebes, niños y adultos, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar  madejas de lana. Ya son varios años que se dedica a la confección de chompas y le va muy bien.       
     
Maria pertenece al banco comunal “Unión, Fuerza y Amistad” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
María is 47 years old and has three children; she lives in the city of Cusco, Perú.  María makes sweaters for babies, children and adults.  On this occasion she wants a loan to buy skeins of wool.  She has been making sweaters for several years now and does very well.

María is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “Unión, Fuerza y Amistad” (Unity, Strength & Friendship) communal bank.  While expressing her gratitude for the opportunity provided through this means she also pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy skeins of wool.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to expand her father's business and purchase a shop

loans.name: Hussain

texts.en: Hussain is a 31 year-old married man living in Chtaura with his wife and child. He has worked in transportaion since 2000. He owns a small van which he uses to take people on trips all over Lebanon, in addition to others going from school or work at home. Hussain is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua to do necessary maintenance to his van in addition to undergoing important medical surgery. Hussain is an honest man, well known in the region; most of his clients are relatives, friends and neighbors. He hopes to improve his business and own a big taxi or tourist company. He also hopes to provide happiness and good health to his wfe and child.

loans.use: To do necessary maintenance to his van

loans.name: Talantbek

texts.en:
Talantbek M. is 38, married, and has three sons. He started his cattle-breeding business in 2005 with an initial capital of 4,000 KGS, which was used for purchasing one calf. Today he has a small farm with two milch cows. With the revenues from selling milk and meat products, he was able to buy a car. Talantbek has broadened his activities by providing transportation services, which bring in additional earnings for the family.
 
Talantbek has applied for a loan of 130,000 KGS to purchase three milch cows and forage for his cattle. With the revenues, he plans to reconstruct his barn and increase the number of cattle. 

Bai Tushum & Partners uses Kiva funding to target especially vulnerable populations. Bai Tushum & Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plastic slippers and bales of waxed cotton cloth

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en:
Tahir S. is 55 years old. He is married and has four children. Tahir is the sole breadwinner for his family and his only income comes from raising sheep and selling them at the local market. Every year he buys lambs from the farms in adjacent villages. He raises them with the help of his wife and then sells the adult sheep to local butchers. 

People in Azerbaijan uses mutton in everyday life and this business is very profitable, especially if you can cover high demand.  Tahir is thinking about expanding his business, since the income from his present herd isn't enough to provide for his family and cover needs of his clients. He plans to purchase additional sheep and lambs; to do this, he needs to invest an additional 1000 AZN in his business.

loans.use: to purchase 10 lambs and 5 sheep.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members. Sarah has a pub business. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works six days a week. Sarah sells her products in a shop, by means of retail. Sarah has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more mobile phones and airtime. The main business challenges for Sarah include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to build her own business premises and also to own a fully stocked mobile shop. Sarah lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, utility bills, and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more mobile phones, chargers, and batteries

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 31 years old and single. He runs a retail shop where he sells sugar, cooking fat, tea leaves, salt and soap. Besides this business, he is also employed. Joseph was previously selling clothes to earn a living. He has sustained his business for one and a half years because of his good customer care skills. His dream is to own rental houses in the future. He has requested a loan of 80,000 KES to buy sugar, rice, maize flour, cooking fat and diapers for his store.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, maize flour, cooking fat and diapers for his store.

loans.name: Rey David

texts.es:
Rey David es un hombre trabajador, de oficio de costura, con más de dos años laborando en zona franca, es un padre de tres hermosos hijos, y como objetivo es la educación para sus hijos y una mejor vivienda.
Pues tiene su propia casa, muy sencilla el cual ha venido mejorando atreves de financiamiento que Afodenic ha otorgado en varios ciclos. Siendo a plazo el cual equilibra sus gastos.
Lo que desea hacer es poder cambiar el techo, en la compra de láminas de zinc, cuartones y reglas de madera para poder cambiar ya que tiene dificultad en los días de lluvias.
Como planes es seguir mejorando la vivienda, ya que solo por este medio le es posible.
texts.en:
Rey David is a hardworking gentleman who is a tailor by profession. He has worked more than two years in the free trade zone. Rey David is the father of three beautiful children. His goals are to provide an education for his children and to make improvements to his home.

Rey David owns a very simple house and has made improvements with the financing he has received over several loan cycles with AFODENIC. He feels that the loans have helped to balance out his expenses.

Rey David wants to replace the roof, so he will purchase sheets of zinc, beams, and wooden frames so that work can begin. He currently experience difficulties on days when it rains. His plan is to continue making improvements to his home since this is the only way possible.

loans.use: to purchase materials for replacing the roof of his house.

loans.name: Kevina

texts.en:
Kevina is a single mother of four children, all  of whom go to school. She doesn't take care of  additional family members.  She owns a restuarant  and works seven days a week.  She has been in business for the last nine years.  She works from her home and her neighbors are her customers. 

Kevina has requested a loan of 100,000 from MCDT SACCO to purchase more food items, like bunches of bananas, beef and rice. Kevina's major challenges are thieves and transportation of food staffs from the market to her home.  Kevina aspires to see her business grow big so that she can own a fully-stocked restaurant.  She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include food, rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas, beef and rice

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is 41 years of age and married. She has been blessed with four children. She manages a motorcycle transportation business. Her monthly net income is 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP). She's asking for a loan of 6,000 PHP to pay for the repair and maintenance of her motorcycle. She hopes to one day open another business to increase her revenue and to continue borrowing from Kiva and ASKI so she can reach her business goal.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Maripa's Group

texts.en:
Maripa is the leader of this group. She is 33 and married to a farmer. Together with her husband she is bringing up their son, 14, who studies at school. In order to earn money to help the family budget, Maripa cultivates agricultural products, potatoes and wheat mostly, and her husband is engaged in cattle breeding. In this way the family makes money to meet their daily needs. Maripa applied for the loan because she needs additional financial funds for purchasing cattle. She hopes that the loan will help her husband to raise the profits gained from reselling cattle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SANTO DOMINGO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gloria; ella tiene 38 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurant y también tiene un negocio de venta de comida que lo realiza los días domingos en el baratillo que es un lugar donde vende cosas de segunda mano, la socia trabaja en el restaurant desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m, por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere implementar su restaurant y ampliar el negocio de venta de comida. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y carne al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank "SANTO DOMINGO".  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province of Cusco, and department of Cusco.

The member is Señora Gloria.  She is 38 years old, she lives with her partner and has 5 children.  The member combines her daily activities with the business of  a restaurant.  She also has a business selling food that takes place on Sundays in the flea market where people sell second hand goods.  The member works at the restaurant from 8:00 am to 9:00 pm.  Through these businesses, the member helps her children to get ahead in life.  

The member wants to increase her restaurant business and expand her business selling food.  The member is requesting the loan to buy cooking products such as rice, vegetables and meat at wholesale.

The member is happy for the loan and agrees to comply with the repayments.

loans.use: to buy products for cooking, such as rice, vegetables, and meat at wholesale.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is married but has no children. She is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Elsa is a farmer and grows vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. She has requested a loan for 20,000 to purchase farm fertilizer. 

Elsa has been a member of PMPC for 8 years. She hopes to buy basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs or fertilizers.

loans.name: C4723 Tubumwe Group

texts.en:
Sarah is 27 years old and is married with eight children. Her business is well-organized and is well known in this business of selling secondhand. Sarah is the team leader of this group which is called "TUBUMWE" in the local language. In the picture, Sarah is the third person from the right side. Her business hours are from 8am until 5pm every day. She has three years of experience in this business. 

Sarah and her team have requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase their businesses by buying more secondhand clothes and so on for resale. They will reinvest the profits in their businesses and save for their futures.

loans.use: To purchase more secondhand clothing for resale.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 44 years old and has been a tricycle operator for nine years.  She is married and blessed with two grade-school children. As a tricycle operator, she can afford the daily allowances of her children. She hopes that her children will not resemble her, since she did not finish education because of her poverty. She is working every day just to earn enough money for their education.

For operating daily, her motorcycle also feels weakened similar to a man. Rosalina is requesting a loan amount of P5,000 to be used for maintenance of her motorcycle. She hopes to immediately recover it in order to provide a better transportation services.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Anifa

texts.en:
Anifa is a married woman with six children. Four of her children attend school, while the other two have already graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a vegetable stall business, where she sells vegetables to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition and price fluctuation in the market. Anifa dreams of expanding and establishing another business in the future.

With the loan in the amount of 15,000 KES she is requesting, she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, and onions for re-sale purposes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, onions and potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Mikayil

texts.en: Mikayil is a 46-year-old, married man with one daughter. Eight years ago Mikayil decided to start his own business selling office supplies and lottery tickets. Hence, he opened a store which he operates with his loving family. His store has a very good location in the central city bazaar. His monthly income is 250 USD. Mikayil has plentiful orders for a variety of lottery tickets and office supplies and now is applying for a loan of 1500 AZN to fulfill his orders. This will be his 2nd loan and he has a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more office supplies to increase profit

loans.name: Khmeb

texts.en: Khmeb is 44 years old and provides a motor taxi service, earning $5 per day. His wife sells groceries at home and earns $2 per day. They have 3 children: two are studying and one works earning $3 per day. Every month, he has to spend $45 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on school fees, $10 on transportation and $20 on other expenses. He would like to request a loan of $800 to buy a musical instrument for his son to join some relatives in providing a music service. The loan will help his son to have a real career and to support himself and his family in the future.

loans.use: To buy a musical instrument

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Teresa has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Teresa has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Teresa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal María Del Carmen se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi (Portoviejo). Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla, ciudad de clima fresco y con muchos atractivos turísticos naturales propios de la zona.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Rosa, tiene 51 años de edad está casada y de  esta relación tiene tres hijos dos mayores y la menor de 9 años de edad la misma que estudia en escuela, todos sus hijos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo es comerciante.
 
Ella realiza el crédito  para ayudar a su esposo con su negocio, él se dedica a la venta de productos químicos como cloro, detergentes, creso, entre otros, él recorre la ciudad ofreciendo sus productos los mismos que luego lleva a entregar de acuerdo a lo que le pidan sus clientes, trabaja de lunes a sábado y  lleva 7 años en su negocio, los productos los va a comprar a Guayaquil donde los compra más baratos en un laboratorio de químicos.

Este crédito es para comprar cloro, creso, detergentes, etc. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque les va muy bien en el grupo. 

Su sueño es tener una tienda o un bazar.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank María Del Carmen meets twice a month in the canton of Montecristi (Portoviejo). This place is famous for its straw hats, cool climate and the many local natural tourist attractions.

Here we meet Rosa who is 51 years old, married and from this relationship she has three children, two older and the youngest is 9 years old and he attends school. All of her children still live in her home. Her husband is a businessman. 

She is asking for a loan in order to help her husband with his business. He sells chemical products such as chlorine, detergents, and creosote among other items. He travels through the city offering his products, and then makes deliveries in accordance with his customers requests. He works Monday through Saturday and has been in this business for 7 years. He buys his products in Guayaquil where he can buy them cheaper from a chemical lab.

This loan is to buy chlorine, creosote, detergents and other products. She is an original member of the Communal Bank and she likes it because she gets along very well with the group. 

Her dream is to have a store or a bazaar.

loans.use: to buy chlorine, creosote, detergents and other items

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana is 46 years old, married, and has 10 children aged 2 to 27.  She and her husband run a fishing business in Trinidad, Bohol. They have had this business for 19 years. Each month, they earn 9,000 PHP from fishing. She does her best to support their big family. She sells banana cues (deep fried bananas coated in caramelized brown sugar) and other kinds of delicacies to help augment their income.

Rosana has requested this loan to purchase fishing nets, baits and other materials. She hopes for their fishing business to grow, and to be able to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, baits and other materials

loans.name: Rosario Cecibel

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San Vicente se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora, Rosario  tiene 39 años de edad está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos de 16, 15, 12 y 9 años de edad, los dos mayores estudian en colegio y los  dos menores en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella es una gran ama de casa que en sus momentos libres se dedica al igual que su esposo al comercio, ella y su marido venden zapatillas, ropa de todo tipo e interiores. Mientras su marido se va a otras ciudades a  vender sus productos ella se dedica a realizar sus ventas por la localidad, ella vende puerta a puerta, deja a crédito y cobra cada fin de semana, llevan más de 15 años dedicados a esta actividad y su mercadería la compran en Guayaquil ya que allá les sale más barato.

Este crédito lo va  a emplear para comprar ropa,  ropa interior y zapatillas. Esta casi desde que se creó el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le han servido de mucho para sacar adelante su negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener un almacén de ropa en el centro de la ciudad
texts.en:
The communal bank San Vicente meets bimonthly in the Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo, a city known for being very commercial, for its traditional festivals of San Pedro and San Pablo and for the friendliness of its people.  

Here we meet Señora Rosario.  She is 39 years old, married and has four children ages 16,15,12 and 9 from this relationship.  The two older children attend secondary school and the younger ones are in primary school.  Her husband is a merchant.  

She is a fabulous homemaker who, in her free time, also helps her husband with the business.  They sell shoes, all types of clothing and undergarments.  While her husband travels to other cities to sell his products, she stays in town to sell.  She sells door to door, extending credit and collecting every weekend.  They have been doing this for more than 15 years.  They buy their merchandise in Guayaquil as it is cheaper there.   

She will use this loan to buy clothing, undergarments and shoes.  She has been a member of the communal bank almost since the beginning and she likes it because the loans have really helped her to get ahead with her business.  
 
Her dream is to have a clothing store in the downtown area.

loans.use: purchase clothing, undergarments and shoes.

loans.name: Raúl

texts.es: Raúl de 33 años de edad, habita en casa propia junto con su grupo familiar el cual está integrado por su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos los cuales se encuentran cursando sus primeros años de estudio. Para Raúl lo más importante es su familia y es por ella que trabaja duramente para poder dar el pan de cada día y cubrir las necesidades más necesarias. Raúl se dedica a la producción y venta de pan. Posee una panadería en la cual vende variedad  de deliciosos panes. Tiene 14 años de dedicarse al negocio por lo que ya ha adquirido muchos años de experiencia, además ha logrado establecer algunos clientes que son muy fieles al servicio que él ofrece. Su sueño es ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales, en mejores condiciones que las que él ha tenido. Esta es la razón por la que lucha con todas sus fuerzas para mantener vivo el negocio que por muchos años les ha proporcionado lo necesario para sobrevivir. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio es decir poder tener la capacidad de cubrir una mayor demanda que le genere mayores ingresos. Esto lo ha llevado a tomar la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la materia prima necesaria (harina, azúcar, canela, agua, huevos, colorantes, aceite, etc.), que le permita lograr su objetivo de cubrir una mayor demanda que le genere una mejora en los ingresos percibidos de tal forma que su calidad de vida y la de su familia puedan mejorar con el tiempo.
texts.en:
Raúl is 33 years old and lives in his own house with his family which comprises his partner and 2 children who are currently in their first years at school. The most important thing for Raúl is his family and it is for them that he works hard to give them their daily bread and cover the most basic necessities. Raúl makes and sells bread. He owns a bakery where he sells a variety of delicious breads. He has been in the business for 14 years which has given him a lot of experience. In addition he has managed to establish a very loyal client base of several customers for the service he offers. His dream is to see his children become professonals, with better living conditions than he himself has had. This is the reason why he works hard with all his might to keep the business alive, a business which for many years has allowed them to survive. His dream is to expand the business to have the capacity to meet increased demand to generate more income. This has led him to take the decision to ask INTEGRAL for a loan to invest in his basic ingredients (flour, sugar, cinnamon, water, eggs, food colourings, oil, etc.) which will allow him to reach his goal of meeting increased demand to generate improved earnings so that his and his family's quality of life can improve over time.

.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, cinnamon, water, eggs, food colourings, oil etc.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel, aged 38, is married to Dorcas. They are blessed with two children, aged 6 and 13 years. Samuel sells household utensils, and the business gives him a monthly income of Kes.7,000.

This is his first loan with KADET Ltd.  He will use the funds to buy more utensils: plates, cups,  jugs, basins, etc., for sale. Samuel hopes to open a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy plates, curios, spoons, and jugs

loans.name: Joice

texts.en: Joice, 52 years old, is married to a retired teacher and they have six children ranging from twenty-five to thirty-five years of age. She describes herself as a talkative and social woman. She has been running a retail shop for the last four years. She also increases her income by working at a hospital as a nurse. Her business challenge is insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more wheat flour. In the next five years, Joice's hope and plan is to be a wholesaler.

loans.use: To buy more wheat flour.

loans.name: Prodige Plus Group

texts.en:
Damien is the leader of the community bank named “Prodige Plus." It is composed of 11 members united in solidarity to receive Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Damien is a carpenter, and a sofa and armchair maker. He is also an upholsterer. In addition to that, he runs a general store. He opened it in 2009 with a beginning capital of US $50. He has been a micro entrepreneur since 1978.

In 2009, when he learned about Hope from one of his friends, he decided to join the group that was formed in his area--Prodige Plus. He took the first US $60 loan to open a small general store. Damien is a trustworthy client of the MFI HOPE RDC, having six times obtained and correctly repaid loans. He will, with his next loan, purchase the raw materials, including timber, to allow him to make a sofa and two armchairs to sell at profit, and reinforce the inventory of his store. Currently, he earns a profit of US $400 per month. Damien and his family are gradually becoming financially independent. He is married and the father of four children between the ages of 17 and 30 years old. One of them goes to school.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials, including timber, for his workshop

loans.name: Martha Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Martha del Carmen es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien desde hace 10 años se dedica al comercio de ropa desde pantalones, blusas, camisas…etc. de manera ambulante. El crédito lo invertirá en ropa de  mujer y principalmente en encargos que tiene para el día de las madres.

loans.use: comprar mercaderia en ropa

loans.name: Francisco Jose

texts.es: El sr. Francisco Rosales de 38 anos de edad del departamento  de Chinandega, municipio de chichigalpa, es casado con tres hijos edad de 18, 16,10 anos. chichigalpa es un municipio que se caracteriza por ser una zona productora de cana de azúcar, por sus ingenios, un lugar de gente muy sencilla pero muy trabajadora del campo con siembras de cultivos. Francisco tiene  por negocio el servicio de barbería  desde hace ocho anos, ubicado en su casa de habitación. El cual lo inicio  desde muy joven como aprendiz en una barbería con el tiempo decidió aventurarse a poner su propia barbería con su esfuerzo y su disciplina es que ha podido hacer su clientela, mantenerla y aumentarla. Francisco es una persona muy carismáticas, conocida por su municipio y sus clientela las cuales son personas del genero masculinos de todas la edades, el cual se ha dado a conocer  por la calidad de sus trabajo, ya que para él ha sido mas que  un oficio digno del cual se siente orgulloso porque lo considera mas que un trabajo una satisfacción y un arte. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en herramientas de la barbería y sillas para darles condiciones  a los clientes y poder mantener y aumentar la afluencia a su negocio y de dicha forma incrementar sus ingresos. Las herramientas son: maquina de rasurar, navajas, peines, alzas para maquinas, toallas, loción,  secadora de pelo, talco, brochas, guilles para afeitar, tijeras. Francisco agradece a los inversionistas kiva  por la ayuda que les brindan a  personas de escasos recurso  y países pobres como es Nicaragua.

loans.use: para invertir en herramientas de trabajo se servicio de barberia. tijeras, maquinas, brochas.

loans.name: Nzaka

texts.en:
Nzaka lives in Mombasa area of Coast Province, Kenya. He has two children, neither of whom attend school. He is a fisherman, a trade he has run for twelve years. He is also a farmer.

He learnt about Milango through a friend with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenge is the fluctuating market due to seasonality and the perishability of his products.

Nzaka is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to buy fishing nets. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to cater for the needs of the family. His plan for the future is to expand into wholesale fish mongering.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets.

loans.name: Dinora Del Carmen

texts.es:
Dinora, de 32 años de edad, estudio hasta séptimo grado, se separó de su esposo, pero se volvió a acompañar, es madre de cuatro hijos, de los cuales 1 de ellos  vive con el papá y los otros tres viven con ella y estudian a excepción del último que aún no estudia porque está muy pequeña.

Dinora, se dedica a comprar y vender ropa y ayuda a su mamá a vender pescado seco, ella desde que era adolescente  trabaja vendiendo diferentes productos; ahora sale a vender la ropa a una distancia de tres kilómetros y lo hace en horas de la mañana.

Dinora, necesita el préstamo para comprar blusas, ropa interior para damas y caballeros, así como también ropa para niños de ambos sexos y de esa manera ofrecer mejor servicio a sus clientes.  
 
Dinora, sueña con ampliar su negocio y contratar a otra persona que le ayude con las ventas cuando sale a vender.

loans.use: para comprar blusas, ropa interior para damas y caballeros, así como también ropa para niños de ambos sexos.

loans.name: Akou

texts.en:
Akou K. was born in Tsévié in 1955. As the daughter of peasants, she did not have the opportunity to go to school, much like the other girls of her generation. From a young age, she has been selling mush throughout the city. She married a laborer and has five children. Everything was going so well when suddenly he died in a traffic accident. Since then, all family expenses have fallen onto her shoulders. To deal with the situation, she got a $350 loan, which she repaid without a problem.

An honest and energetic woman, she has always put into practice the management advice she receives, all to improve her business and make it profitable. To strengthen her business, she is requesting a loan of $850 to stock up on rice, sugar, and other basic goods. She will then be able to increase her income to improve the living conditions of her orphan children and her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame K. Akou est née à Tsévié en 1955. Fille de paysans, elle n’a pas eu la chance de faire des études à l’instar des autres filles de son époque. Depuis son jeune âge, elle vend de la bouillie à travers les quartiers de la ville. Mariée à un ouvrier, elle a eu cinq (05) enfants. Tout allait si bien quand subitement le mari décède à la suite d’un accident de circulation. Depuis ce temps, toutes les dépenses de la famille sont revenues à sa charge. Pour faire face à la situation, elle a obtenu un crédit de $350 qu’elle a déjà remboursé sans difficulté.

Honnête et dynamique, elle a toujours mis en application les conseils en gestion reçus pour améliorer et rentabiliser ses activités. Pour renforcer son activité, elle sollicite un crédit de $ 850 qui va lui permettre de s’approvisionner en riz, sucre et autres produits de première nécessité. Elle pourra augmenter ses revenus afin d’améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants orphelins et de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy rice and essential grocery items.

loans.name: Rasmah

texts.en: R. is a 46-year-old mother with 4 children. She has been selling cooked food such as fish, chicken, and vegetables for 4 years at her small shop. She very much needs to get a $50 loan to buy more goods, so that she can earn more income. She usually earns $10/day. Her husband, Mucing, has a tailoring business at the house. The income from the tailoring  business is going down now, but it could rise in the festive season. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Preparing and selling cooked food

loans.name: Olga Lidia

texts.en:
Olga Lidia is 39 years old. She is a single mother with two small children and lives in the town of Cadereyta, in the state of Nuevo León. With the objective of helping her children to get ahead in life, she began her own business selling slightly used clothes five years ago. This job also allows her to give her children the time and attention they need. She began with very little capital, but with the sales experience she has acquired she has been able to grow her business. She now offers her products in several street markets and has also incorporated perfume sales.

In order to offer her customers wider variety and increase her sales, Olga is requesting a loan of $925.00, which she will use to buy merchandise. She promises to pay back the loan over a period of 6 to 12 months. You can be an important part of the well being of this family. Your help will be of great use to this business. Thank you very much.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Olga Lidia tiene 39 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos pequeños y viven en la localidad de Cadereyta del estado de Nuevo León. Con el propósito de sacar adelante a sus hijos emprendió su propio negocio vendiendo ropa semi nueva hace cinco años, este oficio también le permite tener el tiempo y las atenciones que necesitan sus hijos, inició con muy poco capital pero con la experiencia que ha adquirido en las ventas ha logrado hacer crecer su negocio, ahora ofrece sus productos en varios mercados ambulantes, y también ha incorporado la venta de perfumes.

Para ofrecer una mayor variedad a sus clientes e incrementar sus ventas, Olga solicita un préstamo por $ 925 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía, mismos que se compromete a devolver en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Tú puedes ser parte importante en el bienestar de esta familia, tú ayuda será de gran utilidad para este negocio, muchas gracias.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Petrona

texts.en:
Ms. Petrona F. is 60 years old, single, and has 5 sons now of age. She lives with her sons and nieces making it a house of 10 people. Thanks to her hard work and dedication in her diner, she has been able to recently purchase her own house where they all live.

She works in a diner cooking for over 50 employees of a ship. Her sons also help in her selling fast food meals such as empanadas, milanesas, sandwiches, tortillas, etc. Aside from breakfast, lunch, and dinner, she also offers edibles at her stand such as sweets and drinks. She requires the loan to be able to expand her patio to be able to house more customers as well as to provide them with further commodities. She also needs the money to be able to buy more kitchen products as the current ones are getting old.

She is a part of a group of 15 female entrepreneurs who name themselves “Juntas Podemos” (“We can do it together”).

loans.use: To buy kitchen utensils such as pots, frying pans, plates, forks, spoons, and knives.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga is a married mother of three, all of whom are in school. Her husband works for a company that makes brooms, and his salary isn't enough to cover all their expenses. So two and a half years ago Olga decided to help him by starting her own business. A friend turned her on to selling beauty products via catalogue, and she started selling items to neighbors, friends and relatives. Now she has a long list of steady customers and wants to keep at the job and help the business grow.

Olga is requesting a loan of $375 to fulfill her pending orders and offer a wider selection of products at better prices to her customers. She plans to repay the loan within six months. She and her family are very grateful for your support in helping the business move forward and improving their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Olga esta casada y tiene tres hijos, todos están estudiando, su esposo es obrero en una empresa que hace escobas, y no le alcanzaba con el sueldo que ganaban para poder mantener a su hogar, por ella es que Olga decidió ayudarlo poniéndose a trabajar desde hace mas de dos años y medio, fue por invitación de una amiga a este tipo de ventas por catálogo y luego ella empezó a vender entre sus vecinos, amigos y familiares, y ya ahora su cartera de clientes es fija y desea continuar con su negocio y crecer con el mismo.

Olga esta solicitando un préstamo por US $ 375 para surtir sus pedidos pendientes y ofrecer más surtido de productos a mejor precio a sus clientes, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Ella y su familia agradecen mucho el apoyo que le brindas para poder salir adelante con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Ngozi

texts.en: Mrs. A. Ngozi is 49 years old and is married with 3 children.  She hails from Edo State, Nigeria and is currently a LAPO member.  She is requesting a loan of $800 to enable her to buy more kitchen utensils to sell.

loans.use: To buy more kitchen utensils to sell.

loans.name: Abdullobeck

texts.en: Abdullobeck S. lives in Mastchoh and he is married and has five children. He has been a client of MicroInvest since 2006 and he recommends himself as a serious and strongly-motivated client. His loan sums are permanently increased which shows his business's stability and his income increase. He has the wide-side business including livestock raising and selling, milk production and work out. He dreams of purchasing a horn pedigree bull and a milk cow for further meat and milk and sour-milk goods production (its supply to the bazaars and his family is secure by the milk and sour products). He plans to include in the assortment the following milk and sour products: pasteurized milk, sour milk, sour cream, curd and etc. Now he requires a loan in 1800 STJ for a horn pedigree bull and a pedigree milk cow which will allow him to significantly increase his family's income and will also permits him to plan further business and a wider assortment of milk goods.

loans.use: Abdullobeck would like to purchase a horn pedigree bull and a pedigree milk cow.

loans.name: Cecilia's Furaha Group

texts.en:
Cecilia is 46 years old. She is married and has three children, ages 14, 12, and 8. She is a food vendor and started her business in 2006. She works from 7am to 10pm daily, selling a variety of dishes and snacks. She makes a monthly profit of about $270 from this business.

Cecilia hopes for a loan to buy more food items in order to expand the services available to her customers. She will share this loan with her subgroup who all have businesses dealing in food and clothing sales.

loans.use: To buy food to sell

loans.name: Claudia Yanina

texts.es:
Yanina is 38 years old. She is married and has two young sons who are 12 and 14 years old. Her husband is a civil engineer and he works for a construction company. They live in the neighborhood of Anexo Villa Venezuela. Eight years ago Yanina decided to begin a business that would generate income with which she could cover the household costs, her children’s education, and improvements to her house. Her husband’s job is not stable as he is not working as a permanent employee.

It is due to this situation that Yanina decided to work selling traditional crafts, such as hammocks, ceramic jars, wooden chairs, wall decorations, tables, vases, flowers, among other products, to Costa Rica and Honduras. She goes to those countries 2 to 4 times per month. She stays for 3 or 4 days until she sells the last of the products she has.

It is through this type of business, and her husband’s economic contribution, that this family has gotten ahead and has been improving its living and housing conditions. The house is currently unprotected and insecure because Yanina hasn’t finished the wall around it. She needs a loan to finish building the wall in front of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Yanina tiene 38 años de edad, es casada, tiene 2 hijos varones de 12 y 14 años de edad, su esposo es Ingeniero Civil, trabaja en una empresa constructora, habitan en el Anexo Villa Venezuela.Hace 8 años Yanina decidió realizar una actividad que le generara ingresos con los cuales pudiera cubrir los gastos de la casa, la educación de sus hijos y mejorar su vivienda, debido que el trabajo de su esposo es inestable, ya que él no se encuentra en una empresa como trabajador permanente. Es debido a esta situación que la señora se dedico a comercializar Artesanía Tradicional como hamacas, jarrones, sillas de maderas, adornos de pared, mesas, floreros, flores, entre otros productos a Costa Rica y Honduras, el cual es visitado de 2 a 4 veces al mes, permanece 3 o 4 días en esos países hasta que venda el último producto que ofrece. Con este tipo de actividad y con el aporte económico de su esposo, es como esta familia ha salido adelante y ha ido mejorando su condición de vida y habitacional de su vivienda, la cual en estos momentos se encuentra desprotegida e insegura, ya que la señora no tiene terminado el muro de su vivienda. Yanina necesita un préstamo para terminar de cerrar el muro de enfrente de su vivienda.

loans.use: To build a wall around her house

loans.name: Hayel

texts.en:
Hayel is a 29-year-old man who lives in southern Lebanon, in Nabatieh. Hayel is a car mechanic.

This is the first time Hayel has applied for a loan at A. Majmoua. He wants to buy tools for his business and with the increased income generated from the investment, he plans to open a store specializing in car decoration.

Hayel is a very ambitious man striving to seize every opportunity he gets to grow professionally.

loans.use: To buy tools for his business.

loans.name: Bienaventuradas I Group

texts.es:
The meetings of the Bienaventuradas Communal Bank are exceptionally festive. The women have been working together for many years and that greatly helps the consolidation and integration of the group.

The disbursal took place during an intense but typical rainstorm in the district of Maza. Despite the rain, one could hear the unsurpassable laughter. During the meeting, the group was interviewed. The women told me that the majority works reselling used clothing and breeding animals. It seems that in this part of Guatemala, raising bulls, pigs and chickens is very profitable, especially during the holiday seasons. The women are very satisfied with their credit and for that reason have been requesting a loan from the institution for more than three years.

The women are not only grateful to Friendship Bridge for the financial help lent to them, but also for the educational assistance. They told me that the information about women’s preventive health and the use of herbal medicines provided by the Bacilia credit agency was very helpful. Also, the women feel that the knowledge gained about women’s rights and inter-family violence was very valuable for some members of the group.

Programs like Friendship Bridge that offer easily accessible credit to clients who live in rural areas, in addition to education about health and women’s rights, are important to the development of Guatemala. This is because for many years the poor, especially women, have been discriminated against by the system. These institutions give them a chance to grow as individuals. Through Kiva, you are also contributing to the development of the country and giving them an opportunity.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Las reuniones del banco comunal Bienaventuradas son excepcionalmente alegres. Las mujeres han venido trabajando juntas desde hace ya muchos años y eso ayuda mucho a la consolidación he integración del grupo.

El desembolso se llevó acabo durante una intensa, pero típica, lluvia en el cantón Maza. A pesar de la lluvia uno podía escuchar las risas inigualables. Durante dicha reunión procedí a entrevistar al grupo. Las compañeras me contaron que la gran mayoría de ellas trabaja en el negocio de reventa de ropa y la crianza de animales. Al parecer en esa área de Guatemala la crianza de toros, cerdos y pollos es M. rentable, especialmente en épocas festivas. Las mujeres están M. contentas con su crédito, es por eso que han venido solicitando un préstamo a la institución por más de tres años.

Las mujeres no solo están contentas con Friendship Bridge por el servicio financiero que se les presta, sino por el educacional también. Ellas me comentaron que las capacitaciones impartidas por la agente de crédito Bacilia, de salud preventiva de la mujer y la utilización de plantas medicinales fueron M. provechosas. Asimismo, las clientas consideraron que la capacitación sobre derechos de la mujer y violencia intrafamiliar fue de mucho valor para algunas integrantes del grupo.

Programas como Friendship Bridge que otorgan créditos cómodos a clientas que viven en áreas rurales y capacitaciones en salud y derechos de la mujer son M. importantes para el desarrollo de Guatemala. Esto se debe a que por muchos años los pobres, especialmente las mujeres, han sido marginalizados por el sistema y estas instituciones les brindan oportunidades para salir adelante. Por medio de Kiva tú también estas cooperando con el desarrollo del país contribuye a darles esta oportunidad.

loans.use: Sale of used clothing and animal breeding

loans.name: Agripina's Group

texts.es:
Agripina, Eulogia and Eugenia belong to the San Miguel de Ayacucho Communal Bank. The associates are from the community that has the same name. It is in a small valley where the majority of the settlers are dedicated to the cultivation of vegetables.

Agripina is married, 44 years old and has 3 children. On the other hand, Eulogia is married, 30 years old and has 2 children. Eugenia lives in a shared home, is 37 years old and has 3 children.

Agripina, Eulogia and Eugenia are dedicated to the cultivation of diverse vegetables, that subsequently they sell wholesale in the supplies market of the city of Ayacucho.

Agripina, Eulogia and Eugenia need loans of 1500 soles, 600 soles, and 600 soles, respectively; money that will be invested in the purchase of agricultural supplements, seeds and remedies to control illnesses.

The dreams of Agripina, Eulogia and Eugenia are that their children become professionals and they improve their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Agripina, Eulogia y Eugenia pertenecen al Banco Comunal San Miguel de Ayacucho, las socias son de la comunidad que tiene el mismo nombre, es un valle pequeño donde la mayoría de sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura de verduras.

Agripina es casada, tiene 44 años y 3 hijos, por otro lado Eulogia es casada, tiene 30 años y 2 hijos, mientras que Eugenia es conviviente, tiene 37 años y 3 hijos.

Agripina, Eulogia y Eugenia se dedican a la agricultura de verduras diversas, que posteriormente venden por mayor en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Agripina, Eulogia y Eugenia necesitan préstamos de 1500 soles, 600 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de abonos, semillas y remedios para controlar las enfermedades.

Los sueños de Agripina, Eulogia y Eugenia son que sus hijos sean profesionales, mejorar sus negocios.

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplements, seeds and remedies to control illnesses for their vegatable crop.

loans.name: Partik

texts.id:
Partik lives with her husband, Purwianto. Purwianto works as a driver. They live in a rented room at Cargo street in Denpasar. Partik opens a food stall thats sells simple rice dishes. Her stall is doing quite good because it is located in a strategic location. Her stall is located at the main route for cargos/ trucks fleet from Java to Bali. However because she only sells limited menu, some of her customers gave her feedback that they want to see more variety in the dishes. Therefore she is hoping to get the loan money to help her to afford more variety in the menu so her business can be expanded.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva volunteer.

Usaha yang dilakukan sehari-hari Partik adalah sebagai penjual nasi. Warung makanan miliknya sudah berdiri sejak beberapa tahun yang lalu, tetapi hingga sekarang belum juga mengalami perkembangan yang menjanjikan. Usaha yang dijalaninya sebenarnya cukup menjanjikan, karena banyak orang yang mampir kewarungnya. Apalagi karena tempatnya sangat strategis, yang merupakan jalur kendaraan kargo dari Jawa. Tetapi karena menu makanannya selalu sama, banyak yang merasa bosan. Oleh karena itu dia sangat mengharapkan mendapat pinjaman untuk nantinya dijadikan modal usahanya, untuk memperbanyak jenis makanan sehingga nantinya semakin banyak pelanggan yang makan diwarungnya. Setiap harinya dia harus berangkat ke Pasar terdekat dengan berjalan kaki. Saat ini, bersama suaminya Purwianto yang bekerja sebagai sopir, Partik tinggal di Jln Cargo Denpasar dengan menyewa kamar bulanan.

loans.use: To add working capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Anthony

texts.es:
Anthony is 24 years old. He is a proactive, single young man. He is currently a student in Management. He is a young person with a business vision. He joined with his mother, señora Oliva, to open their Cevicheria "La Kalesita" which is very crowded because of its good flavors and service. Anthony decided to open this business because he found a good location and because he was thinking about his future. Now he is very content thanks to the support of his family. He would like to continue studying while he runs his business and, above all, to support his mother. However, he would like a better atmosphere and to increase the size of the cevichería. To do this, he has estimated the amount of money he has requested as a loan. Support this young man who demonstrates his desire to keep growing.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Anthony tiene 24 años de edad, es un joven muy proactivo y soltero, pues él en la actualidad es estudiante de Administración. Anthony es un joven con visión de negocio, se asoció con su mamá, la señora Oliva, para poner su Cevicheria de nombre La Kalesita, la que es muy concurrida por su buena sazón y atención. Anthony decidió abrir este negocio debido a encontrarse en una buena zona, motivo que le hizo reflexionar acerca de su futuro, ahora él está muy contento porque gracias al apoyo de su familia. Él quiere mediante su negocio seguir estudiando y sobre todo apoyar a su mamá. Sin embargo él quiere ambientar mejor e implementar su cevichería y para ello estima de una cantidad de dinero que solicita como préstamo. Apoya a este joven que demuestra sus ganas por seguir creciendo.

loans.use: Enlarge and remodel his cevichería to better serve his customers

loans.name: Jenny Giovanna

texts.es:
Jenny works to improve the income of her home. Her earnings as a teacher are not sufficient, so, she saw the opportunity to establish a business selling cosmetics via catalog, which has been an economic source for her son’s studies as he will be starting his professional studies at the university soon, and this is the reason she works so hard. Additionally, Jenny offers her educational services providing private tutoring where she also has the opportunity to sell cosmetics to the mothers of her students. Now she wishes to increase her capital, so she is asking for an 800 soles loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

El trabajo de Jenny es realizado para mejorar la economía de su hogar. Sus ingresos como docente son insuficientes, por lo cual, vio la oportunidad de emprender el negocio de venta de cosméticos por catálogo, el que ha sido un sostén económico para los estudios de su hijo que en poco tiempo iniciará una carrera profesional, esta es la razón de sus esfuerzos. Adicionalmente, Jenny ofrece sus servicios educativos realizando clases particulares donde aprovecha en ofrecer sus cosméticos a las madres de sus alumnos. Ahora desea incrementar su capital de trabajo, para lo cual, solicita un préstamo de 800 soles.

loans.use: Increase capital to buy products.

loans.name: Lesbia Elvira

texts.en:
Lesbia Elvira F. Martínez 37 years old Q3665,- / $500 This is the story of a young woman who, just as so many others, struggles to find her way in life. Perhaps more than for others, her work plays a major role in helping her find her life's direction. This woman is called Lesbia and she lives in the Guatemalan City Prison called Santa Teresa.

I get the opportunity to meet with Lesbia when I accompanied Sergio Roberto Gonzalez, the director of FAPE, on a special day organised by FAPE to teach the women how to run a business. Entering the prison is relatively easy, and the two stamps on my arm ensure that I can rejoin the outside world. Obviously for the women here, it is another story. This facility is a place where most of the inmates await their trial. The slow process of the courts means that some of them have been waiting for more than four years. Sitting together in the prison's enclosed patio area, we begin our chat and Lesbia tells me that she has been there for four years and one month.

Before she began her time in this facility, Lesbia was living in Guatemala City. Her family is from a nearby area called San Miguel Petápa. She is trained as a teacher and has a 20-year-old brother.

In prisons in Guatemala, like many other developing countries, authorities supply only the most basic essentials. Beyond shelter, food and water, the standard of a prisoner's life depends on what their family can provide them with. Items such as clothing, books, and toiletries are all given by the inmate's families. Because Lesbia's mother is ill at the moment and cannot visit her, she has no one but herself to rely on.

Living circumstances within the prison are far from easy. The women live in a single room with 24 other inmates. The beds are made out of concrete. In order to give a semblance of privacy, the prisoners hang sheets between adjacent beds giving each woman has a solitary square metre of her own. Currently there are about 225 people live in the facility.

Last year, students from the University Rafael Landivar (URL) came to the prison and to teach interested inmates how to run a small business. There were courses given in all kinds of business related subjects, such as credit control, writing a business plan, etc. Inspired by the course, Lesbia decided to make all kinds of small decorative items for books and pens by hand. These charming products gave an outlet to Lesbia's talents and a focus to her life while incarcerated. But it has become more than that now.

The course organisers successfully petitioned the facility to allow inmates that performed very well in the course the chance to sell their wares at a market stall in the university for a day. Lesbia was one of those chosen. She tells me with pride how she was able to sell all of her goods, and that it proved to her how well her business could perform in the outside world. The experience has inspired her to pursue her entrepreneurial dream and more than just a distraction from her mundane existence in jail.

In the picture, Lesbia is holding a big bag of her products that she hopes to sell at a local church. I am amazed when she mentions to me that it has taken her only two days to produce so many items. There's nothing else to do in prison, she admits; there are no books, no televisions, and so days are very long there. She focuses her entire life upon her business. In order to work in the evening times, Lesbia had to seek special permission for the use of a lamp. She's even allowed to own a scissors, a necessary item for her work. Privileges like these are only available to women that show that they are dedicated entrepreneurs and participate in all of the offered social programs.

Lesbia initially sold her products to friends that came to visit her in jail. However, since the facility recognises Lesbia's responsible behaviour, they now approve her non-family visitors more readily. This has proved very useful, as Lesbia is now able to use these visits to send out her products to clients as well as to receive materials. Many of her suppliers she has never met in person, only over the phone. It is certainly a challenge to run her business from this facility, but she is able to manage.

Before her business, Lesbia didn't believe that she was very creative. Now, however, she actively seeks out inspiration for new product designs wherever she can. Some of these designs shall be part of the new selection of products that she hopes will be ready in time for Christmas. Lesbia realises very well that her customers like her products, but in order to maintain their interest, she needs to offer them something new and keep her products fresh. A brilliant commercial thinker, if you ask me.

I ask Lesbia if there is something that she wants me to write in her story, and she tells me that she wants to thank FAPE for giving her this life-changing opportunity. She tells me how she knows that funding women in prison may have been seen as a risky investment and that FAPE was the only organisation who thought it worthwhile. Having FAPE believe in them has given her back a large part of her dignity and self esteem.

Towards the end of our interview, when I ask Lesbia about what her dreams are, she becomes a little emotional. She explains to me how being in prison can change a person's way of thinking. She feels that she has grown, spiritually and as a person. Her biggest wish now is to be able to have a little shop somewhere in the city where she can sell not only her own products, but also the products of people that find themselves in situations similar to the ones that she herself faced. Her experiences have taught her much about herself, she tells me, and she hopes that the lessons that she has learned she will be able to teach to others. This is what she is working for now: the new life she wants to build after prison and the credit will help her with this!

loans.use: To buy materails for making handicrafts.

loans.name: Stumai

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 50-year-old Stumai M. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with five children between the ages of 20 years and 30 years old. Stumai has been running a charcoal business since 2003. Charcoal is the primary fuel used for cooking food in Tanzania. Woods are burned in a low-air environment to produce charcoal. Stumai normally buys charcoal from those who produce it wholesale, and she then sells it to customers around her area. Her business is doing very well. She works at the business for nine hours per day, seven days per week; she is assisted by one employee. Stumai currently earns about 500 USD from this business. She is requesting a loan of 850 USD in order to purchase additional stock of charcoal. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Stumai thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit through micro-leasing in Tanzania. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women and uses the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal in bulk

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia sells drinks and pure water and makes popcorn; she has been in this business for the past 3 years. Felicia is 30 years old and married with 2 children. Felicia is business-oriented, that is why she wants to include the sale of foodstuffs to her business.

Felicia needs the loan amount of N100,000 to buy more drinks, pure water, and foodstuffs to sell. This, she said, will increase her productivity and her profit. She is grateful to Kiva lenders for their kind heart and LAPO MICROFINANCE for their business training.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks, pure water, and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Roberto Antonio

texts.es:
El caballero Roberto G. se desempeña en su negocio de venta de abarrotes en el municipio de Chichigalpa de la ciudad de Chinandega. Desde que tiene el negocio  ha logrado llevar el sustento a su hogar mejorando las condiciones de vida de su familia y por este motivo se desempeña laborando arduamente en el negocio.
